Manager Response: Dear bctrip,  As a Marriott Rewards member, we appreciate your loyalty to our brand, and we are glad we could welcome you to the Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. Thank you for the generous compliments on our service and accommodations. Wherever you travel, we seek to offer a calming, reliable experience characterized by our warm hospitality all at an excellent value. It was our pleasure accommodating you and your son, and we hope you will come back and stay with us again soon.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: I stayed here for 4 nights for a band trip in May.  The hotel has nice beds and plenty of space in the main room area, the bathroom, however, is it a bit small.  The hotel to Disneyland is a short walk, along with the rest of the parks.  Room Service did a good job and there wasn't much noise heard throughout the hotel.  Highly recommend staying here if you want a short walk to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Mikaela,  We are delighted you chose to stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort and that our spacious rooms, especially the comfortable beds and room service convenience, enhanced your visit. Thank you for recommending us to future guests for our accessible location to Disneyland, and we hope to welcome you and your friends again on your next trip to the city.  Joy W Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: We stayed in a premium room for 3 nights with a family of 5. The hotel and grounds were extremely clean, the staff was ALWAYS quick and helpful/friendly, the valet service was fast and efficient. The beds were comfy. The room was immaculate. I’m a major germaphobe and I was even comfortable giving my kids baths and letting the toddler run freely. Housekeeping service was good/all towels were restocked daily. This hotel was exactly as we expected. We booked through Costco with a Disneyland package—we just wanted to go for a few days and not break the bank. We were not expecting the Ritz. I have zero complaints. The walk to the entrance of Disneyland is literally less than 10 min and super easy. We did mobile orders from Panera a lot (get their app....and McDonalds too if that’s
Manager Response: Dear shermanfam,  Thank you for choosing us and for taking the time to post a review. We are delighted you had a magical stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort, located right across the street from Disneyland® Resort. Also, it is great to know we met your expectations and that you loved our excellent service and well-appointed accommodations. It was our pleasure accommodating you and your family, and we hope you will make Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort your home away from home whenever your travels bring you to Anaheim. We look forward to your next visit.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: This was a good budget option for a 1&1/2 day trip to Disney. Very basic accommodation. Clean, didn’t have noise issues like some reviewers. Beds were a bit on the harder side. I probably wouldn’t pick this for an extended trip but it was perfect for my needs this time. Panera bread close by, small arcade for the kids.
Manager Response: Dear lisaas365,   Thank you for taking the time to share about your stay. We are always excited to receive positive comments from our guests, but we are also grateful to learn where we can make improvements. We are continually striving to improve our services, and we appreciate your feedback. As part of The Fairfield Guarantee, we hope to have another opportunity to make it right on a future visit. Thank you for choosing us, and we wish you all the best with your travels.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: Late for the review party, but my husband and I had a great stay at the Fairfield the first week of March 2019 for our one year anniversary. We arrived super early and had no trouble finding the hotel. It's best to look for the Panera Bread on Harbor, and then you just turn in there. Don't turn at the McDonalds, its too soon.   We were greeted at the counter with a smile and I so wish I could remember the name of the girl who helped checked us in. She was wonderful and so pleasant. We told her we were staying for our anniversary and if we could check out luggage to the locked storage closet and hop across to Disneyland for the day, since we were purchasing APs. She said she would call when our rooms were ready and we checked our luggage and wandered off to the parks.   We
Manager Response: Dear adormouse,  What a pleasure to be a part of your anniversary here in Anaheim. We are delighted you had a magical stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort, located right across the street from Disneyland Resort. We strive to ensure every guest has a comfortable and relaxing stay, and we will enjoy sharing your compliments with our associates. Thank you for the detailed review and recommendation of your enjoyable experience at our hotel. We look forward to welcoming you both on your next trip soon.  Joy W Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: For an Aussie, American hotels are very simple, they are a room with a bed, a TV and a bathroom and not too much room.  In saying that, the beds were extremely comfy and we had a really good nights sleep each night.  We could step out onto the balcony and watch the fireworks each night.  The pool was warm too!  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  The proximity to the gates at Disneyland is a huge bonus, because you will be doing an awful lot of walking each day at the park!
Manager Response: Dear Ros F,  Thank you for the wonderful review of your stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We are pleased you found our location near Disneyland to be ideal for your vacation. After a long day of rides, parades and making memories, we love that our guests can take a short walk back to our modern rooms to relax and recharge. It was a pleasure having you as our guest; we hope you can come and vacation with us again soon.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: I stayed here with a large group for just over a week and there were four of us girls in the room.  We had plenty of room and the layout of the bathroom was great with the vanity and basin separate from the shower.  There was plenty of storage for clothes and luggage.  The shop/pizza hut/cafe area on the third floor was a great spot to chill with others from the group. Very happy the cafe sold wine.  There is a great gym and play room for children.  The pool is heated and a nice area to chill.  Disneyland is an easy walk away.  There is also plenty of food choices close by.  The cleaning staff were very efficient and did an excellent job with our room given how much stuff we had in it.
Manager Response: Dear Lini999,  Thank you for the excellent review of your group stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We appreciate you mentioning how much you enjoyed the plentiful food and beverage options with Pizza Hut Express®, Seattle's Best Coffee and Panera located right here at our resort. Also, we are pleased to read that you loved your spacious room and our courteous associates. It was our pleasure hosting you, and we hope to be your home whenever you all are in the area.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: Booked two rooms, high floor, quiet room.  Arrived too early to check in but bags stored and off to Disney, five minute walk.  Returned for check in about 6:30 which was quick and painless. Initially disappointed when given main floor 144/145 for our rooms by the pool. BUT! We ended up loving the location.  Closest to the park making it the shortest walk.  No elevator to wait for. Saw the fireworks from just outside and to the right of our room.  Pool closed at 10:00, no walkers by our room after, no noise.  Lovely air conditioning fan provided a steady white noise if set, which we loved! Beds are comfy, selection of pillows. Water hot and plentiful. Fridge, free coffee in room and a safe.  Infused water in lobby to fill your water bottles. Helpful staff always smiling.
Manager Response: Dear ivanhoe,  Thank you for choosing us and for taking the time to post your awesome review. We are delighted you had a magical stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort, located right across the street from Disneyland® Resort. It was our pleasure accommodating you, and we hope you will make Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort your home away from home whenever your travels bring you to Anaheim.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: Our family of 5 enjoyed this hotel. The staff was SO nice--everything was ready for us at the front desk (we ordered Disney Tickets + hotel through Costco). Our room had enough space for 5 of us and was cleaned well every day. The walk to Disney was easy and there was convenient food along the way--Panera, McDonalds, a taco place, etc.The Wifi worked great; the walls are thin as far as noise barriers, thus the 4 stars.
Manager Response: Dear G6879MGlisap,   Thank you for the excellent review of your family stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We are pleased you found our location near Disneyland to be ideal for your vacation. After a long day of rides, parades and making memories, we love that our guests can take a short walk back to our modern rooms to relax and recharge. It was a pleasure having your family with us; we hope you can come and vacation with us again soon.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager, Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: Clear firework view from north side of hotel
Summary: I have mixed feelings about our stay here. Family of 4 with 2 teens. Very clean. Super easy to entrance of Disneyland - maybe 5 mins walk. Nice to have Panera on property for necessary morning coffee and easy breakfast. Parking was $21 for 1st car and $31 for 2nd (needed 2 cars so that was REALLY steep and unexpected to have the 2nd car be more.) A few hotels in the area do offer free parking - admittedly not many - and continental breakfast, so the price for the room in comparison seemed a little steep given all the extra charges and nothing special about the hotel amenities. Staff was very accommodating and pleasant. We stayed here because my sister made reservations through Costco, so we made direct reservations with Fairfield. Probably would look for something a little more
Manager Response: Dear peacelovejava,  Thank you for the review of your stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We are pleased you found our location near Disneyland to be ideal for your vacation. It was a pleasure having you and your family as our guest, and we hope you can come and vacation with us again soon.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, checked in Friday the 26th through Monday the 30th. We flew in from Phoenix. As we were walking through the airport I received a call from the 714 area code and answered, it was the hotel asking what time we will be checking in and if we would give up our standard king for a premium room with 2 queens, we said yes. We ended up on the 8th floor, we could see most of California Adventure. Our room was Disney themed, clean and spacious. Our only problem was our first night after checking in we had dinner reservations and when we went to leave I always check to make sure door locked, our door would not lock. Ended up calling the front desk and they sent maintenance up and had to change out the motor. We missed out dinner reservations so just went
Manager Response: Dear PhoenixPhoenician,   Thank you for revisiting the Fairfield Inn by Marriott Anaheim Resort. We are delighted you choose to visit us again due to our unbeatable location close to Disneyland. After a long day of rides, parades and making memories, we love that our guests can take a short walk back to our modern rooms to relax and recharge. However, we regret the inconvenience you faced with the room door, and have shared your comments with the maintenance team to perform pre-check in the rooms. Thank you again for your compliments, and we look forward to hosting you back.   Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: An easy place to stay - a handy location where you are well looked after
Summary: When you book online you never quite know what you'll get when you arrive. There was nothing to worry about with this hotel. The staff were very friendly and responsive. We used the early check in and late check out which avoided all the stress of filling in 6 hours before you can be in/after you have left your room. The rooms aren't large but we had two connecting queen rooms so there was plenty of room for four of us. The TVs were large enough that even the teens in our party were impressed (not that we turned them on much). The beds are good quality - a bit firmer than I am used to but I didn't notice after a couple of days. There pillows were great. The shower pressure and hot water was good.The rooms were serviced regularly and to a good standard. Our rooms were at the back
Manager Response: Dear Deidre F,   We are delighted you had a great time at Fairfield Inn by Marriott Anaheim Resort. It is always our goal to provide you with a worry-free stay with through our friendly service and comfortable accommodations. We are also happy that you found our location to be convenient. Thank you so much for your detailed feedback, and we hope you are already planning another trip our way.  Joy W Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: My husband and I stayed at this property for a few days after visiting family in Honolulu. I got sick in Hawaii (a cold) which turned worse once I got off the plane at LAX. We booked a king park view room through Costco. Our room was ready for us when we checked in. All of our documents were ready at the front desk as well. The room was on the sixth floor and faced south so we could see the California Adventure rides, but weren't able to see the fireworks at night. The room was nice, quiet and relaxing. The bed was very comfortable.  Overnight, my illness got worse and had to go to a walk in clinic the next day. The valet happily called a car service for us who came quickly and picked us up at the end of my doctor visit. The driver even took me to a pharmacy (CVS) so I could
Manager Response: Dear krand1276,  We hope you are feeling better now. Thank you for choosing Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort and for taking the time to write a review despite your condition. It was a pleasure reading that you loved not only our hospitality and comfortable accommodations but also our attentive staff and excellent location close to all that Anaheim has to offer. Moreover, we are glad that our valet assisted you with transportation in such a difficult time. Thank you for the gracious rating, and we look forward to welcoming you soon.  Joy W Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: We enjoyed our stay of 6 nights here--took us 10 minutes to walk from the lobby to security at a medium pace.  Very doable.  The beds were very comfortable, rooms clean.  They could use a magnifying make-up mirror and it was hard to get the room really dark at night.  Our room was very spacious.  My biggest complaint was the motion-sensing bathroom light!  Kept going out while I was in the shower and I would have to wave my arms outside the curtain to get it to kick back on!  And it would do this several times during a single shower.  A big irritation!
Manager Response: Dear LovesBritain,  It was a pleasure to read your review of Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We are glad to know you enjoyed your fresh, spotless room and comfortable bed. However, we are sorry for the inconvenience you had due to our in-room amenities. We would love to welcome you back the next time you are in the area.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel for a Disney Holiday
Summary: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn for 5 nights for the purpose of visiting Disneyland.  The hotel caters perfectly for this.  Our rooms were very clean, functional and beds comfortable.  We had a great view of Disneyland and could watch the fireworks from our balcony.  I appreciated that there were 2 washer/dryers on each level.  The staff were so friendly, polite and professional- making us feel very welcome. Definitely recommend for families. Thank you Fairfield Inn and Staff for a perfect stay.
Manager Response: Dear lauracE6653HA,  Thank you for the excellent review of your stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We are pleased you found our location near Disneyland to be ideal for your vacation. After a long day of rides, parades and making memories, we love that our guests can take a short walk back to our modern rooms to relax and recharge. We appreciate you recommending us to others and look forward to your return visit.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel.  We stayed for 4 nights recently while visiting Disney.  Every employee that we encountered was very friendly and helpful.  We had a double room and it was very clean and spacious.  Housekeeping was great, our room was always cleaned early.  They have good coffee in the room.  The beds are comfortable.  We had a Disney facing room and a great view of the fireworks.  The walk is very quick and easy, just a few minutes.  There are other hotels between here and Disney, but they do not look as nice.  This is back from the road and feels very secure as there is someone monitoring all vehicles coming in.  The market area on the 3rd floor is convenient.  I will definitely stay here again for Disney.
Manager Response: Dear 857jillk  Thank you for the excellent review of your stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We are pleased you found our location near Disneyland to be ideal for your vacation. After a long day of rides, parades and making memories, we love that our guests can take a short walk back to our modern rooms to relax and recharge. Also, we are glad you enjoyed our staff and comfortable room and look forward to seeing you and your family soon.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: Very comfortable and great location to Disneyland
Summary: This is a great hotel if you are going to Disneyland Anaheim.  The beds are incredibly comfortable and pillows are great.  We shared a twin room with 2 kids very comfortably.  It's a 5 minute walk to the front door of Disneyland.  The pool is great but uses recycled water.  The pool towels are small though.  The staff are amazing.  There are however no close supermarkets so order a delivery from aldi or vons.  Just make sure you are at the hotel to take delivery as the hotel cannot accept it on your behalf.  There is a great bread shop for pastries next door and a macdonalds on the other side.  There are a number of restaurants near by also.  If you need gluten free then head to pizza press. When ordering food and buying be careful as the prices shown are not inclusive and you
Manager Response: Dear Helen G,  Thank you for choosing Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort and for the kind review about our staff, pool as well as the room. Our ideal location provides our guests with an effortless way to enjoy all that Anaheim has to offer. We are pleased to know you could take advantage of this, and we look forward to welcoming you and your family again soon.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: Booked the Fairfield months ago through a travel company for my wife’s birthday trip to Disneyland.  I chose it because we had stayed there multiple times before and never had a bad experience.  Definitely not the case this time.  Note the picture of the reservation.  It clearly states that I reserved a King Deluxe room.  This is the same room I have had for many trips to Disneyland due to its view of the fireworks from the balcony. When I checked in, I was told I had a first floor room looking at the parking lot with two queen beds.  I explained that that was not what I payed for but the clerk said that they were over booked and this was what they had available.  I was not given a refund for the inconvenience or price difference.  Instead,  I got to look at the parking lot and
Manager Response: Dear DCH50,  Thank you for choosing us during your travels to Disneyland and for sharing your feedback. We appreciate you bringing these issues to our attention, and we sincerely apologize for not being able to provide the room you had requested due to availability. We have shared your feedback with our management team, and invite you to contact us directly at the hotel so that we can look into this matter further. Thank you again for being our recent guest, and we hope you will consider giving us another opportunity to regain your trust the next time you visit our area.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Great place for high school band trip
Summary: Very nice place to take a group of kids.  Lots of space and convenient.  Breakfast buffet very good and spacious dining area.  Rooms nice and clean.  Small bar downstairs also a plus, with great service.  Close to restaurants, convenience stores and of course, Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Darwin U,  Thank you for choosing Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort for your high school trip. We are pleased to know you enjoyed our delicious breakfast and found our location to be perfect for your needs. We look forward to welcoming you all again in the near future.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: Whilst the motel and close to the park, the rooms are very basic but not facilities ie kettle or microwave so heating bottles for our two yr old was a hassle.  The reason for the rubbish rating is that I was travelling with another family and between our booking and theirs the motel currently has around $4000 dollars of of money due to overcharging. We met with the accounts person multiple times and after multiple promises is yet to return the funds. During our stay of trying to sort this, 3x other families were at the front reception arguing about the same issues. Absolute disgrace and never again.
Manager Response: Dear Boon_Tree,   Thank you for providing your feedback. We are sorry that it is taking so long and regret that it was caused in the first place. Appropriate training has taken place to prevent this from occurring in the future.   Joy W. Guest Relations Manager

Summary Heading: Easy walk to Disney, CA Adventure and Downtown Disney
Summary: At first we were a bit concerned as it is a Motel, but the staff was very friendly and the rooms were fine - a standard three star Motel.  On the third level they have a Pizza Hut and a Seattle Best Coffee.  Downstairs they have a gift shop.  From certain rooms you can see the fireworks from Disney.  The walk to the park is their best feature.  There are many restaurants around the hotel.  They have both self parking and valet parking.  They do have an outdoor swimming pool.  Enjoy!
Manager Response: Dear LindaKayC,   Thank you for staying at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We are glad you enjoyed many aspects of our hotel and that our location near Disneyland was ideal for you. It was a pleasure having you as our guest, and we look forward to seeing you and your family soon.   Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: This was a great hotel. The staff didn't look at me like i was crazy when i asked for a lower floor room, i hate elevators. They asked me a few times if the second floor was fine after hearing about it. About a 5 min walk to the park, longer with the blisters. Lol. Nice and roomy with a comfy bed. The only downside is i wish there was a continental breakfast. I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Pattie W,   We appreciate you letting us know our team went over and above during your visit. This kind of service is all part of the Fairfield Guarantee, where everything goes as expected, or we'll make it right; it's that simple. It was a pleasure having you as our guest, and we look forward to seeing you again.   Joy W. Guest Relations Manager, Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: We recently stayed here for 5 nights while taking Disneyland by storm. We had a great room overlooking the park. The room was clean and comfortable, nicely decorated, and roomy enough for the 5 of us (2 adults, 3 kids 10 and under). The beds were very comfortable and we got a good night's sleep. Although it was rarely on, the large t.v. was appreciated!  The staff we encountered were all very nice and welcoming. As long-time SPG Gold members, we weren't sure what to expect from a Marriott property. (This is our first stay post-merger). We were pleasantly surprised. The service was excellent.   The place is a 5 to 10 minute walk to the Disney gates. (We timed it....did it in 5 minutes one day walking at a pretty good clip, and another day sauntered over and it took us about 9
Manager Response: Dear Alison5280,  Thank you for the excellent review of your stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. Our ideal location provides our guests with an effortless way to enjoy all that Anaheim has to offer, and we are glad it was perfect for you. Also, it is great to read that you were impressed with your clean & comfortable room and our courteous associates. We look forward to your next stay, and until then, we wish you and your family safe travels.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: I stayed here recently for two nights while I went to Disneyland. I've stayed at other Fairfield Inns a couple of times, so this one met my expectations. The room was clean and large enough, and it came with a refrigerator. The refrigerator and the doorless clothes closet were more or less part of the space containing the sink; a room containing the rest of the bathroom was next to this area, with a door protecting privacy. So that entire arrangement was a bit unusual but worked fine for my solo stay.   The room had enough outlets for the usual devices and enough lamps to be well-lit at night. My only complaint with the room is that the ventilation came from a rather loud machine underneath the window. The room supplied a free pair of earplugs; I had my own, and you'll need
Manager Response: Dear Soxfan667,  Thank you for choosing us and for taking the time to post a review. We are delighted you had a magical stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort, located right across the street from Disneyland® Resort. It was our pleasure accommodating you, and we hope you will make Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort your home away from home whenever your travels bring you to Anaheim. We look forward to your next visit.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: Still waiting to get a room and a horrible experience already
Summary: Front desk has no idea what they’re doing and although they say rooms aren’t ready and have luggage check as an option, of course it’s full and they tell us to keep our luggage in the car. But don’t worry, it’s safe here (they say). I should’ve stayed at the courtyard Marriott next door which I love.
Manager Response: Dear Q9948SLcarolinem,   Thank you for the review and for choosing our hotel. We are disappointed knowing you had difficulties during check in, and we apologize for not being responsive to your needs. We strive to provide an outstanding experience to all our guests, and we are disappointed that we let you down. We appreciate the valuable feedback and hope you will give us a second chance to make a better impression.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This hotel is wonderful. It is only a five minute walk to Disneyland and the staff are fantastic.  This hotel has a little convenient store inside the Pizza Hut area that you can purchase things and make on the spot with a microwave that they have available. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear pattyd308,  Thank you for taking the time to share that your stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort was perfect in every way. We appreciate you mentioning how much you enjoyed the plentiful food and beverage options with Pizza Hut Express®, Seattle's Best Coffee and Panera located right here at our resort. We are grateful for your recommendation and hope to be your home whenever you are in the area.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: Closer to Disney to some of their own hotels
Summary: The clerks at check in were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were immaculate with very comfortable beds. The walk to the Disney parks was minimal, closer than some of their onsite accommodations. After a short walk  IHOP and Dennys are right at the crosswalk to the parks for a quick breakfast. McDonalds and Panera are passed on your way back to the hotel. Don't be disappointed to be on the ground floor (away from the pool), you miss the huge lines at the elevator after fireworks, parade, etc.
Manager Response: Dear Jodi R,  Thank you for the excellent review of your stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We are pleased you found our location near Disneyland to be ideal for your plans. It was a pleasure having you as our guest; we hope you can come and vacation with us again soon!  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: This was the perfect location - right across the road from Disney (5 Minute walk to the gate) We stayed here late Oct so we could experience Halloween at Disneyland. Even walking back to the hotel around midnight we felt safe there were so many people waking to their hotels along the street. Will recommend this hotel to anyone who's visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Erica S,  Thank you for the excellent review of your stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort and for your recommendation. We are pleased you found our location near Disneyland to be ideal for your plans. It was our pleasure hosting you, and we hope to be your home whenever you are in the area.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: You really cannot do better than this hotel if trying to stay near Disneyland
Summary: Admittedly, I've browsed through most of the reviews about this hotel in the past and shied away from staying here.  I've also stayed at a few other Motels right across the way who had much better reviews and I hated my experience.  After staying here the last several times for my annual pass usage at Disneyland, this is far and away the best hotel across Harbor Blvd that I have stayed in.  Obviously, everyone values everything differently.  Take for example, the way the room faces.  On my first visit, I stayed facing fireworks and that was nice.  However on my second visit, I did NOT splurge extra for the 'Premium' view and was given a room facing the highway on the opposite end of the property.  BEST THING that could have happened to me.  Rooms are quiet enough to where you
Manager Response: Dear jzguru,  Thank you so much for this awesome review of Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. We are delighted you had a magical stay and that you found our location near Disneyland to be ideal for your Disney trip. It was our pleasure accommodating you, and we hope to welcome you again soon.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: This hotel was chosen mainly for the location and based on reviews.  Overall we had a nice stay, but there was nothing that really stood out that would make me say it was memorable. We had more interaction with the parking attendant by the Panera Bread then the front desk staff. A little hello when stepping off the elevator or welcome back when returning from a long day is a nice touch that we missed here. Our room was well equipped, clean, beds comfortable, hot water never an issue, elevator was quick to come.  The market place on the third floor was convenient, but I will say that you are best to avoid the pizza.  $19 a day to park is crazy but expected for the area. The valet staff were always running around working hard. We needed our car out at 4:30 am for a flight and had
Manager Response: Dear RCMommy,  Thank you for sharing a review regarding your recent stay. It is always exciting to receive positive comments from our guests, and we are glad that you were able to enjoy our refreshed, comfortable accommodations, as well as our excellent location. We also appreciate learning from detailed comments such as yours, and apologize for not being at our best while you were here. We hope to have another opportunity to make it right on a future visit, and wish you all the best with your travels.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager

Summary: This was our first stay at the Fairfield Inn and probably our last. Our vacation started out great with being able to check in early because of an early flight. The front desk employees were so kind. Our room was clean and the hotel gift shop had everything you could ever need. The hotel was super close to the park and we easily walked every day. Also super close to restaurants.  The biggest downfall was that after spending a long day at Mickey’s house we came back to find our door propped open, and who knows how long it had been left open. It freaked me out so bad. We immediately called the front desk and they asked if we wanted Security to come to our room. After an inspection we found everything how we left it, but it just left us with a feeling of unease. The manager on duty
Manager Response: Dear disneylover6,  Please accept our sincere apologies for the issues you experienced while staying with us. We take the safety and security of our guests very seriously, so we are sorry this happened during your stay and worked to restore your trust as evidenced by our team’s response. If we can be of any additional assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out to us. Again, we are very sorry this incident happened.   Adam Kulikowski FRONT OFFICE MANAGER

Summary: Typical Fairfield.  Clean rooms, comfortable beds.  Not a full service hotel but you know that going in.  No better location for Disney.  5 minute walk to walkway to main gate.  Could not be more convenient.  Staff is super nice and always helpful.  Services around the hotel make it the perfect value.  Panera and McDonald's 2 minute walk.  Many good restaurants within 15 minutes including Downtown Disney.  Recommend 5th rooftop bar, Anaheim packing district, ballast Point.  So many choices.
Manager Response: Dear John D,  Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay. Your review was a pleasure to read, and we were delighted to learn that the service provided by our associates surpassed your expectations. We will enjoy sharing your compliments with our team to recognize them for a job well done. Thanks again, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.   Joy W Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: It cannot be overstated how perfect the location is, however the service provided was equal. I asked for some odd requests and they were granted. We even lucked out with a Matterhorn view.  We didn't get to use the pool but the arcade was a nice bonus.... Even for us adults.
Manager Response: Dear imisslincecum,   We are delighted we met your expectations! Our highest priority is making sure every guest has a relaxing experience in clean, comfortable accommodations, and we're glad we made that happen for you. Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your comments. We hope to welcome you again soon!  Joy W Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay Near Disney
Summary: We stayed here for five nights with no issues.  The walk to Disney couldn't get much closer. It is maybe a five minute walk from out the doors to the street to cross.  The Anaheim Garden Walk, CVS, Walgreens, etc. are about a 15 minute walk max. We went to Walgreens a couple time to get some snacks and drinks.  Every staff member we encountered was friendly. Check in was quick and efficient. The pool area was nice and although it wasn't hot outside, we were able to enjoy it every afternoon as it was a good temperature. Pool towels are tiny so I recommend getting one from the room.  Room was clean and newly renovated. The only thing that still looked slightly dated was the bathroom door. There was a sliding door to block off the beds from the counter/fridge/sink area which was
Manager Response: Dear CSquared31,   Thank you for choosing Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort and for the kind review. Our ideal location provides our guests with an effortless way to enjoy all that Anaheim has to offer. We are pleased to know you could take advantage of this, and we hope to welcome you again soon.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: All staff were friendly and welcoming- car parking attendant, valets, front desk etc.   Rooms spacious and good facilities. Noisy heater which did keep waking me up through night but was far too cold without it on.   Shower curtain blocks light/makes it claustrophobic.   Free WiFi   Few minutes walk from Disney   Lots of restaurants nearby   Helped with car hire from another hotel   Onsite Pizza Hut and mini shop
Manager Response: Dear katie2686,   Thank you for your review regarding your stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort. It is a pleasure to know we were able to exceed your expectations. We strive to ensure every guest has a comfortable and relaxing stay, and we will enjoy sharing your compliments with our associates. You're our #1 priority, and we are committed to this promise! Thank you again for your feedback, and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to Anaheim.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary Heading: Decent hotel, good location for Disney.
Summary: Our family stayed here for a Disneyland trip in February. We knew we wouldn’t be in the room much so we mainly booked this for its close proximity to Disney. It wasn’t bad but I’d probably try another hotel on harbor next time. I was torn between a 3 or 4 star review for this hotel but a few things brought the overall score down.   The good: location to Disneyland (about a 7 minute walk total), very comfortable beds, super clean with excellent housekeeping, friendly staff especially the luggage storage person, convenient cafe/food store on the 3rd floor, nice room decor especially the new flooring, nice view of Disneyland from our 8th floor room. The TV set up is also really nice for you to be able to steam your kids favorite shows easily from the TV.   The  not so good: super
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us following your recent visit to Anaheim. We are disappointed to hear your stay did not live up to expectations, and we appreciate you letting us know. We will be sure to discuss the situation you experienced with the water bottle in your car with our Valet staff. Should your travels bring you back to our area, we hope to have the opportunity to improve upon your experience.

Summary: We stayed here in February and loved the clean rooms, the restaurant was convenient and yummy, we especially loved the non-carpet floors and sliding bathroom door to keep the light low when getting ready. Right across the street from Disneyland, we had a ticket mishap (must mention any Disney deals at counter!) and Carmen at the front desk helped us out with the mistake and was patient, kind, and never made us feel like we were not important. We would definitely recommend this hotel!!
Manager Response: Dear Xtinamurray,   Thank you for choosing us and for taking the time to post a review. We are delighted you had a magical stay at Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort, located right across the street from Disneyland® Resort. It was our pleasure accommodating you, and we hope you will make Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort your home away from home whenever your travels bring you to Anaheim! We look forward to your next visit.  Joy W. Guest Relations Manager Fairfield by Marriott Anaheim Resort

Summary: The hotel was nice but it is a hotel for families attending a Disneyland. I attended as part of a group 12, and we ALL agreed that it was EXTREMELY NOISY at night.   The hotel staff was nice, the rooms were clean, and the amenities were modern.   All that being said, I wouldn't stay again due to the noise and family crowds.
Manager Response: We are very disappointed to read of your negative experience at our hotel in regards to noise. We pride ourselves on providing our guests with a magical experience and your comments are concerning to us. We hope to have another opportunity to improve upon your visit in the future.

Summary Heading: Nothing more than lipstick on a pig. Avoid.
Summary: I may not be the audience for this hotel. I generally don't stay at hotels that look like dumpy motels and I avoid hotels with pools that are fenced and have a sign that say 'don't drink the water' - but I decided to stay here because it was very close to the parks. It's about a 7 minute walk.  The hotel is a dump. It has been painted, and the staff are friendly, but honestly its a crappy old motel that has been given a crappy 'ramsay's kitchen nightmares-esque' makeover. You know what i mean, it looks cheap.  I stayed at this hotel for a whopping 5 hours and then called the Marriott Gold-Elite line and said 'i'm getting out of here.. never again'  and let me explain why.  The rooms don't have walls. They have paper-thin cardbboard disguised as walls. Don't believe me? Ask
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking the time to share your honest feedback with us. We're disappointed to hear that you did not experience the kind of five-star stay that we strive to provide all of our guests. We appreciate your sharing all of your constructive input.

Summary: I had a great stay! I had one of the premium rooms with a theme park view. Rooms seemed recently renovated. Very close walk to the parks (5-10 mins) and there’s a McDonald’s and Panera out front that was very convenient. All the staff I interacted with were friendly. Would recommend and plan to stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Barely 3 Dots. Location is the saving grace. Oh, and Cockroaches...
Summary: It's unfortunate that this Fairfield isn't in better shape.  The location is wonderful and the parking is reasonable.  The staff is friendly and helpful, but that's about where the positives end.    First off, we were told over the phone that the first night of parking was included, only to be informed that that was not correct when we arrived.  Not cool and felt like a bait and switch.  Second, the rooms were pretty shabby.  Not sure why this happens, as they probably are making money hand over fist considering their proximity to the park.  They should be sold out most nights if not every weekend.  Again, just my assumption, but maybe put some more funding into upkeep.  There was rust in the bathtub, which made me very hesitant to give my kids a much needed bath after a long
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We do apologize for your experience during your time with us. We strive to provide top notch service to all of our guests, and we're sorry to hear about these issues that you encountered during your stay. We have shared this review with our team as a learning experience, and to ensure these matters are addressed right away. We hope to have the chance to provide you with a 5-star experience on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Fantastic location being less than 10-minute easy walk to Disneyland parks and lots of places to eat in walking distance, Mcdonald was right next to the hotel which was very useful. Rooms were a great size for a family of 5 and were very clean. All staff at the hotel were extremely helpful. Only negative, you could hear quite a bit of noise of outside and the market place did not have many options and was overpriced.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We’ve always hoped we could stay here if we ever came back to Disneyland ... and now we have! It is only a short walk to the Disney Parks with the convenience of a few good restaurants within a couple of blocks from the hotel. Staff were friendly and ready to help make our stay more comfortable at all times. The rooms, although a little small, were clean and housekeeping did a great job refreshing it each day. The outdoor hot tub unfortunately ALWAYS seemed crowded.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean and Close to the Parks 🎉
Summary: We stayed at the Fairfield in from 2/2-2/4. It was a epically rainy weekend at Disneyland!   The team at Fairfield was very welcoming and polite. It seemed as though people were constantly mopping and cleaning the floors and lobby. They managed to keep it sparkling even with all of the guests sloshing in and out.  The walk to the parks is quick -we like to take a break during the day so it was perfect for us (about 5 minutes).   There is a Pizza Place (I think Pizza Hut) and Market in the hotel.  Panera and McDonalds are a parking lot walk away from the rooms.  Crazy people swam in the outdoor heated pool and hot tub. They seemed to have fun!  We had been recommended the hotel and would stay there again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland maingate.  There is a Mimi's Cafe, Panera and McDonalds within a 2 minute walk and the hotel has a small cafe with the basics....the wine was even pretty decent.  The one downfall is that the rooms are extremely noisy.  I could hear the street all night, our neighbors shower and every airplane that flew above us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean and kept up. Not dated.Charge for parking, no free brakefast.Pool and hot tub are nice, kids love them.Free cups of water in lobby, No coffee.House keeping likes to give decaf instead of regular, sucks when you have 4 newdecaf pouches every time.Very Short walk to Disney.Long lines at the elevators.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here 5 nights while visiting Disneyland. Will stay here again anytime. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping where the greatest. Great little store. The pizza hut was hot and good. The scoter rental was a fair price and saved us from walking all day long in the park. Can’t say enough about how great our stay was.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a comfortable inn with a Pizza Hut inside it along with microwaves in the dining area o the 2nd floor.  Every morning, we would walk out and pass the Panera and then the McDonald Restaurants.  It's like a 10 minute walk to the gates of Disney.  There is a swimming pool that is small, but the kids still loved to cool off after a hot summer day at Disneyland.  Everyone there was really nice, and check-in and check-out were both a breeze!  There is a little souvenir shop inside also.  This is a great value for a decent/average hotel with a pool that is in prime location for Disney fun!  We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Starting with the valets out front, everyone was extremely welcoming and made you feel at home. The hotel was nicely renovated since our last visit. The housekeeping staff did a great job and kept our rooms spotless. Having the Pizza Hut on the third floor for reasonably priced breakfast sandwiches and good coffee is a bonus!   The best part about this hotel is the short walk to the Disneyland gate which is a huge bonus after walking all day.  The only negative is charging $20 a day for parking.  :( We definitely will return next year.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved this location to Disneyland as we spend a portion of our afternoons around the pool Which was also nice...the short walk made it doable.  However, we found the room small w the 5 of us...aadaquate but tight.  Overall a good experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family of 4 adults stayed here for 10 days and had a fantastic time. It is a great location if you're walking to and from Disneyland, especially if you don't want to spend the entire day in the park. The pool and  hot tub are small, but it was never too crowded for us. The room was always nice and clean. There is a store selling souvenirs, snacks and alcohol which was convenient. It is also walking distance to different restaurants (McDonald's, Denny's, Panera bread). I would stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We often stay at Marriott properties but chose this one due to its proximity to Disneyland. We walked to and from the parks in <5 minutes, and on the days the parks were open late, loved being able to return to our room in the afternoon for a nap on the comfy bed, then go back for fireworks or Fantasmic in the evenings. Note that this Fairfield does not serve breakfast.  There’s a “market” with a Pizza Hut express, breakfast foods, wine, etc. and microwaves on the 3rd floor but I found it a bit pricy for a yogurt and a bruised banana. There’s a Panera right in front of the hotel where you can mobile order for quick pickup, and also a McDonalds where I sometimes picked up yogurt parfaits in the evening and put in our fridge for a quick breakfast the next day.  If you arrive
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great prices, location and friendly staff
Summary: This is a good place for kids and very reasonable given closeness to Disneyland. It’s a property that’s showing it’s age, mostly through design and functionality. Noise didn’t seem bad given building design. A/C units blow air like crazy. Just don’t get a room next to the elevator shaft as it’s very loud. If you do, ask for free parking or something.
Manager Response: none

Summary: From the moment we arrived we received fantastic service. Valet parking was superb. The staff were friendly and professional. Check in was fast and the front desk staff friendly. The room was near some construction but had no noise disturbance whatsoever. The rooms have been renovated and were clean and very nice. The beds we're comfortable and the wood floors were a nice touch. Nice pool and hot tub however it rained so we couldn't use it this time. It was less than 7 min walk to Disneyland front gates. This was perfect after a long day at the parks. They had a small gift shop which had rain ponchos with Mickey Mouse on them. How convenient for us and not very expensive either. Hotel is perfectly located to Disneyland, restraunts and Highway. We would stay here again in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Located just across and down the street from the entrance to Disneyland, this is an affordable alternative to staying on Disney property.  Everyone who works the front desk is very knowledgeable and helpful.  Nice size rooms.  Laundry facility located on each floor.  Panera is located at the front of this property, and McDonald's just next door.  Five minute walk to the Disney gates.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Marriott service hurting here, the account data breach is effecting all
Summary: Hi, A very old property, always a line in front as they only had 1 person manning the front desk.  Poor staff communication and a run down feel overall. I mention the data breach only because now to make a reservation takes a lot longer and they blame the customers for issues like false bookings.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us following your recent visit to Anaheim. We are disappointed to hear your stay did not live up to expectations, and we appreciate you letting us know. We will be sure to discuss the issues you experienced with our staff and leadership. Should your travels bring you back to our area, we hope to have the opportunity to improve upon your experience.

Summary: We stayed there for several nights while visiting DCA and Disneyland.  We walked back and took nap on long day at parks. The rooms were nice.  They moved us when room was noisy. Helped us with Uber arrangements.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Can’t stay much closer to Disneyland!!!
Summary: In November, we spent three days at Disneyland with our kids and their 11 month old And 3 yr old Disney nut. We stayed here on combined package with Disney travel and it worked perfectly. We were not able to get in Roos until 4pm, which seldom happens. We wasted a couple of hours waiting while kids went onto the park. We received room on 8th floor with view of park and fireworks, which were weather cancelled. Rooms were king premium and were nice. We walked over and back each day which was about five blocks total. Never had to move cars. Worked out great for this kind of visit where we were in park 12-15 hrs a day.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're delighted to hear that you loved our views and guest rooms. We do apologize for the delay getting into your room and we appreciate all of your feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: I was hesitant when I saw the style of the hotel but upon entering the room I was relieved! It was clean, beds were comfortable and it was surprisingly quiet. It was a great place to stay to explore Disneyland and was only about a 10 minute walk to downtown Disney between the 2 parks. The Disney Express bus stop is about a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Very happy with my stay there. Just don’t expect room service and a bar with a view.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review, Andrea. We're happy to see that you found your room comfortable and our location convenient, and we appreciate your feedback as well. We hope to host you again in the future for a 5-star visit.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, hard to find with GPS
Summary: Stayed 3 nights for a recent conference at the convention center. Received an upgraded room to 7th floor Park View. I would not recommend paying for this type of room because the Park View was a bit underwhelming; it was more like parking lot view. While this hotel is right across the street from the noise of Disneyland, I found the room to actually be comfortably quiet and was able to sleep uninterrupted through the night (they did provide free earplugs in the room if needed). Contrary to most Marriott properties, this hotel does NOT have a complimentary breakfast; however, there is a Panera Bread in the same parking lot so that was convenient. All hotels in this area charge for parking so be prepared to spend about $20/day for parking. The floor in the hotel room is wood
Manager Response: Thank you for this detailed review! We're so happy to see that you enjoyed your time with us, and that our team made your stay special. We appreciate your feedback as well, and will share this with the team for review. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we hope to have the chance to host you again!

Summary: Okay, another trip to the West Coast, and a two centre vacation comprising of five days in Anaheim and five in Las Vegas. The two pair together well and we find that visiting them in this order (Disneyland first, Vegas second) is the best combination. March to the schedule-heavy and organised timetable of a Disney fest in the first instance and use Las Vegas to chill out at a more relaxed pace to decompress before heading home.  So, Anaheim. After trying a few alternatives in recent years, we returned to the Fairfield Inn by Marriott on Harbor Blvd, you can’t get too much closer to Disneyland at reasonable rates and, a little out of season, post Halloween and pre-thanksgiving, the competitive deal we got with British Airways Holidays was an excellent proposition.  After a ten
Manager Response: What a wonderful review, Nigel! Thank you for taking the time to share such detailed feedback. We appreciate this recommendation and we hope to host you again in the future.

Summary: We spent three days on a last minute trip to Disney.  Great location.  Short walking distance to the park.  Nice having Panera Bread nearby for a quick breakfast.  We were given a nice resort view room, which we could see the Disney fireworks nightly from outside our door.  Staff was extremely nice and friendly and very helpful.  Enjoyed our stay there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us! We're delighted to hear you had a lovely stay and are happy to know our staff took excellent care of you. We can't wait to welcome you back for another visit in the future.

Summary: I spent five days and four nights here for a conference at the convention center. The room was well appointed with 2 queen beds  and a large TV. The rooms had thin walls. My room was facing the freeway so it was quite noisy even in the evening. They do provide earplugs, but these were not sufficient. The hotel was about 1.0 miles from the convention center. I would not recommend staying here again
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this review. We're sorry to hear you were disappointed with your experience, and we appreciate your feedback regarding noise. Hopefully, if your travels bring you to Anaheim again, we have the chance to host you for a flawless visit.

Summary: My friend and I stayed for 8 days. The room was spacious, quiet and I really liked the sliding door between the bathroom and sleeping area - a great feature. What I didn't like was that my room was cleaned only TWICE during our stay! The first time, we were promised it wouldn't happen again and when we returned at 10:30pm the next day the room had not been cleaned - AGAIN, after being told the previous day it wouldn't happen again. They seemed to think 2 nights of apologies should be sufficient compensation - for the amount I paid for the room, having the garbage removed and fresh towels isn't much to ask - I can get that at the Motel 6 for a whole lot less money. The location to Disney was a short walk, the staff always said hello or Welcome back which is a nice touch. At this
Manager Response: Hello, and thank you for taking the time to submit this feedback. We do apologize for your experience, as this is not the level of service we strive to provide. We are sharing this with our team right away for review as a learning opportunity, and we hope to have the chance to host you again in the future for a flawless experience.

Summary: Our family of 4 stayed at the Fairfield Inn in for our Disneyland trip.  The location couldn't really be better.  It takes only 10'ish minutes to walk from the hotel to the front gates.  So much easier than waiting for a shuttle after a long day at the park.    The hotel itself is nothing fancy, but is very clean and the updated Disney themed rooms are very nice!  We stayed on the top floor facing Disneyland.  There are no fireworks in January (bummer) but apparently you can see them from these rooms.  They are all motel style rooms, which we really liked.  We ate at Panier Bread (right in the parking lot) most days for breakfast (and sometimes late dinner)... we don't have this chain in Canada, and we loooved it.  The hotel itself has an express Pizza Hut and a snack bar as
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review, Jenni! We're thrilled to know that you and your family found our hotel perfect for your Disney visit. We're happy to hear that you were able to take advantage of our great location as well, and we hope to host you again in the future!

Summary: This use to be my favorite hotel when I would visit Disneyland. I’m an annual pass holder, so we come up ever few months for a few nights. I love the location & can justify the $19 parking fee.   I have forgotten my pillow before & paid to have it sent back to me. The last week of October my friend & I came up for three nights. I had a migraine the morning we were checking out so I wasn’t thinking clearly. We were half way home & I realized I had forgotten my Michael Kors watch on the bed. When I called they said the room had been processed & nothing was found. When I got home I was hopeful I would find my watch in one of my bags. After searching them numerous times I knew I was right the first time. I called security at the hotel to report it to them & they staged it could have
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate you sharing this constructive feedback after your recent stay with us in Anaheim, Renee. While we're delighted that you love our location, we are sorry to hear that this stay did not live up to your previous experiences. Should your travels ever bring you back to the area, we hope you will give us another chance not only to meet but to exceed your expectations.

Summary: Amazing location and and exactly what you need! Staff was very nice and helpful from the guys at the gate to the wonderful lady at the front desk who got the park tickets for us even at the late hour we got in from New York, and the cool lady at the Gift shop. 7 minute walk to Disney Land park gate so if you need to get back to the room to get something, like a jacket in the little bit chilly evening. All good with Marriott, room and hotel is clean, comfortable and more like basic than wow...
Manager Response: What a fantastic review! We're so glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your time with us. You're kind words mean a lot to our team, and we'll be sure to pass this on. We hope to host you again in the future!

Summary: I frequently stay in Marriott hotels and I've stayed at this Fairfield Inn by Marriott before (4-5 times). It's a comfortable place to stay that's one of the absolute shortest walks from any hotel to Disneyland and California Adventure. Very few frills compared to the Courtyard next door, but it's always the right price, clean, and everything we need.  I've never had any negative experiences with the front desk staff and they've always been very friendly. But this time I had an experience that compelled me to write this review. After checking into our room, we were concerned about the layout for the pack-n-play for our 11-month old. Even though the hotel would now have to clean an extra room, we were allowed to change to an accessible room that had a better configuration.  That
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share this review with us. We are happy to accommodate our guests, and we are pleased to hear that Tamara and our associates took excellent care of you and your family. We will be sure to share your shout-out with our staff, and we look forward to welcoming you and your family back to our hotel the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: This is a great property for the value! Rooms very clean, with an accommodating and professional staff. We reserved a premium connecting room prior to arrival and received what was requested. Really enjoyed that the vanity and sink were behind a pocket door so we could get ready without disturbing the kids. Room had a fridge and a safe.Also had a decent coffee maker and supplies. Ironing supplies, hair dryer as well as Paul Mitchell basic products. Room cleaned daily and enjoyed the recent updates. We swam a few times and enjoyed the pool area. Would recommend larger pool towels, they are more like hand towels. The pizza hut and game room is on the 3rd floor. Noticed there was a microwave and a waffle iron in that common eating area. This really is a wonderful property and can
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this thorough and thoughtful review with us! We're are pleased to hear you and your family found our room spacious and convenient for your travels, and we appreciate your feedback regarding our pool towels. We can't wait to welcome you back for another stay in the future.

Summary Heading: Close walk to Disneyland, friendly staff
Summary: We chose this hotel based on location. Walking distance to Disneyland, approximately 5 minutes with a 9yr old. The room was a bit small but well appointed. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good value for price.
Manager Response: Thank you for joining us for your recent visit to Disneyland. We're delighted to hear you found our location convenient and our staff friendly and acommodating. We can't wait to welcome you back for another stay in the future.

Summary: From the shuttle service to the bar service this location knows how to take care of the customers.  Great people working at a great location.  We’ve been here on business for several weeks and have not been disappointed yet.  Thank you Moe, Carlo, and Maureen for taking care of me and our team. Kudos!
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Kevin! It's a pleasure serving you and your team and we greatly appreciate your kind words. As always, let us know if we can assist you in any way!

Summary Heading: Quick stay and visit to Halloween at Disneyland on 31 Oct 2018
Summary: Hotel was perfect! Rooms were spacious, clean. Lovely large pool and hot tub. All staff very friendly. Great for families. Can easily walk to Disneyland, shopping and many restaurants. Enjoyed our view of Disneyland from right outside our room.
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Suzanne! We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed all that the resort had to offer. We appreciate your kind words and we'll be sure to pass this along to our team. See you next time!

Summary: Stayed here as a family with two small children.  The room was adequate and we could watch the fireworks in the park the balcony which was nice.  The lobby has a nice gift shop and there was a cafe/Pizza hut on the floor we stayed on which was also nice.  Proximity to the park was decent though some hotels are perhaps slightly closer.  Overall pleasant stay.
Manager Response: We're happy to hear this! We appreciate your 4-star review and thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We hope to host you again in the future!

Summary: No need to rent a car if only going to Disneyland. Seriously less than 10min walk! Staff was absolutely fabulous, rooms were clean, beds were comfortable! Moving forward this will be my only choice of hotel when traveling to Disneyland. Worth every penny if you have young kids and need to go back to room to take a nap. Very happy with this hotel! Book this I promise you won’t regret it!!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Melissa! We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us, finding our location convenient and comfortable. We'll pass along your kind words to the team, and we look forward to welcoming you back again in the future!

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights and it was so much nicer than I had expected!  I read a lot of reviews and some of them were making me nervous but this hotel was wonderful. The staff was super friendly and helpful! We stayed in a queen premium view room and it was very nice all though a little small.  I called about 3 weeks prior to our arrival and requested a room with a view of the park and the fireworks. We were not disappointed! The room was very clean and housekeeping did a great job. We returned every day to cute towel animals on the bed. It was a short walk to the parks and there were plenty of restaurant options nearby.  We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this review with us, Jill! We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and loved the view from your guest room. We're also pleased to know you found our location convenient for your trip to Disneyland, and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: We’ve stayed at a handful of different Anaheim hotels on past trips hoping to save on parking and just walk to Disneyland. None of them were bad when walking TO the park, but coming home after a long day was always a Beast (and not the lovable, animated kind).  The Fairfield Inn has spoiled me on walking distance to Disneyland. So so easy. Took no effort or time at all to get there and back.   The newly-refurbished rooms were clean, spacious, and stylish. We stayed in 615, which offered a GREAT view of the park. Fireworks were cancelled due to wind, but our view would have been excellent from that perspective.   Staff from valet to check-in to room service were all friendly and welcoming.  The proximity of Mimi’s Cafe, Panera, and McDonalds makes the fact that Fairfield offers
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this review with us, Michael! We appreciate your thorough and helpful feedback regarding our parking prices. We're delighted to hear that our rooms were spacious and comfortable for your stay, and we're glad you love our convenient location. We hope to welcome you back for a five-star stay in every way in the future.

Summary: The location is pretty hard to beat and it is overall a very nice facility. Costs about the same if not less to park the car here than it does at Disneyland. We visited Disneyland 1 year ago and stayed elsewhere but we had a rental car that time so driving wasn't a big deal. This is my second stay here and we returned because you simply cross the street and you're in the Park. Only thing that could improve the stay would be complimentary breakfast, which you would find even and most inferior hotels to this.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Tom! We appreciate your loyalty, and we're happy to know that you enjoyed another stay with us. We value your feedback regarding breakfast as well and will share this with the team!

Summary: We didn't have any problems with our three night stay. The room was clean and kept clean by housekeeping. Everyone was friendly and the front desk staff was very helpful, even finding me a phone charger cable in the lost and found (they had a box full.) Breakfast was good and varied. Only a 30 minute safe, clean walk to the Disney gates.
Manager Response: That's what we like to hear! We're so happy that our team made your visit special, and that you enjoyed your time with us in our great location. We hope to host you again in the future!

Summary: We stayed at this property last month during the Disneyland Mickey's Halloween Party, for 7 nights. We were lucky (Depending on your view of lucky), to be situated on the same floor as the Pizza Hut. This was such a life saver at times. The rooms are great, good size, good amenities and most importantly, close proximity to the Disney parks. (About a 5-10 minute walk) The rooms were cleaned regularly and it felt and looked clean once serviced. The arcade room is a nice touch for the young and not-so-young ones. It certainly passed the time away, though it could use an upgrade of the machines available. The pool is great for relaxing in the afternoon from the parks and refreshing before going out again for the evening sessions. The gift store is very quaint, still great though and
Manager Response: This is what we like to hear! We thank you for taking the time to leave such kind and honest feedback. We appreciate this review, and we're thrilled that you and your family enjoyed all that the resort had to offer. We hope to host you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Preferred location, comfortable room & reasonably priced
Summary: We stayed 4 nights at this property for our Disneyland trip.  We love this location for walking to the park.  It seems just about as close to me as staying at Paradise Pier but it’s a different direction.  We have a family of 5 and my youngest had a small pull out bed that was fine.  The room was updated and comfortable.  This property feels older than some but we were pleased based on cleanliness, price & distance to park entrances.  Also loved having Panera in the parking lot.  The staff was attentive the 2 times I needed assistance. I wouldn’t consider this a resort you want to hang out at but if you’re focused on the park and need a economical, clean & close option I’d go for it!  I did request a room away from the elevator based on other reviews and found it to be very
Manager Response: Thank you, Carrie! We appreciate your feedback and we're happy to know that you enjoyed your time with us. Hopefully, we have the chance to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great location, super friendly staff, clean rooms = Family Vacay Perfection!
Summary: Due to an early Saturday morning flight, we arrived well before check in time.  They stored our bags without no problem and I felt like it was very secure.  In fact, I had to run back and grab something out of a bag  and they clearly followed protocol to check my slip before pulling my bag, although it was like 5 minutes since I'd been there.  I took that as a good sign.  Having McDonald's and Panera in the parking lot makes feeding the family super easy.  We were able to walk between the parks and our room with ease.  The rooms were clean and in good working order although clearly an older hotel.  The pool is small and right at ground level next to all of the cars idling in the valet area, but we were so busy we didn't really stay long anyway and it was Fall. I think this would
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share this review with us. We're happy to have earned the "family vacay perfection" badge following your stay! We are delighted to hear our staff members took excellent care of you and that you found our location convenient for your recent travels to Disneyland. We can't wait to welcome you back for another stay in the future!

Summary: Spent a weekend in Disneyland with the family and stayed here. The room was simple and clean and we got two adjoining rooms which helped us get the youngest kiddos ready in the morning. They kindly provided ear plugs for when the masses come back to sleep when the park closes. The location is perfect for park hopping or afternoon naps. The restaurant in the parking lot is a great quick stop for food. Definitely recommending this to my friends!
Manager Response: That's what we like to hear! We're so happy that you and your family found our location convenient, and that you enjoyed your time with us. We greatly appreciate you taking the time to share this review, and we hope to have the chance to host you again very soon!

Summary: Was put in room 702 and heard constant rumble from nearby elevator. It felt as if I was sleeping on top of rumbling subway. Then in am called about comp breakfast as am elite member and they said "sorry dont offer breakfast for elite memebers." Nothing not even extra 10-20 bucks per room. Only pro is this place right next to Disney and has valet which costs the same as self parking.  Wont stay here again. When called about breakfast seemed unapologetic.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this review, Carlos. We're sorry to hear you were disappointed with your recent experience with us. We do appreciate your feedback regarding breakfast and compensation to elite members and we'll share this with our team for review.

Summary: This hotel is a very short walk to disneyland. It has vallet, a pizza hut in the 3rd floor and a cute gift shop. It is clean, nice beds. The only complaint is the fold out bed is small and uncomfortable. It may be ok for little children but it is not good for a teen. Other than that its a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and found our location convenient for your trip to Disneyland. We appreciate your feedback about our fold-out bed, and we'll be sure to discuss this with our team. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you for a five-star stay in every way in the future.

Summary Heading: Great location - walk to Disneyland and DCA
Summary: Very clean recently refurbished rooms.  Walking distance to both Disneyland and DCA.  We watched the fireworks from our room.  The view of Disneyland was absolutely spectacular!  The rate was one of the best in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing this five-star review with us, Stephen! We're delighted to hear you found our guest rooms comfortable and our location convenient, and we can't wait to welcome you back to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: 5 minutes and you are in line for security to Disney!
Summary: We decided to try this motel because it’s so close. Their new premium updated rooms are great, be sure to request a premium room with a view for the fire works. Disney fireworks right outside your door! They are loud but 🤷🏻‍♀️ they are magical. We stayed on the 7th floor two queen beds. Small room in general a for a family of four, but I didn’t expect anything less. It had nice hardwood floors, a sofa bull out chair. A mini fridge! Two firm queen beds.  Ac was a bit noisy I saw that on other reviews. It didn’t bother us... especially with kids.. I had a sound machine going to so no issues. We did set the ac when we were gone, it was 90 so we wanted the room cool when we got back. But we think those might be the next things updated in the rooms. Housekeeping was moving the ac
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this lovely review! We are thrilled to hear you had a magical time with us, and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know. We are happy that our guest rooms were comfortable and convenient for your visit to Disneyland. We know how important location is when you're ready for a day of fun (or to get home quickly once the fun is finished). We can't wait to welcome you back for another stay the next time you're in our area!

Summary: As mentioned in most reviews for the Anaheim Fairfield Inn, the main draw is the location in walking distance to Disneyland.  It is about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel to the security line and both McDonald's and Panera are on route.  One bit of warning is that the security line off of Harbor can get quite long during peak times, so you need to plan around that if you are walking to Disneyland.  The hotel is a bit older and the common areas are showing significant wear and tear.  The rooms, however, were recently updated.  These updates included vinyl wood flooring, a large flat screen TV (with netflix/youtube access with your own account), and updates in the storage area.   This makes the stay comfortable while in the room.  There is a useful bag storage off of the lobby
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review! We're happy to hear you enjoyed our great location and our updated rooms, and we appreciate you sharing your experience here. We hope to host you again in the future!

Summary: 5 minute walk to Disneyland. Panera, McDonald’s, IHOP, Tony Roma’s & Cold Stone all right in the vicinity. Rooms appeared clean.  Staff was friendly & helpful. I would not have minded the wood laminate floors if they supplied house slippers. Overall, great hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay! From our convenient location to our friendly staff, we're glad you loved it all. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back again soon.

Summary: Recently stayed here with my family for a trip to Disneyland. We payed extra for a room with a view of the park; however, we did not have a view. We were told we could view the fireworks from our room, but that is not what was advertised and we were in the park for the fireworks show anyway. I would not pay extra for this. Also, the room was pretty small for our stroller and all the extras we brought home from Disneyland. Not much room to move around. Beds were clean and comfy, which was a plus.
