The wall from our room to the front gates was 15 minutes (that includes the security line). Probably would not stay here again and would try somewhere else next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this review, Susan. We're sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your room view, and we apologize for any miscommunications during the reservation process. We will share this with the team as a learning experience, and we hope to have the chance to host you again on your next visit.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights while we were visiting Disneyland. It was a super nice hotel!! We had a king room on the 4th floor. The valet folks were always nice and greeted us coming and going. The check in process was a breeze and the front desk was super nice. I loved the wood floors. The room came with a pair of ear plugs which made me nervous. The walls were really thin and you could hear a lot the fireworks sounded like they were right outside so beware. We would totally stay here again I loved the location and how close it was to Disney just a 5 minute walk
Manager Response: Hi, Rochelle. Thank you so much for taking the time to share this lovely review with us. We're delighted to hear you loved your room and found it spacious and convenient for your family. We also love knowing our staff took great care of you, and we can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: Excellent location, comfy room, great beds
Summary: Stayed here on a Disneyland trip booked through Costco Travel.   The location is excellent.  There is a Pizza Hut that's like a little deli on the 3rd floor.  In the same location are arcade games.   The beds were really comfy.  Rooms had a fridge and coffee maker, but no microwave.  But there are microwave ovens available in the 3rd floor area with the pizza hut.
Manager Response: Hello! Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us. We're delighted to hear you had a pleasant stay and found our guest rooms comfortable and our resort well-appointed. We can't wait to welcome you back the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: If your idea of a good hotel, at high prices, is Location Location location you might like this place..Otherwise buyer beware.  I rented our room several months early for my son, my granddaughter and baby great grandson and me..I'm relieved they didn't all come..tiny room, no room for baby bed. Microwave was on another floor, We stayed 4 nights and no refills for soap plastic cups nor shampoo (be sure to bring your own).  Parking was odd..you paid to park and when I told customer service one person would use parking lot for one night the calculation was mind blowing.  No complimentary breakfast though they had a market place on 3rd floor that was more expensive then walking to IHOP. The staff was super friendly but of little use when asking about Disney package.  This is a
Manager Response: Hello, Dee. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us following your recent visit to Anaheim. We are disappointed to hear your stay did not live up to expectations, and we appreciate you letting us know. We will be sure to discuss the issues you experienced with plastic cup and toiletry refills with our housekeeping staff. Should your travels bring you back to our area, we hope to have the opportunity to improve upon your experience.

Summary: My best friend, her mom and my daughter stayed here for 4 nights for a quick August trip. The walk to the park was good, easy for all three generations. We were upgraded to a top floor room. The two queen beds plus little loveseat was enough room for three adults and one 9 year old. The only thing missing was a microwave in the room. We enjoyed the small refrigerator. There a sliding door so some of us could sleep while others used the sink area and still another the shower. The front desk was beyond helpful with the scooter that my friend's mom rented. We arrived well before check-in and stayed after check-out in Disneyland. The bell service and luggage storage were great. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share this review with us. We're delighted to hear that our staff took great care of you, and we appreciate your feedback about the room lacking a microwave. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in every way.

Summary: I stayed here for four nights while visiting Disneyland, and it was a great choice. The hotel room was quite clean and it seems like a lot of rooms face Disneyland, so you could theoretically view the fireworks from your room. The noise from the fireworks is pretty loud, but they do give you some free earplugs. There are plenty of restaurants on the way to Disneyland from the hotel (which is within walking distance), but if you don’t feel like walking even that short distance, there is a Pizza Hut on the third floor. My only complaint is that when I turned on the AC, I would be left with a puddle in my room.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your Disneyland getaway! We're delighted that you loved our guest rooms and our location. We hope to welcome you back very soon!

Summary: We stayed here for two nights to visit Disneyland on our way back to LAX from Vegas and had a few issues. The first was the air condition unit, it sounded like a jet engine in your room, so you couldn't have it on over night, which resulted in an hot nights sleep. The second was why would we be placed next door to a family and young kids, there was also a joining door. I know it’s Disneyland and what was I expecting but there were other rooms free. So all night and early in the morning we would get banging on the door etc. I’m not blaming the family, ish, but the hotel for putting us together. The room wasn’t cheap, and parking was extra, and all we got at check out was sorry.   The rooms are basic but it’s a good location for Disneyland, however, the air con alone would stop me
Manager Response: Thank you for filling us in about your recent stay. We're sorry to hear about the inconveniences you experienced and we appreciate you providing your feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a seamless stay in the future.

Summary Heading: Good location, decent hotel.  Don't stay here if you are brown or mixed
Summary: It is a decent hotel and in a decent location, but if you are brown or mixed expect static from the front desk.  My wife is dark and I am white.  Her key was bad and they refused to give her a new key.  I have verified she is listed on the room.  I verified it when we checked in and they even asked me if anyone else needed to be added to the room because the particular room we had was good for four people. We joked about it was just the two of us and hopefully no one else. Cut to the next day and she heads back to the room without me and her key doesn't work and she is refused a new key. I call the hotel and gripe and they give her a key. 5 hours later I show up and my key doesn't work either and sure enough it takes me, a white person, 20 seconds to get a new key. You would
Manager Response: Thank you for reaching out to us. We feel badly that both you and your wife had room keys that did not work and we did not notate your wife’s name on the account so she could have a new key made. We truly apologize for the miscommunication and we hope to provide you with a seamless stay in the future.

Summary Heading: The hotel so nice, we are staying here twice!
Summary: Check in was easy and quick. Our room was right at the top, and then right at the end, pretty much overlooking McDonalds. Room was always clean, all staff are amazing. Very small walk to the gate of Disney. Plenty of food options close by. We stayed here over Halloween 2017, and are staying again in 2018. Can't wait to be there again soon.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know what made you book another stay with us! From our guest rooms to our staff, we're thrilled you loved it all. We can hardly wait to welcome you back!

Summary: My wife and I frequently visit the Disneyland Resort, typically once per year.  We always stay at the hotels on Harbor as Disney resort hotels are out of our price range.  This was our first time staying at this particular hotel as it was cheaper than the other hotels we have stayed at in the past this particular trip.  We had a bit of a mixed experience staying here.  I'll start with what was good about this hotel.  The staff working at this hotel were pleasant to deal with any time we interacted with them.  The valet company always greeted us when we returned to the hotel, check in and check out went fairly smoothly.   And perhaps the biggest pro to this hotel is that is is a short 5 minute walk to the Disneyland gates.    Now for the not so great:  Early check in fee - Talk
Manager Response: Hello, Jeff. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We greatly appreciate you sharing both your positive and constructive feedback after your recent stay with us in Anaheim. While we're delighted that you loved our location and experienced the friendly service we strive to provide all of our guests, we're sorry to hear that you found our guest beds uncomfortable. Should your travels ever bring you back to the area, we hope you will give us another chance not only to meet but to exceed your expectations.

Summary: Location Location Location, directly across from Disneyland's main entrance this is a very clean and comfortable Hotel with all you could need.  Pool, cafe kids play/games room and even themed rooms.  We have stayed her 4 times and will again.
Manager Response: Thank you for joining us once again, Craig! We are delighted to hear you love our location and found our hotel comfortable and convenient, and we can't wait to welcome you back for another stay in the future.

Summary: This hotel is in a prime location for Disney. It's less than a 10 minute walk to Disney security, and is very near some easy food options (Mimi's Cafe, McDonalds, Panera). It's so close that on some of our days at Disney we went back to the hotel for a cold drink and a break during the hot sun before going back to see the night shows. The staff at the hotel are very friendly, and our room was always very clean. The only downside was that the airconditioning in our room was so loud when it was running, and unfortunately it was too hot to not have it on - I didn't sleep well because of this. The rest of the hotel is great, there's a pool, a coffee shop, and a little shop in the lobby that sells snacks, Disney merch, and sundries. From the balcony and the pool you're able to see
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share this review with us. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and found our location convenient for midday breaks. We appreciate your feedback regarding our air conditioning. We can't wait to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: We stayed Aug 29-Sept 04 2018.  First off, I have to compliment the staff. Very friendly and attentive. Particular notice to Jackie Z at the front desk who remembered my name the next day and always did her best to help us out.  This hotel is closer than you think to the gate. Maybe 5 minutes or so. We got a room with a fireworks view but anyone could wander over to that side and watch the show from the second floor walkway.  The beds were AMAZING. We always find hotel mattresses to be uncomfortable but these were great. One guest said her husband checked the label and planned to buy one!   The rooms themselves are clean and tidy.  There is a Panera Bread just in front of the hotel.  The pool does the job in that it’s a rectangle of cool water for the kids to let off steam.  I
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review, Jean! We greatly appreciate you sharing such wonderful and detailed feedback about your experience, and we love that our location holds a special place in your family's heart. We'll be sure to pass along your kind words to Jackie and the team as well, and we look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Nickel and Dime you, but great location
Summary: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights.  The room was clean.  The park is right across from Disneyland so really enjoyed the short walk, much better than busing to another hotel.  What i didn't like is the lack of communication on what is offered and what isn't.  Marriott fairfield suites website tout having breakfast at their locations.... what they don't mention is that this location is the only one that doesn't provide it for free.  Very disappointing compared to other properties around Disneyland.  They also did not mention on the travel site we used to book the hotel that parking was an additional $19 a day so that was an unexpected expense so when you add parking and breakfast costs the hotel was not as reasonable as other locations we have stayed in the past.  I was also
Manager Response: We'd like to thank you for taking the time to provide this review and honest feedback, Steve. We apologize for any miscommunications regarding pricing, and we greatly value your input. We're very sorry to hear about your experience at the front desk when you addressed the issue. This will be addressed right away as a learning opportunity, as we aim to provide polite and respectful service to all of our guests. We truly hope we have the chance to host you again in the future for 5-star experience.

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights as a family of 4 & had a very worthwhile stay. It’s pretty basic, nothing fancy but rooms are clean & well maintained. The pool area is nice, but can get quite crowded at times. We got woken up at 3.30am by an emergency alarm & then an apology over the speakers - after 3 long days at Disneyland this didn’t help our sleep which we were craving?! This is the only minor gripe I have with the hotel - overall I would recommend it & the staff were wonderful
Manager Response: We thank you very much for this kind, 4-star review. We do apologize for the inconvenience of the false fire alarm, and we have addressed this issue with the team. We are glad to hear that you found your rooms clean and well maintained and that you enjoyed your experience at the pool. We hope to host you and your family again in the future!

Summary: As a Marriott Rewards member, I was thrilled to find a Marriott hotel within a 5 minute walk of Disneyland - the perfect place to stay for a magical day and night at the happiest place on earth... or so I thought. After a wonderful and memorable day at the Disney parks with my wife, we returned back to our hotel exhausted and looking forward to a restful and safe night. Unfortunately our experience was neither restful or safe. We were frighteningly awoken by an air-raid siren of an alarm at 3am. Clearly an emergency of some sort was occurring and we were given no further direction or explanation from staff. We attempted calling the front desk and they were not picking up after a dozen attempts. Very scared, we chose to stay in our room. After a terrifying 20 minutes, a second
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us. We would like to apologize for your experience and let you know that we are addressing your concerns internally. Our guests' safety and security is our priority and we are sorry for the confusion you experienced. We hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a seamless stay in the future.

Summary Heading: Ignore the haters - this hotel was perfect
Summary: Location location location!!!!! 8 min walk to the park. We where here for a 7 night stay.  We had a view of the fireworks from our room. The room was clean, staff was friendly, elevators were plenty! I did a lot of research on hotels and I landed on this one. I felt I got my monies worth 10 times over. Some hotels look like their close to the gate, but they aren’t. Do your homework. You won’t regret this one.
Manager Response: We know location is key when traveling and we couldn't be happier to hear that you loved ours! Thank you for taking the time to let us know about how much you enjoyed our views, guest rooms and staff as well. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary Heading: Perfect for Disney - and so much more !
Summary: If you’ve stayed at (and enjoyed) one of Disney’s All Star resorts in Orlando and wondered what the equivalent would be when staying at Disneyland in Anaheim, look no further.  The Fairfield Inn has one of the best locations for Disney’s original Park.  A short walk along Harbor Boulevard, cross the street and you’re in.  But the best aspect of this Fairfield has to be its people:  We experienced incredible customer service during our stay, starting at check-in where Tamara, on noticing my wife’s hearing aids, immediately started signing. That kind of attention to detail is extraordinarily special.  She also provided an excellent map of local eateries and visits - a paper-based tour with humour and insight.  Later Jackie directed us to the coin-op laundry with a friendly chat.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review! We're thrilled that you loved our location, service and views. We truly appreciate all of your feedback and we hope to welcome you back very soon!

Summary: This was my family's second visit to Fairfield Inn Anaheim Marriot. We choose this hotel because of the short waking distance to the Disney Resort. Loved the remodel and Disney Theme in our Premium View room. Excellent view for the fireworks and great restaraunts near by if you wish to relax in your room. The only suggestion I have is have more children channels available on the TV. It was hard to find shows appropriate for my little ones (6 and 1 1/2) Disney Jr. would be great for the little ones or even a channel showing all things available at the Disney Resort. The Disney Channel available had maybe one show theycould watch the rest were too mature. Other than that Our family will be back next time we are down!
Manager Response: Hello, Renee! Thank you for taking the time to share this feedback with us. We appreciate your thoughts regarding our TV offerings in the room, and we'll be sure to discuss this with our team. We're glad to hear you loved your view, and we can't wait to welcome you back to Anaheim!

Summary: This hotel is in a great location. About 5 minute walk to Disneyland and great food options near by. The staff was always friendly, greeted us every time they saw us and were helpful when we asked questions. The reason I give 3 stars is because we had an item go missing in our room after housekeeping cleaned. My sons blanket which he has had since he was born was gone after they came to clean the room. We talked to the front desk staff and even security. They looked and it could not be found. They offered to write an incident report and have it sent to corporate to deal with, but how can you replace something that only has emotional value. I had a VERY upset child. You should feel safe leaving your belonging when leaving your room. This is the reason I won’t be staying again.
Manager Response: Greetings. Thank you for taking the time to share this with us. We are disappointed to hear that we could not locate your son's blanket. Please feel free to send us a private message with your reservation details so that we can check again for your lost item. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we do hope to have the opportunity to improve upon your recent experience.

Summary: Booked a premium room view as it was our first time visiting Disneyland. We could barely see anything from our room. I wasn’t aware that even with premium view you have to request to be able to see fireworks from room. Was disappointed as it looked nothing like online pictures. Very deceiving. As well my daughter got some bites from sleeping on the pull out sofa and the hotel could have cared less. Said they couldn’t prove it was from the room and that was it. Very disappointed in customer service. Won’t be staying here again on our next Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: Greetings, and thank you for reaching out. Please feel free to send us a private message with your reservation details so that we may look into your stay. We take issues of this nature very seriously, and we appreciate you sharing your experience with us.

Summary: Going to Disneyland for the first time just my husband and I ..no kids this trip..we wanted to stay somewhere differant and the travel agent recommended the Fairfield inn anahiem so we upgraded to the premium King.  The hotel sits a little back behind Panera bread and has a typical lobby.The Hotel guest services are really friendly and greet you promptly.We wanted to check our bags so we could head to the park right away and this part was a little confusing because they told us to go over and wait to the left.We did but it took a little bit for someone to come and help us with our stuff.  We enjoyed getting a text saying our room was ready while we were at the park.When checking in to get our keys the guest team member Bernie made it extra magical!Her warmth and greeting were
Manager Response: This is what we like to hear! We're thrilled you enjoyed your anniversary with us, and that our team made your visit special. Thank you very much for sharing such a kind review of your experience here, and we look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary: The location of this hotel is great for visiting the Disneyland parks. There are plenty of places to get a quick breakfast beforehand too. The room was clean and comfortable. You have to pay for parking which is not cheap. We paid for a room with a view. When I checked in, she asked if I wanted a room with the view of the fireworks. I’m glad she asked bc that was the entire reason for the upgraded room! Otherwise I would have been looking at trees. Make sure when you request a room with a view that they know you want to watch the fireworks. I would stay here again if we ever return to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us! We're delighted to hear you found our location convenient for your visit to Disneyland and our rooms clean and comfortable. We are happy to know you were able to view the fireworks from your room, and we do hope you enjoyed the show! We can't wait to welcome you back and we hope to provide you with a five-star stay in every way in the future.

Summary: This is an excellent hotel if you’re looking to access Disneyland. A quick five to ten minute walk to the main gates, this hotel is located on the “strip” but is also incredibly quiet and you can get a decent rest. Whilst the bathrooms are slightly outdated, the rooms are clean and beds comfy. We used the laundry facilities and it was great to wash our clothes after an extensive period away.  We didn’t get to try the Pizza Hut express but with Panera bread on the corner, this was a great spot to eat before heading into the park. Will definitely stay here again if visiting Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you very much! We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us, and were able to take advantage of our convenient location and dining options. We hope to host you again in the future.

Summary: I had been here in the month of July with my fiancee and i was very happy with the service we received. We stayed here for two days and we couldn't ask for anything better from food to room service. Everything was too good.
Manager Response: This is what we like to hear! Thank you so much for sharing such a kind review. We're happy to hear that you both enjoyed your time with us and that our team exceeded your service expectations. We hope to have you with us again in the future.

Summary: Stayed there with my family. The hotel is clean even when it seems to be packed and full. We called for towels for the pool and they sent them right the way. The location is great since you have a bunch of options if you want to go out for breakfast.
Manager Response: That's what we like to hear! Thank you for sharing such a kind review. We're thrilled you and your family enjoyed your time in our great location, and we look forward to hosting you again soon.

Summary: My family and I recently stayed at Fairfield Inn by Marriott in Anaheim for a couple nights. Once we found the place, it was a pleasant experience! It's important to note the hotel is set back from S Harbor Blvd. So, in order to reach the Fairfield, you have to pull into Panera Bread and then proceed straight through their parking lot to the guard stand. Since we were traveling to Disneyland, we arrived well before our scheduled check-in time. Surprisingly, our room was ready and we received a free upgrade to a Jr. Suite! Since this hotel doesn't really have indoor corridors, I was surprised to learn they offered this room category. But, the room was nice, spacious, and recently renovated. The beds were comfortable, there were ample outlets for charging, the air conditioning
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed your time with us, and we appreciate you sharing your experience here. Hopefully, we have the chance to host you again in the future!

Summary: Exterminator (canister and all) was entering the room next to ours while we were checking in.  We were supposed to get adjoining rooms and it was clear why the room next store was suddenly not available.  Staff could not get there story straight as to what was going on.  The said everything from it was a cricket to a plumbing issue.  I don't think you need a bug spray canister for either.  We requested to be moved.  2nd room was dirty. Floor had crumbs on it and the nightstand had a drink spilled down the back that was all over the mattress cover, wall and floor.  I would not recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello, Laura, and thank you for reaching out. We do apologize for your experience during your time with us. We strive to provide top notch service to all of our guests, and we're sorry to hear about these issues that you encountered during your stay. We have shared this review with our team as a learning experience, and to ensure these matters are addressed right away. We hope to have the chance to provide you with a 5-star experience on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Such an accommodating, friendly, super professional staff. Great location to Disneyland (and Panera). The only thing missing was a restaurant in the hotel that wasn’t fast food. I don’t recommend this hotel if you are not with a family, there really isn’t one quiet spot.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We're very happy to hear our team made your visit special. We appreciate your feedback regarding dining options as well! We'll share this with our team and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: My wife likes to surprise me sometimes.  Sometimes good and sometimes bad.    Basically, she took my kids to Disneyland and stayed at a Disney property.  I realized that I could join the family that weekend so I asked her to book me a room.  I flew into LAX (a mistake), got my rental car and then drove for a while and finally found the place.  It's a bit confusing as the hotel is set in the back of a parking lot where the McDonalds and the other places, ie, Panera are in front, facing South Harbor Boulevard.  So I drove into the parking lot.  And it's a parking lot, like at Costco-type parking lot, without the pretense of topiary.  There's a guard there.  I guess he's checking to see if you're a guest.  So I park my car, roll out my luggage and walk to the lounge.  It's obvious
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We always appreciate feedback from our guests and this is no exception. We apologize that we did not meet your expectations and we appreciate you letting us know so we can share your input with our team. We hope to exceed your expectations in the future.

Summary Heading: Even friendlier than Disney, great location
Summary: My two teenage sons and I stayed here for 3 nights near the end of July 2018 (busy, busy, busy season).  Since it is located right across the street from Disneyland and California Adventure, I was concerned that it may be overrun by little kids, noisy and they may not be able to keep up with keeping the property clean.  I was completely wrong!  Our room was extremely quiet (and we went to bed fairly early each night), clean and the beds were very comfortable.  Wifi was fast and reliable. And I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH ABOUT HOW GREAT EACH AND EVERY EMPLOYEE WAS.  Their friendliness and assistance was even better than we have come to expect from actual Disney employees.  It was just a short walk to the park entrances so we didn't have to worry about parking the car or taking the shuttle
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us, Heather. We're delighted to hear that you and your sons had an excellent stay, and we appreciate you letting us know. We love taking care of our guests, and we're happy to know that our staff delivered exceptional guest services. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we cannot wait to welcome you again!

Summary: My girlfriend and I were left scrambling to find a place to stay after having a negative experience with poor cleanliness at the Howard Johnson and poor room condition at the Anaheim Marriott.  So, we found a room available at the Fairfield Inn.    We opted for the premium view room because of the decoration.  The room was clean but the view was of a pine tree, so I wouldn’t call it a premium view.   The room is dated but has been repainted and new flooring has been added.    Rooms are high priced but are clean.  Staff was great.   Room was a good choice if choosing to stay off Disneyland property.
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Joseph! We're happy to hear our team made your visit special, and we appreciate your feedback regarding the rooms. We hope to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary: We've stayed here a dozen times. It is a quick  .5 mile walk to either park, there is a McDonald's, a Mimi's and a Panera right outside. The rooms are nice, newly decorated with wood floors and a pocket door that creates privacy for the sink area. The cost is reasonable. The 3rd floor has a lobby with toasters and a small coffee shop/pizza parlor/quickie Mart for cereal and breakfast sandwiches. It is a great hotel for families with kids of all ages.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! We're so happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay in our great location and found our amenities convenient. We appreciate your recommendation and we hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: Took the family to Disneyland end of July and spent 2 nights at the Fairfield Inn. A very nice hotel right across the street  from the entrance to Disney. Comfortable rooms..clean and well supplied. A great staff made it a good  choice. Have to pay for parking though.
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Scott! We appreciate your kind review, and we're happy to hear our team made your visit special. We hope to welcome you again soon!

Summary Heading: Good Hotel at a good value.... just a couple mins walk to Disneyland
Summary: This is a good hotel at a good value and the location is great!  Literally a mins walk from the front gate of Disneyland.  The room we had was spacious and the front desk agents were helpful. Just outside the hotel is a Panera Bread, making it easy to grab a snack coming or going from the parks. Also close by is a McDonald’s and a nice breakfast place, Mimi’s Cafe.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. From our location to our guest rooms and staff, we're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay! Thank you for letting us know what you loved most.

Summary: My family (Mom, Dad, adult daughter, two teens) stayed at the Fairfield Inn for ten nights for a Disneyland/Los Angeles vacation. The room (two beds and pull out sofa) was spacious enough to make us all feel comfortable and not crowded, especially since we really only needed a place to sleep before going to the parks for the day or leaving for LA. The room and grounds were very clean and the staff was helpful whenever we needed anything. The pool provided a nice place to relax and unwind for a bit, and the hot tub was very relaxing. Beds were comfortable. Overall, we were very happy with our stay.  One very nice perk was the water station at the entrance to the hotel. There is a water station in the lobby that provides ice cold water infused with lemons or limes. This was a
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this kind review, Mark and Amy! We're thrilled you and your family enjoyed your time with us in our great location, and enjoyed all that the hotel had to offer. We hope to welcome you back again in the future for a 5-star experience.

Summary: I am a self admitted Disney freak so when I found out I had training 20 mins from Disneyland I booked a side trip there.  I orginally booked another hotel but read they were under renovations so switched to the Fairfield a couple of days later.  Things happen for a reason because everything was perfect here. I work in customer service and this hotel could teach lessons on customer service. From the employees who sit outside under the umbrella to the front desk I was always greeted with a smile and a hello.  The front desk helped me by upgrading my room at check in and answered any questions I had.  The location is literally across the street. I was in the park within 5 minutea if I had to wait for the light to change, 3 if I didnt.  Ive stayed at resorts in Disney World before
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this kind, 5-star review! We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed your time in our great location, and we're glad our team made your stay special. We appreciate your recommendation, and we hope to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great Stay at a great location
Summary: I would highly, highly recommend this property.  The location for Disneyland visits was awesome...short walk to the parks.  There are a couple places to eat close by, nothing awesome but ok.  The hotel staff was awesome, the room was great (elevator sounds in room was a bit annoying).  I opted for the upgraded view and I will never regret that decision.... OMG the fireworks were just fabulous.  Pool was nice, hot tub was hot.  Room was super clean and all areas of the hotel were clean.  I wish they offered breakfast...most travelers are used to at least a continental breakfast...something grab and go.  If I get back to visit Disneyland again I will def stay at this property.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a wonderful review! We're thrilled our team made our visit special, and we appreciate your recommendation. We hope to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary: Our family spent three nights in two rooms at the Fairfield. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our two rooms very clean and more than adequate. This is a high volume hotel so small evidences of wear-and-tear are starting to show but not enough for me to rate them lower. As previous reviewers have said it is minutes from Disneyland so this saves much consternation if you have a car (which we didn’t). I would certainly stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, William. We are delighted to hear that you found our guest rooms spacious and our location perfect for your recent vacation. We can't wait to have you back the next time your family visits Disneyland!

Summary: My Mom and myself stayed at the Fairfield inn July 12-19th 2018. We had chosen the hotel because of the proximity to Disneyland as well as the pictures on the website. We were more than satisfied. We had booked a room with a king bed on a high floor with a premium view. The room was very clean with laminate flooring. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The TV had Netflix as well which was great for the evenings. We could also see California Adventure from our balcony as well as the fireworks.  What we loved most about the hotel was the close proximity to Disneyland. We were able to come back  in the afternoon and have a rest before getting ready for the evening in the park. We will for sure be staying here again on our next trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Greetings, Alicia! We are delighted to hear that you and your mother enjoyed your recent stay with us, and we appreciate you taking the time to know. We love discovering that our guests found our rooms spacious and well-appointed and our location perfect for their Disneyland adventures. We can't wait to welcome you back the next time you're in the area.

Summary: We had a great stay at this hotel last week.  Our room was clean and comfortable; we had a fantastic view of Disneyland Resort, and the staff, as always was friendly and helpful.  We also enjoyed the close proximity to Disneyland  (easy walking distance) and the convenience of Mimi's and Panera restaurants right next door.  This is our favorite place to stay in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Greetings, Clydene! We're delighted to hear you had a wonderful stay with us and found our resort convenient for your recent travels. We love knowing our staff took great care of you, and we can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary: The hotel was a short walk to Disneyland, Panera Bread and McDonalds. The room was a standard hotel room. What makes this hotel special is the pride each employee took in maintaining the structure, cleaning, and customer service. The front desk was staffed with the most caring and knowledgeable staff. Above and beyond! That’s customer service. Thank you!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this amazing review! We're thrilled our team made your visit a special one, and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: My family of 4 spent 6 nights at the Fairfield Inn July 3rd through July 9. The staff was great, the Market & fitness center on the 3rd floor is fantastic & the pool was a relaxing respite from miles & miles of Disneyland walking!  We were lucky to get a 9th floor room facing Harbor Blvd., which enabled us to have a great view of the nightly fireworks show.  Having Panera & McDonalds in the parking lot was super convenient as well. If I have another opportunity, I would gladly stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a kind review, Michael! We're thrilled to hear you and your family enjoyed your time with us in our great location. We'd love to welcome you back in the future!

Summary: Check in was easy, did an upgrade to room with a view.  Fireworks are awesome and loud.  Quick walk to the park. Valet was easy.  I liked the fact that the rooms had laminate flooring.  I hate carpets, you never know what is on it.
Manager Response: That's what we like to hear! We're thrilled you were able to enjoy a great view and our convenient location, and we hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: walking is short and the rooms are very nice and well cared for.  thing i did not like is that I left a blouse there and they did not call me to tell me I did.  I have left things at other places and they have called me.
Manager Response: Thank you for this kind review! We're sorry to hear about your missing garment.  If it has not yet been recovered, please call us at (714) 772-6777, and select option 9. We hope to welcome back again soon.

Summary: Service is amazing  just two blocks from the gates and the staff cares  The biggest thing that impressed me was that the staff tried anything to ensure that you visit was amazing.  We need transportation to Medevil Times and they lined us up with a discount
Manager Response: This is what we strive for! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us, and that our team made your stay special. We truly hope we have the chance to host you again soon.

Summary: Stayed here for our semi-annual Halloween visit to Disneyland.  This hotel is perfect if you're on a budget but still want to be super close to the park.  The Fairfield Inn is essentially right across the street from Disneyland. Some hotels say they are in "walking distance" but they're really not... Don't worry, this place is legitimately within walking distance.  We stayed in the standard King room and it was ideal for us.  The bed was very comfortable, and having the little couch thing in front of the TV was nice too.  There was a good amount of space as well, We did not feel cramped like you might at some other budget hotels.  Everything was clean and nothing was falling apart.  No weird smells or issues with any of the appliances.  Checking in and out was a cinch.  If
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us, and we greatly appreciate you sharing such kind feedback. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.

Summary: This hotel is a perfect location if you want to walk to Disneyland! It sits in between Panera Bread and McDonalds so breakfast on the way to the park is easy. This is an older property but very well maintained and the staff was great. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review! We're delighted that you loved our convenient location and our excellent staff. We truly appreciate your kind words and we hope to welcome you back very soon.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel for the Price for a Disneyland Getaway
Summary: We stayed at this hotel June 28-July 2, 2018. This hotel was very busy and still the staff went over and above to service their guests. The parking fee at the hotel is $19.00 per day, but it is the same price if you park yourself or if you have the valet park your vehicle. I drove down from Northern California after 8 hours of driving, It was appreciated that the valet actually unloaded my car for me and directed me to check in and that hotel staff would bring my bags and other items to my room. The hotel is no more than a 5 min walk to the Disneyland property. The rooms are clean and there are plenty of dining options near the hotel. We decided to extend our stay by one day, and the hotel staff were helpful with making the arrangements and we did not have to change rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're thrilled that you loved our exceptional service and convenient location. We truly appreciate you taking the time to share your kind words.

Summary: We have traveled to Disneyland several times over the years, and decided to try out the Fairfield Inn in order to save some money this trip.  We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel in the past.  The grounds of this hotel are beautiful, and the rooms have all been renovated.  Our room was clean, and the beds were great!  We were right by the pool which we loved, and returned to our hotel every afternoon to go swimming before heading back into the park.  The walk to Disneyland is only about 5 minutes.  The hotel also has a Pizza Hut and game room on the 3rd floor, which we loved. The staff was wonderful.  This is the hotel we are going to stay at for all of our future trips to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review, Petra! We're very happy to hear you enjoyed our great location and amenities. We're thrilled we'll have the chance to welcome you back on your next adventure to the park!

Summary: What can I say about this hotel is it one of the best I stayed in. The location great fir families having a lot of stuff to transfer from car to hotel and disneyland. I would like to thank Patricia on taking care of my request on giving me the location of th room I wanted and provided excellent service. I gave her my concern about my situation traveling with twins and preywife and she was able to make it happen. Marriott scored on this employee keep up the great work and keep getting great people like Patricia.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this wonderful review! We're thrilled our team was able to make your stay special, and that you thoroughly enjoyed your visit. We hope to have the oppportunity to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: Great location. Directly across from Disneyland/California adventure entrance. Comfortable, clean rooms. Quite. No noise problem. Friendly staff.  Plenty of water/drink//snack/ice machines. Disneyland express located right in front of hotel. 2 Thumbs up. Didn’t have time for pool/hot tub. But looked inviting. Will stay again.
Manager Response: Greetings, Sandy! Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us. We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and found our hotel clean, comfortable and convenient for your visit to Disneyland. We can't wait to welcome you back for a five-star stay in every way during your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: We had planned a vacation for just two days once we got to check in they told us we reserved our room as a wheel chair accessible and we even read the confirmation and it did not say that, it indicated a couch and such but we were told there were no more rooms avavaible and also called and requested a higher floor 5 days before and was told they could do that so I’m confused as to why they didn’t mention the wheel chair accessible issue then overall the room was very small but it was clean was just accepting a bigger room for the price.
Manager Response: Hello, and thank you for your review. We're sorry to hear that you were disappointed with the room you received. We will pass along this feedback to our team and review this process. We hope to host you again for a wonderful visit.

Summary: Security is quite good at this hotel, I felt very safe.  The floors in the room were wood and the bed was very comfortable.  It is also close to Disneyland, but my transportation was Urber, who had a hard time locating the front of the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review!

Summary: My family and I stayed here in May and loved it. We stayed in the Jr. suite which was nicely updated.  There was a small living room with a tv and pull out sleeper couch that was away from the windows and doors, which was really nice for afternoon naps for the kids.  The hotel grounds was nice and clean, there’s a Pizza Hut and small snack shop for snacks, drinks, serves Seattle’s best coffee.  The location is great also, less than 5 minute walk to the park entrance and close to Panera Bread, McDonald’s, ihop, etc.
Manager Response: That's what we like to hear, Brenda! Thank you for sharing such a kind review. We hope to host you again sometime soon.

Summary: This hotel is great. It’s a hop, skip and a jump from the entrance to Disneyland; about 5mins to the front gate. The staff are all so friendly (more so than any hotel I’ve stayed at recently), it’s nice being wished a good day when you leave, and being greeted when you return.  The rooms are well maintained and very clean. They are however a little noisy when the plumbing is being used in other rooms, but other than that I heard very little noise from other rooms or floors.  There is a Pizza Hut express on level 3 which is very handy. The shop by reception is well stocked too. It’s also right next to McDonalds and behind Panera bread. You can watch the Disney fireworks from all rooms, views from the upper floors are great as they go off just across the road at 9.30pm. Very good
Manager Response: That's great to hear, Sarah! We're happy you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Quick Trip to Anaheim for Wedding and Disneyland
Summary: I am booked thru Costco Travel and chose this hotel due to the location across from Disneyland Park entrance. I was given an updated room on the 6th floor. The room was a modern look and feel. The water pressure was great. I didn't experience any noise problems. The TV had netflix and hulu access if you have an existing account. The location was great. It was a quick walk over to Disneyland. Many food options nearby, which is very nice. The hotel was clean and the front desk staff were always friendly. Parking was the same price if you park yourself or if you use valet, so use that Valet! I actually like the room without the carpet. I feel like it is easier to tell if it is clean or not. Carpet just traps the cooties. There is a little store in the lobby with drinks, snacks, and
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed our time with us, and we greatly appreciate you sharing your experience here. We hope to welcome you backagain in the future.

Summary: It's a good hotel, close to Disneyland, maybe a 7 minute walk to the main entrance of the parks. Only two things I didn't like about the place was, the floors in the rooms felt dirty when you walked in them, horrible feeling, and the price for self parking an valet parking are the same price, $19.99. Not quite sure why they would charge for self parking at the same price as valet. A few good things within a couple of minutes from the hotel, Panera, McDonald's, IHOP yes IHOP not (IHOB), an Denny's. The price for the rooms are pretty reasonable.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Christopher. We appreciate your feedback about our rooms, and we'll be sure to discuss these concerns with our staff. We're happy to hear you found our location convenient, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again should your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: We recently stay at the Fairfield Inn Anaheim for our short Disneyland stay. Hotel is in a great location, my only recommendation is that the bath towels could do with being refreshed as they are very worn, other this that we had a great stay
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We appreciate your feedback on our towels, and we'll be sure to discuss this with our team. We are glad to hear you found our location convenient for your trip to Disneyland, and we can't wait to welcome you back on another adventure in the future.

Summary: This property recently completed a makeover of the rooms and they look great! The service of so many members of their team outshined the new look. Kevin started things off with a terrific check-in experience, Michelle in group/event sales had outstanding follow-up and Tamara at check-out went above and beyond. This was an amazing experience and I look forward to coming back soon!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share a review with us, Travis! We are so happy to hear our team members took excellent care of you, and we'll pass your compliments along to Kevin, Michelle and Tamara. We can't wait to welcome you again the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: I have stayed at this Fairfield several times in the past, but it's been a few years since my last visit.  The renovations that have been completed at this property since my last stay are incredible!   but let's start at the beginning.  Once we arrived at the hotel for our 5 night stay, the lovely lady at the front desk (I wish I could remember her name) worked on helping us with our requests.  It was just myself and husband travelling, so we had requested a king room.  Not only did she accommodate thsi request, she upgraded us to a higher floor with a premium view!  Totally unexpected and greatly appreciated!  Thank you so much!!!  The room was amazing, the renos are great, and every staff member we interacted with (parking attendant, bellman, front desk, housekeeping, etc)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us. We are delighted to hear you and your husband found our hotel wonderful and our staff friendly and accommodating. We cannot wait to welcome you again the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: Mostly positive things to say about the hotel.  The location is great and the beds are comfy.  The main downside is the noise.  The noise of the air con can be forgiven as its air con but if you have an adjoining room then be prepared to hear everything going on in the other room!  Tried to switch out but they wouldn't move me as there were only 'better rooms' available. Luckily the family did calm down eventually.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We appreciate your feedback regarding the air conditioning in our rooms, and we're happy to hear you found our location convenient for your travels. We hope to welcome you again for a five-star stay in every way in the future.

Summary Heading: My stay in Fairfield Inn & Suite Anaheim
Summary: On arrival I was able to check in right away. The front check in stuff greeted me and acknowledged my Elite status. My check in was fast and easy. The staff was courteous and friendly.  My room was clean and spacious. There was coffee and Tea available in the room. Free Wi Fi was provided. There is a refrigerator in the room. This hotel is infront of Disney Land and there are lots of restaurants to choose from.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a kind review! We appreciate you sharing your experience here, and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn Hotel for 8 days. During our stay the staff have been all so amazing. Housekeeping Daily. Location very good just a small walk to Disney. Maritza the front desk clerk she is AMAZING. Helped out with transport getting to our tours cheaper as oppose to uber. We told her we were here on holiday to celebrate a 21st birthday. We then received a package to our room with a birthday card and goodies for the birthday girl. She was stoked. Thank you Fairfield for a great and friendly stay! Especially to MARITZA. If you can pass it on to her please. She’s an asset. A++
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Sina! We are delighted to hear you had a wonderful stay with us and that Maritza took great care of you. We are happy to have been able to share a birthday with you, and we can't wait to welcome you back the next time you're in Anaheim.

Summary: This hotel has been one of the best hotel we had stayed in. The front desk service was excellent. Special thanks to Marissa and the other front desk lady. Who I regret not getting her name (she's in the morning). Are room was comfortable and super clean. The walking distance to Disneyland was no more than a 5-7 minutes. Which was great because we would go back to our room and rest. And go later on to the park. Plenty of choices where to eat. From our balcony we had the perfect view of the Disneyland fireworks display. We had a wonderful first time experience with Disneyland and the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share a review with us! We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and that our staff took excellent care of you. We look forward to welcoming you again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: Conveniently located near Disneyland entrance. The hotel was remodeled last year and nicely done.  You can get a Disney themed room(for extra money).  The hotel rooms are 1/2 the price of Disney hotel.  There is McDonalds next door and Mimi's Café nearby.  The rooms are comfortable and the TV is 52".  My daughter stay here every time we come for price and you can watch the fireworks right across street for tomorrow land.  Hotel has excellent staff and small pizza restaurant on 3 rd. floor.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the kind review, Barry! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Great location, easy walk to DisneyLand Front desk staff need some customer service training, we arrived half hour after check in time, to be advised room not ready, they advised it maybe still another hour, to leave our phone number & they will text us when ready, their attitude was very off putting. Room was clean & modern, king bed & double bed sofa. tea/coffee maker in room coin operated washer/dryer on site, fantastic to have when traveling.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us, Nadine. We're thrilled you loved our location! We do apologize about the service you encountered, however. This is definitely not up to our standards and we appreciate you filling us in so we can address your concerns internally. We hope to provide you with a five-star stay in the future.

Summary: The overall experience was good.  The rooms look recently renovated and were spacious.  The exterior looks rundown.  the room has a safe inside which was needed given the exterior door was troublesome to open and close.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Adrian. We appreciate your feedback regarding our hotel. We're happy to hear you found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable for your vacation needs, and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star stay in every way in the future.

Summary: The room was fine and updated. We accidentally left an valuable item in the hotel in an obvious place and called back immediately to obtain it. It was mysteriously not there as stated by security and maids. We called Marriott to make a claim and they denied our claim. There are many other Hotel chains and due to the treatment by Marriott through this process they have lost our future business!!!
Manager Response: Greetings, John. We take lost and found issues very seriously at our hotel, and we would like to do more investigating into this matter. We invite you to send us a private message with your contact information and dates of stay so that we may look into this further and reach out to you for follow-up information.

Summary Heading: 5-minute walk to everything plus Marriott quality stay
Summary: Location: 1. Less than 5 minutes to the nearest diner and other fast food restaurants. 2. 5 minutes to Disneyland and California Adventure.  Service and Amenities; 1. We are regular Marriott patrons and this hotel will not disappoint as it exhibits the usual great service from the bell boys, front desk and house keepers. 2. Standard self-service coin laundry is very convenient.   3. Clean rooms and comfortable beddings.
Manager Response: Thank you very much! We're happy to hear you were pleased with your stay in our great location, and we appreciate you sharing such a kind review. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the future!

Summary: Have stayed here 3 times now. It’s a 5 minute stroll to Disneyland and California Land so it’s easy to leave the park to eat at somewhere cheaper like Denny’s or IHOP or MacDonalds or to come back to get changed into something warmer at night. It’s clean. The rooms are a good size, the staff bend over backwards for you. It has parking, a pool and 2 onsite places to eat. Will come to stay again. It’s also an hour by coach to Universal Studios and Hollywood. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! We greatly appreciate you sharing your experience here, and we're thrilled the team made you stay special. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the future!

Summary: This hotel is clean and looks to have had a room makeover in the last few years (although this was the first time we stayed there). We had a 2 Queen guest room which has plenty of space for 2 adults, and I'm sure a family of 4 could fit comfortably in this room. We stayed here because of the proximity to the Disneyland Resort. We arrived very early and the hotel held our bags while we headed into the park, our room was ready around 3pm. We did not use other hotel features and amenities like the pool or the dining options, but the pool was heavily used while we were there. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this wonderful review! We're very happy to hear that you enjoyed your time with us, and we greatly appreciate you sharing your feedback here. We look forward to you next visit!

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights just recently. We had 2 queen size beds in the one room, and still had enough room for our 4 big bags. There was a seperate vanity sink and mirror to the bathroom, which was great for 4 females to get ready. The hotel itself was very central to walk to Disneyland, and lots of nearby restaurants. McDonalds and Panerra Bakery were just out the front, which was very handy for breakies :) The kids appreciated the free Wifi !!
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your review! From our spacious guest rooms to our convenient location, we're so glad you had everything you needed at our hotel. Thank you again and we hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: I've stayed here three times over the last twenty years and have never had a bad experience. As usual the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the convenience of being within ten minute walk to Disneyland is a big plus. The beds are very comfortable and even the hide-a-bed was comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel for everyone who wants a very nice hotel next to Disneyland. Great Staff.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review! We're thrilled that you keep coming back to see us. From our staff to our location to our guest rooms, we're glad you love it all. We'll see you next time!

Summary: Fantastic location near Disney and restaurants. Very clean but basic. Great laundry facilities, games room, food for purchase and use of microwaves and toasters on the 3rd floor. Location is noisy but wouldn't be any different at any of the hotels along that strip. Would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're thrilled to hear that you loved our convenience to Disneyland and our many amenities. We hope to welcome you back for a five-star stay soon to keep the magic going!

Summary: Recently spent 10 nights here as part of a large group booking Amenities were good, good water pressure and clean rooms, housekeeping attended daily excellent proximity to the Parks (10-15 min walk to gates of Park) PIzza Hut on level 3 tasty and prices not too bad Lost a star for locking me out of my room on return from the parks on my second last night as I had not paid for my vehicle in car park. I did not have a vehicle in carpark and took quite some time at front desk tired and exhausted to fix this up to then have  a follow up call to my room as soon as we were let in confirming who I had in the room that would have a car. Otherwise a pleasant stay. Would recommend- rooms suitable for families with vanity outside of bathroom for convenience- we had 2 adults and 2 girls and
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are happy to know you found our location convenient for your visit to Anaheim, and we appreciate your feedback regarding your visit. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in every way.

Summary: Close to Disney with great views of the night time fireworks. There are several restaurants close by and a Pizza Hut and mini mart inside. Staff were great and easy access to rooms with ample parking, would recommend to other families.
Manager Response: Thanks for this wonderful review! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us. Hopefully, we have the chance to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel directly across the street from Disneyland!
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn one night while on a 2-day visit to Disneyland.  The hotel is clean, the staff professional and friendly, the room was a little small, but the bed was comfortable and it had a nice big screen TV in it.  This is an older hotel that has been well maintained.  The room had a Disney theme painted on the walls.  The pool is nice.  The parking is ample and guarded so as to allow only guests to park there.  The hotel is located directly across the street from Disneyland making entry into either park a short 5 minute walk.  The price was reasonable given it's location across from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We truly appreciate all of your positive and constructive feedback! We hope you'll join us again soon for another visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great little hotel right across the street from Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our trip to Disneyland and we have no complaints. It's in a perfect location, right across the street from both parks- you can actually see portions of Magic Kingdom from some of the balconies that face the parks. It's probably a 10 minute walk to the entrance to both.   I gave an excellent rating because of its general closeness to the parks and cleanliness. The rooms were nice and updated, with a Disney theme. No breakfast - but there is a Panera that you have to walk by in the morning to head to the Disney area that worked just fine for us to get coffee and a bagel on our way over (much cheaper than breakfast in the parks!)   Overall a nice hotel that you can stay at without breaking the bank by staying at a Disney hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a great review! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us here, and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Rooms are TINY but location was excellent
Summary: My family and I took my daughter to Anaheim for her 6th birthday and after weeks of planning we decided to stay here because of the close proximity to Disneyland.  At the time, all the hotels inside Disneyland were full so this was our plan B. Let me warn you beforehand the room is super tiny! The bathroom, the sink, the closet, the coffee maker, refrigerator was all bunched up towards the back of the room. It will fit 4 people comfortably but anymore it will be cramped but the closeness to Disneyland made up for it.  You save sooo much precious time driving, parking or shuttling. Disneyland is huge if you have little kids they need a place to rest and nap mid day, this hotel will do the trick since it is right across the street from the entrance.  Will recommend for its
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for sharing your review. We loved hearing that you and your family enjoyed celebrating with us. Thank you for sharing all of your valuable feedback with us and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: We stayed here in October when we came for a quick trip to Disney. It's a bit more money then other hotels, however we liked how close it was the the park. A quick walk across the street and you are there! It was very handy as when we were at the park it was 41 degrees Celsius so it was nice to be able to leave and come back without having to spend to much time away. The room itself was nice and clean. Everything worked well. There is no breakfast included, however there are places around. More fast-food type of locations. But if you are up to walking, about 15-20 minutes away are a number of great restaurants to try from! Would probably stay here again. There was also a pool, which would definitely be a nice way to cool down.   They were also very helpful in booking
Manager Response: Thank you for filling us in about your recent stay. We're thrilled that you loved our location, guest rooms and pool. Should your travels ever bring you back to the area, we hope to welcome you back to our hotel!

Summary: Quick walk to the gates to Disneyland.  Friendly staff and clean facilities.  Easy to hit several places for breakfast on the way to the park as well as a place to eat in the hotel.  Better than parking at the out lots.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! From our location to our staff, we're thrilled that you loved it all. We hope you'll come back and see us again soon!

Summary Heading: Hotel is fine but not your standard Fairfield Inn
Summary: I'm a lifetime Platinum and have stayed in Fairfield Inns all over the country. This is the first one I've encountered that doesn't offer complimentary breakfast. We weren't informed of such at check-in, nor were we told that 1,000 bonus points are offered in lieu of breakfast, In fact, we received no Platinum recognition at all upon check-in.   I even had to ask the gentleman who checked us in about the Platinum arrival gift bonus points (which, until this morning, I assumed would be the standard 200 points). It wasn't until I went downstairs for breakfast that I learned any of this, and was informed that it was spelled out on the website (which, unless they are hiding it well, it is not, nor is it on the confirmation, nor on the app, at least that I can find). In fact, the
Manager Response: Hello, and thank you for taking the time to submit this review. We do apologize for any miscommunication regarding breakfast and points for platinum members. We're sharing this with our team right away for review. We greatly appreciate this feedback and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again in the future for a flawless experience.

Summary: I do not think you can beat the location for the price.  Avoiding the shuttle buses and just walking was amazing.  The rooms are clean and updated.  The view of the fireworks can’t be beat.  The staff is very nice and accommodating.  Had a great vacation and would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this wonderful review, Stacy! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us and we'll be sure to pass along these kind words to the team. We hope to welcome you back again on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel For A Disney Trip
Summary: We opted to stay at this hotel because it is located in front of Disneyland. We figured out that we will be so drained out after a whole day at park, so we decided to make the reservation the morning of our trip. Everything went so smoothly.   It was a bit of a struggle to look for the hotel though. We were circling around Harbor Blvd until we figured out that we have to drive through Panera’s parking lot. Once we pulled through, the hotel’s security mini-kiosk was there.  The room we got was pretty. It was very modern. It was clean. It also came with a mini fridge. The bed was comfy. We can see a little view of Disneyland from our room. The staff were very friendly. We decided to grab food outside at 1am and the valet guys were very easygoing. The 24hr valet service was awesome!
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your review! From our location to our guest rooms and staff, we're thrilled you loved it all. We hope you'll come see us again soon!

Summary Heading: Opposite Disneyland, a walk away affordable. Save money.
Summary: We were a family of 5 (2 adults and 3kids) we had 2 double beds and a fold out single couch. We also had 4 large bags too in the room. The rooms are not big but they are all you need basically to sleep and rest while not at Disneyland. It has one bathroom as well and a small fridge, this is it. The room has aircon too.  The entrance to Disney is literally across the road and there are plenty of options for food in a stretch of 50m.  We also stayed here to go to universal studios too, the drive was over an hour but that’s because we got stuck in peak hour traffic.  Parking is $20 a day at the hotel. There is a pool and also a Pizza Hut in the hotel as well which is handy for a quick dinner. Hotel is right next to McDonald as well and a short walk to Denny’s, ihop and other
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're thrilled that your family loved our convenient location and our pool. We truly appreciate all of your valuable feedback and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary Heading: Hard to get in, Average Rooms
Summary: Yes, the staff are nice and the location is across from Disneyland, but...we couldn't figure out how to get into the hotel! You have to drive into the Panera parking lot to the back. Then you see a podium where a person is sitting. You realize this is how you enter the hotel parking lot. The person greets you, gets your info, informs you it's $19/day to park (UGH!) then moves some cones so you can get in. Talk about a gated community! That's problem #1. Problem #2, not enough parking! You are forced to use valet parking - where they double-park cars in a few areas of the lot so they can shuffle them as people need their cars again. Build a small parking deck in the back or something! The rooms weren't modern, but the TV was HUGE and bolted to the dresser. So, not impressed with
Manager Response: Hi, Regina. We thank you for taking the time to submit this review. We're sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your stay, and we'll be sure to pass along your feedback to the team. We hope to have the chance to welcome you back on your next visit for a 5-star experience.

Summary Heading: Great location for a reasonable price
Summary: We stayed here for 5 days to visit Disneyland and Universal Studios, and the location was perfect.  It is right across the street from Disneyland and there is easy access to the freeways to go to Universal Studios and the airport.  The rooms are big and clean.  The hotel itself does not have a lot of amenities, but it is surrounded by anything you need, including restaurants, fast-food places, and shops.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're thrilled that you loved our location and guest rooms. We so appreciate you taking the time to share this with us and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: I travelled with my Mom (80), and my two daughters (14 & 12).  I requested a ground floor room as long distance walking is challenging for my Mom.  They booked us close to the lobby and closer to the Disney side of the hotel.  Thank you very much as this location was perfect for us with close pick up at the round-about and closer to the Disney side of the hotel. The staff were friendly, accommodating, professional, and always greeted us with a smile and "how can we help you."  The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were dreamy (you could sink right into them).  The hotel was very safe, and the quiet hours from 10pm to 8am were always adhered to which was greatly appreciated when resting up for the next day adventure at Disneyland.  We spent a total of 8 days at this
Manager Response: We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we greatly appreciate you taking the time to let us know. We pride ourselves on excellent guest services, so we're pleased to hear we delivered on this for your family and that you were able to rest and enjoy your time together while recovering from days spent in Disney. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we can't wait to welcome you for another memorable vacation.

Summary: When I joined my brother's reservation at this hotel, I was a bit nervous staying in a room with outside access. But once I got there, I realized how safe it is with the parking attendant and also the bell personnel at the entrance. Also you need a key card to get access to the stairwell. The hotel staff gave my brother's family and I an adjoining room which was really amazing! My nephews were able to come and hang out with me at any time. Like if we had a suite. The beds are very comfortable and we can't hear the neighbours. The TV are huge and you can sign into your netflix account which was good to put cartoons for the kids. We did rent a movie on our last night but it kept buffering. After 15 minutes we had enough so called the front desk and they removed the charges. We
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this delightful review with us, Sophie. We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know. We pride ourselves on exceptional guest services, and we love knowing that we were able to deliver on this promise for you. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary Heading: Clean, Comfortable room a short walk from Disney's main entrance
Summary: This hotel offers great value if you can find a good deal on it. Parking was $19 per day but didn't bug us because we arrived at 10am, 6 hours before check-in, and they let us park at the hotel. We were in the Disney security line less than 10 minutes after parking our car. The room was clean and had a nice size refrigerator for milk for cereal and soda. The beds were comfy and the room had all the basic amenities. We were initially concerned when we approached our room, as it was facing the VERY LOUD I-5 freeway, but the second we closed the door the noise disappeared completely. There is a Panera Bread and McDonald's at the front of the property. This property is VERY CLOSE to the Disney main entrance. You would spend 2 to 3 times as much to get any closer and that would be in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us. We are delighted to hear that you found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable. We're happy to know our location was convenient for your recent visit to Disneyland, and we hope to welcome you back the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: There are lots of hotels close to Disneyland so if there is something that makes the Fairfield Inn stand out it is great customer service!    After spending all day at Disneyland we came back to our room exhausted.  My daughter had a Minnie blanket she brought from home.  When we opened the door the blanket had been turned into a big Minnie bow on the bed!  We were all so tired from the long day at Disney but that gesture was amazing!  The housekeeper's name was Patricia and we spoke to her the next day to thank her.  She was very kind and obviously hard working.  I really hope her employer's give her some special recognition because it is small things like that that make a trip memorable!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We're thrilled that you enjoyed our service as well as our location. We hope to be your hotel of choice for future visits!

Summary: Great location, easy walking distance with young kids to Disney parks. Also great food right around the hotel.  Room was clean and staff was great.  I would stay here again in the future.   9nly thing is paid parking for guests.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review, Joshua. We appreciate your feedback concerning our parking costs, and we're delighted to hear you found our rooms well-appointed and clean and our location convenient for your travels. We hope to welcome you again in the future!

Summary: Truly we can not say enough about our experience here at the Anaheim Fairfield Inn. From the moment we arrived until we checked out, the staff was absolutely amazing. Greeting us every mornnig on our way out of the hotel, and welcoming us back every evening. Top notch customer service! Our room was on the 2nd floor a little above the lobby. Super clean room and immediately after check in, they brought us extra towels and pillows as I had requested through the Marriott App. Bed was comfortable. You could hear some outside noise, but really didn’t bother us at all. Hotel in perfect location too. Very easy walk to the main entrance to Disneyland. Was able to go back to hotel mid day to recharge for more Disney fun later in the day. Nice to have the Pizza Hut express in the hotel
