Manager Response: Ann, we can't thank you enough for this amazing review. We appreciate you sharing your experience here and we're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland - but that's about it
Summary: Pros:  - Short walk to Disneyland - Panera outside was open early - Room was clean - Couldn't hear outside noise inside room - Staff was polite and professional  Cons: - Room was sooooo small (like as small as possible) - Because the window was on the walkway, we had to keep the blinds shut at all times, making our tiny room feel like a windowless cave - We had a room on the 5th floor facing the park (ideal, but certainly nothing special), but there were a lot of rooms overlooking the freeway or right over the pool area, where people would slam the gate at all hours. I couldn't imagine being in one of those rooms - it would be awful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. While we're thrilled that you loved our convenience to Disneyland and our staff, we're sorry that not every aspect of your stay was as seamless. We hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience very soon.

Summary: Front desk staff horrible. Parking and room staff pleasant. Room very basic and not set up for 4 adults/teenagers. Beds incredibly uncomfortable. Medium walk to Disneyland and restaurants. Grandkids enjoyed pool and gift shop.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We are disappointed to hear you did not experience exceptional customer service, and we appreciate you letting us know. We will be sure to discuss this with our team. We are happy to hear your grandchildren enjoyed our pool area. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to improve upon your experience.

Summary: We stayed here for four nights and felt this is a good hotel not great.  All of the staff was  extremely friendly which was very welcome.  The reception area was quite nice.   The rooms were recently remodeled and were well done.  The distance to Disneyland made for an easy walk over each morning and we were even able to stroll back over midday one day when we wanted to for our kids to take naps.    Negatives:  Only two real negatives.  While they did a great job remodeling we were placed on the freeway side of the hotel and the traffic noise was VERY apparent in our 6th floor room.  They definitely needed to replace the windows with better windows for a better sound isolation as it was annoying and not enjoyable.  Second the beds we had in our room were definitely as firm as
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review. While we're delighted you enjoyed our friendly and welcoming staff and proximity to Disneyland, we're sorry other aspects of your stay did not live up to our standards or your expectations. We'll be sure to pass your feedback along to our management team.

Summary: “Meh” was the only thing that came to mind after staying at this hotel.  If you are going to Disneyland, it is definitely an easy walk especially with kids.  That and the Pizza Hut with an arcade for the kids were the only real positives in my book. The pool looked out to the parking lot.  The parking was expensive considering we were there for less than 24 hours but got charged 2 full days of parking.  And the rooms...I hope I misread an earlier review that said the rooms had recently been renovated.  Just because they may have new laminate wood flooring does not make them “renovated”.  They are actually quite bad.  From the walls to the popcorn ceilings.  And super noisy.  I actually can’t believe Marriott put their name on this hotel...
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your candid feedback. We're sorry to hear that we didn't exceed your expectations and we appreciate you letting us know why so we can learn from this. We hope to have the opportunity to improve upon your experience in the future.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, nice rooms, small pool
Summary: The location was perfect for our family trip to Disneyland.  We had our children and grandchildren with us so it was very easy to walk to Disneyland and back to the room if needed during the day.  We arrived at 5pm for a 6 night stay.  It is kind of confusing to find and enter the hotel. Turn in off of Harbor Blvd. into Panera Bread(if going South you will need to go to the signal and flip a U turn as you cannot cross Harbor).  You will see a parking attendant prior to the hotel who will look up your reservation and give you a parking pass for your car.  Once at the hotel you can valet or self park for $19 per day.  We opted for valet and it was very convenient and the parking staff were great.  The hotel is not like most Fairfield Inn's.  It is 10 stories and has several wings
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us after your recent visit! We appreciate your feedback regarding the lack of notification that your final room was ready and will discuss this with our team. We're happy to hear you found our location convenient for your travels and our guest rooms well-arranged. Should your travels bring you back to Disneyland and Anaheim, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary: We traveled as a family group and stayed in 3 rooms with 2 queen beds each.  There were 3 children under 6 years old and 6 adults.  Rooms were very clean which we really appreciated with 3 little ones toddling around!  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Location is a short walk to Disneyland - especially appreciated when taking young ones back and forth for mid-day naps and at the end of the day when we were all a little footsore!  We stayed on the 7th floor facing the expressway so there was a fair amount of traffic noise but everyone was so tired at the end of the day we had no trouble falling asleep.  The heating/air conditioning unit has an individual thermostat on the wall, but is the standard motel under-the-window fan unit so it was fairly noisy.  No continental
Manager Response: We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, Terrie! We love knowing that you found our location perfect for your travels with little ones, and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know. We're happy to be your home away from home, and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: Stayed here for its easy access to Disneyland Resort where I had business meetings for 3 days. Comfortable and quiet rooms with walking access to the conference hotel in the Disney property.  Exceptionally quiet versus many other Disney or near Disney properties where I’ve stayed.  Easy walking access to Panera one of my healthy eating choices when on the road.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this review with us, Dallas. We're delighted to hear you found our property quiet and convenient for your recent visit to Anaheim, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: This is my second time staying at this hotel, first time since the remodel.  I love the updates they made to the rooms.  The hard flooring was nice since when we returned from the beach, my kids brought half the beach with them in their suits and the sand was a quick easy sweep for housekeeping.  The front desk and housekeeping were very forgiving and friendly about the sandy mess as well which I appreciated.  It is an easy walk to Disney.  I would stay here again because it seems one of the nicer of the ones within walking distance without having to pay Disney hotel prices.  The pull out chair is a deciding factor as well since it gives each of my kids a spot to sleep and the occupancy is 5 instead of 4.  I would recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for this lovely review! We're thrilled to hear you love our new look, and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know. We're also happy to know you found our guest rooms spacious and our location perfect for your recent visit to the area. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: Our family of 4 booked this place for 3 nights through Costco. Clean, friendly staff and short walk to DLR! Our room had some nice Disney touches and beds were fairly comfy. Good choice if wanting to save money by staying off-site but want the convenience of a quick walk to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us after your recent visit to Anaheim. We're delighted to hear you found our guest rooms comfortable and our location convenient, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for another stay in the future.

Summary: I always stay here when I visit Disneyland. The staff are amazing, the rates are good, the rooms are clean and recently refurbished, the lighting is FANTASTIC! You can actually see in the room! There is a great TV selection, free WiFi, complimentary breakfast, valet parking at the same rate as self park. It’s a 5 minute walk from the park. I really can’t fault it. Oh and the beds are some of the best I’ve slept in! Comfy as all get out with amazing pillows, which you really need after walking around Disneyland all day! This will always be my first choice. Multiple visits and it only gets better.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this lovely review with us! We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and found our rooms spacious and comfortable. We can't wait to have you stay with us again on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: We have stayed here a few times when we go to Disneyland.  It’s a short walk to the park.  If you have small children consider a stroller.  Good accommodations and food options in and around for quick dining. Ask for rooms to view Fireworks/Park for extra enjoyment.  Small pool for kids to cool off.  Front Desk is alway accommodating.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Jodi. We're pleased to hear you enjoyed your visit and found our location convenient for your recent visit to Disneyland. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in every way.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay. Loved how close it was to Disneyland. Easy walk. Staff was great. Room was always clean. It’s close to many restaurants.  Panera bread is right out front which made breakfast easy and delicious. Will definitely stay again
Manager Response: We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, Kelly, and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: This resort is very close to Disneyland and California Adventure Parks .Being an older style building the room was very quiet. The laundry facilities were a bonus and whilst small were most adequate. There were a choice of breakfast spots close by and the pizzas in the hotel were good. The staff were very helpful and all were polite and courteous. This would have to be the cleanest accommodation that I have every stayed in. Spotless room.
Manager Response: We're thrilled to hear this! Thank you for such a great review. We look forward to hosting you again on your next visit!

Summary Heading: Clean, close to Disney but loud!!
Summary: This is a nicely refurbished property.  Rooms are clean, spacious and the beds comfortable.  This is an outdoor hallway entry hotel...not my preference.  The room's only window opened onto the hallway so no privacy and little light.   We had a junior suite which had 2 queens, a single sleeper chair and a larger sleeper sofa.  The sofa was in an alcove (with no windows) with its own desk and tv, perfect for my teen.    The HVAC is an old style unit under the window and loud.  Insulation is poor between rooms and floors and as there a ton of kids, it was extremely loud.  Bathroom is a split tub/toilet and sink/dressing area.  Great water pressure in the shower.  The location is the reason to stay,  less than five minutes walk to both disney properties.  Given the location, the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us. From our guest rooms to our location, we're glad you enjoyed your stay. We do apologize for the noise you experienced and we appreciate you letting us know. We hope to welcome you back for a seamless stay in the future.

Summary: My family of five stayed here for five nights in February 2018.  We had connecting rooms on the ninth floor.  (I paid extra for a premium view before I realized there would be no fireworks.)  It was nice to be on the top, though the hotel is very soundproof so I imagine we wouldn't have heard upstairs neighbors.    Rooms were super clean.  Our housekeeper, Claudia, was awesome.  She did an excellent job straightening the room, and she always made cute animals with the kids' security blankets and towels.  Plus, she was very sweet.  It was so nice to return from a day at the parks to a tidied room.    Biscuits for sale on the 3rd floor let us get to the park on time most mornings.  They may be $4 each, but they were a good hot start to the day and a nice option instead of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us! We're happy to hear you enjoyed a five-star stay and found our staff friendly and accommodating. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again!

Summary Heading: Basic, comfortable hotel walking distance to parks
Summary: I’ve stayed at this hotel a few times and have always had good experiences.  I like the room remodel with the sliding door closing off the bathroom area from the bed area.  Makes it easier for people to get ready earlier while others sleep.  Front desk, valet and housekeeping are always friendly and polite.  Air units are very loud, I had to wear earplugs to drown out the sound.  A pretty basic hotel, but comfortable and I find it slightly nicer than some of the other hotels on the street.    This trip we did have a room facing the Courtyard pool park.  There is a bucket with a bell feature that is very loud, even with the door closed, and goes off constantly once the water park opens.  For anyone looking to do afternoon breaks or naps I would recommend requesting a room not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Amy. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and that our staff provided the friendly, exceptional customer service we strive to share with all of our guests. Thank you for your feedback regarding room locations and sounds. We hope to welcome you back for a five-star stay in every way during your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: This property is conveniently directly across the street from Disneyland, but being near the happiest place in the world does not mean you will encounter the happiest or friendliest people here. The front desk team was very dismissive and short with me and I observed that with other guests in line ahead of me. Yes, they are a big and busy hotel but a smile takes no time to give and a friendly “hello” takes 2 seconds. Each time I would ask a question I was spoken to like I couldn’t comprehend basic English (I received this treatment from each front desk staff I encountered during the entire stay), and when I asked for any floor but the first they said all the rooms were taken… but I arrived at check in time and there were multiple people waiting in line behind me so I highly
Manager Response: We're very disappointed to hear about your experience with our front desk team, Bree. We strive to provide top-notch service to all of our guests, and we apologize for missing the mark during your stay. We appreciate your feedback regarding room pricing, hotel layout and sound as well. We'll be certain to share this with our team for review as a learning experience, and we hope to have the chance to welcome you back again in the future for a flawless visit.

Summary: Really enjoyed our 4 nights at this hotel last week.  We were able to check into our 2 rooms a few hours early on arrival.  Friendly staff.  Rooms were quiet and clean.  So close to Disneyland entrance!  Enjoyed the breakfast items they served at the Pizza hut, made breakfast time fast and easy.  No complaints and would stay here again.  Staff helpful in booking our transport back to airport when it was time to leave.
Manager Response: We love to hear this! Thank you very much for such a kind review. We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: This hotel is a 5 minute walk to the shuttle entrance to Disneyland. It is really a 5 story motor inn since all the rooms entrances are located outdoors. The rooms are newly remodeled in the modern sparse style. The bath products were shampoo and conditioner only. It felt like a solid three star experience. The staff was friendly and there is a Pizza Hut express on the 3rd floor that was helpful because there is not a free breakfast included at this hotel. If you want a close walk to Disneyland with a basic hotel/motel room this is a decent option. Our friends stayed at the La Quinta that had a bigger room and breakfast but required a shuttle that they provided.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We're sorry to hear that not every aspect of your stay was as seamless as we would have hoped. We appreciate all of your valuable feedback and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience soon.

Summary Heading: Great location...easy 5 min walk to Disneyland!
Summary: This particular Fairfield Inn is much better than most. The location is ideal for Disneyland...quick 5 minute walk! The hotel is also steps to Panera, Mimi’s & McDonalds. The staff is very friendly & professional. They just renovated the rooms so they look nice & are well appointed. My choice for a reasonably priced hotel within walking distance to Disney!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this thoughtful review with us. We're happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your stay with us and found our location convenient for your vacation needs. We're also glad to know our staff provided exceptional guest service, and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know. We hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in every way during a return visit.

Summary Heading: Not the worst hotel in Anaheim
Summary: Pros: Friendly staff Friendly parking valet except they parked by vehicle in an area that the sprinklers were going and with dirty water because I could barley see out of my windows and had to get a car wash  Close to the parks Pizza Hut in the hotel is great option for hungry kids  Cons: (there are several) -The pool and hot tub were absolutely disgusting. The hot tub is so nasty that the white stairs are partly yellow and slimy.  -The pillows and blankets in our room were dirty (one pillow even had wet toilet paper that had dried on it) -Do not try to give your little ones (at a hotel close to Disney) a bath because the non slip design on the bottom of the tub is absolutely horrible on their skin. -The hotel is fairly difficult to access via vehicle, now I will say that there
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your candid review with us. We truly value all of our guests' input. We're sorry to hear that your stay did not exceed your expectations like we would have hoped, and we appreciate you filling us in on your experience. We will be sure to address your concerns internally and hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in the future.

Summary: I really liked this hotel. It's the perfect location if you're going to be visiting Disneyland, easy short walk to the entrance. Plus heaps of food options near by, if your not eating in the park.  I was there for Disney and Disney only, so I don't have a bunch of useful advice, except it's just a great place to stay if Disneyland is your focus.  They also have themed rooms, which is really great if you want that extra Disney feel. We had the Cars themed room, and it was really well done. As someone who has stayed in a Disney hotel, I can say our room was really well decorated/Disney-fied. BUT they only have a limited amount of themed rooms, so if you are set on having one, you need to book early, or so I've heard... The beds were great too, really high & comfy (which is sooo
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this review with us! We're delighted to have been your home away from home during your recent visit to Disney. We are also pleased to hear you found our guest rooms comfortable. We know how important comfort is while traveling. Should your travels bring you back to Disneyland, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary: We chose this hotel because it is a Marriott hotel and because it is across the street from Disneyland and just a few minutes walk.  We stayed 4 nights in a king room.  The room was good sized for the 2 of us.  The bed was comfortable.  Our room was clean upon check in, and had been refreshed by the time we returned in the evening.  If we go back to Disneyland, we would stay here again.  NOTE:  Unlike every other Fairfield Inn we've stayed at, this one does NOT have a complimentary breakfast.  They charge $3.29 for a 12 oz. bottle of milk; I can buy an entire gallon for less than that!!  There is a mini frig in the room so you might want to bring your own drinks and snacks to avoid paying these outrageous prices.    And beware ... they charge $19/day to park your car.
Manager Response: Hello, and thank you for taking the time to submit this review. We're glad to hear you enjoyed your time in our great location, and we appreciate your feedback regarding breakfast and pricing as well. We hope to be able to host you again on your next visit.

Summary: We were here for a couple days. It is close to Disneyland and the price is OK. But be carefull. We had a room to freeway side. There it is allways loud. Bad for young Kids and babys. The Other side is fine. At the 3rd floor you‘ll find a Pizza hut.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this review. We're happy to hear you enjoyed our location and your overall stay with us. We appreciate your feedback regarding our proximity to traffic noise as well.

Summary Heading: On the nicer end for hotels across from Disneyland
Summary: This is my second time staying at this hotel. It seems they renovated it compared to the first time I stayed. I was happy they removed the carpeting and think more hotels should do this.  This hotel is one of the nicer affordable hotels across from Disneyland. It still is a short walk to the main entrance into the park and can seem long when you spent all day there.  The staff were all very nice and held our bags while we were waiting for our room to be ready. Once our room was ready we received a text.   I did book a room with a park view but our room was not high enough to actually see the park. We did face the front but wouldn’t have paid extra if I would have known I wouldn’t actually have a view.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review, Kailey! We're happy to hear you like the improvements that we've made, and that our staff was able to make your visit special. We appreciate your feedback regarding the park view room as well, and we'll share this with our team. We hope to welcome you again in the future!

Summary: We stayed here for a girls trip to Disneyland to celebrate our birthdays.  Hotel is located almost directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.   There is plenty of parking or you can choose valet.  Hotel has been updated & is super clean & Modern. Each room has laminate flooring instead of carpet.    Two queens & pullout sofa bed room was large, but sofa bed is only a twin & really uncomfortable for an adult.  They could have put a larger sofa bed if they had moved the beds over.   Rooms have small refrigerators but no microwave. Large TV's. They do not offer free breakfast, but Pizza Hut & Panera Bread on property offer breakfast.  Definitely worth the price for the location. Will choose this hotel again.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a wonderful review, Patty! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us, and greatly appreciate you sharing your experience here. We look forward to hosting you again on your next visit!

Summary: This hotel was one of my favourites from this trip.  It was nice and quick (walking) to Disneyland.  It meant we could visit the parks come back, relax by the pool, then go back to the parks at night.  The room itself was comfortable, well kept, clean, modern and relaxing.  I loved the Disney touches throughout the hotel.  Our only bad thing was that our room keys stopped working, apparently the battery stopped working, and it took awhile for someone to come and fix it, while we sat outside.  All in all, out of the other 2 hotels I have stayed at within Anaheim (all walking distance), this is my favourite.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us, Rebecca. We're delighted to see that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us and found our location perfect for your visit to Disneyland. We're happy to be your home away from home when in Anaheim, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: Loved it.   Definitely a resort I would stay at again . Location is excellent as it’s located in front of Disneyland and restaurants of your choice .  .  Although room is typical small motel (hotel ?) , it’s very clean and modern . They have hardwood floors & pocket door that separates the bed area from the bathroom & sink . Room also has mini refrigerator, iron & board,  coffee maker, hair dryer & a safe.  I like that although sink isn’t very large , they installed 2 small shelves to allow you to place your personal items on them , giving you more space and keeping things neat. On the 3rd floor there is Pizza Hut , small eating space with microwave, toaster, arcade & gym .  People are also very friendly & courteous.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us. We appreciate both your positive and constructive feedback following your recent visit. We're happy to hear you and your family found our location excellent, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: I called the day before we arrived to confirm our room reservation and was told we would receive free parking during our stay. When we got to the checkin the next day we were told that this was an error and we were asked to prove that we had called and who had I spoken to? We were then given the run around and told no we would not get free parking.We paid almost 100.00 to park our 2 cars. Our room was not worth the large sum that we paid each night. The towels were stained there was dirt on the bathroom floor. The maid was banging on our door at 8:30 the next morning. I wondered why, if they clean the rooms at 8:30 in the morning, we can't check in until after 4:oo in the afternoon? We will not stay here again I thought that the Marriott name on the hotel would be a guarantee of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We're concerned about your experience and will pass this information along to our management team.

Summary: Spent one night during our Disneyland trip. We booked a total of 3 rooms. The room my husband and I spent the night in was in the 6th floor, it was clean, the beds were comfortable, we slept so nice after 12 hrs. of walking all over Disneyland. Room was stocked with towels, hair drier, free coffee, and some free goodies such as shampoo, facial soap, etc. I did not use these because I brought my own, but it is helpful to have them just in case. The hotel is right across Disneyland, it has a couple of pools and next to it, there is a Panera, McDonalds(was closed), IHOP, etc. We will definitely consider it for a second stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! It's wonderful to hear that you loved our guest rooms, amenities and location. We truly hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: Fantastic hotel!  Clean, great amenities, Paul Mitchell toiletries and so close to Disney.  After a long day at Disney the pool was a hit with the kids and the hot tub was a hit with me!  Could not have cared less that it was near the parking lot.  Got given a room beside the elevators at first but it was so loud with the elevators and ice machine that we asked to switch. If you get given this room, switch, you will not be able to sleep!  They gave us an upgrade to a view room.  Had the pizza hut for dinner one night (very greasy but no surprise!).  The Panera next door has great food and we had it delivered to our room twice.  We asked for a very extended check out as our flight back to Aus wasn't until 10:30pm.  They let us check out at 6pm for USD100.  Fair enough as it
Manager Response: Thank you for this fantastic review! We're sorry to hear about the noise from your initial room, but we're glad our team was able to provide an upgrade. We appreciate you sharing your experience here and we hope to welcome you back again in the future for another amazing experience!

Summary: Loved this hotel. The staff was great. The elevator was never a long wait. The room was clean and modern. It was across the street from Disneyland so the walk to Disneyland was quick. We had electric scooters that the hotel charged for us every night. I was a bit disappointed with my “view” room but we didn’t spend a lot of time there. My husband enjoyed the pool...it was 95 degrees in November! We got coffee and pastries and breakfast at the Panera in the front of the hotel. I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a wonderful review, Millie! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us and we appreciate your feedback regarding your room view. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the future!

Summary: Stayed there for three nights in early January with my husband and daughter.  It is across the street from Disneyland, approximately a 10 minute walk from our hotel room to the entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure.  We could hear the fireworks from our room, but they were not too loud.  Staff was very friendly from check in to check out.  There is not a lot of sound proofing.  Street noise as well as people conversing outside in the corridors were quite prominent.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review, Patty! We appreciate you sharing your experience here, as well as your feedback. We hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: The rooms were very clean and quite comfortable.  Great  location for our Disney family vacation.  Plenty of eateries within walking distance.  Disneyland resort was across the street from the hotel.  Hotel does not offer a continental breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review. We appreciate you sharing your experience here and we're happy you enjoyed your time with us. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: We stayed here two nights for a short Disneyland trip.  We opted for a room with a view, but we were never there during the fireworks so I'm not sure how good the view is.  You can see Disneyland from the room though.  The hotel is not right across the street from the entrance, but it's close enough!  I love the location. The rooms are normal sized, not too big, but enough room for families.  The lobby was nice and the check in clerks were great.  We valeted, but self parking is available.  The valet staff was quick and friendly.  This hotel has a gift shop with lots toiletries and snacks in case you forgot anything.  There is a pizza place on the 3rd floor, but it isn't open after Disney closes, so don't expect to get anything late at night. We will definitely stay here again
Manager Response: Thank you for such a wonderful review! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us here, and we look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.

Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for a few nights.  The proximity to Disney was great.  The hotel is a motel style which put me off a little, but honestly that was just because I wasn't used to it - it's not as common in the midwest.  We didn't do much except sleep & shower here, but the rooms were updated with a nice tv.  I always felt safe and secure here. The hotel was close enough to walk back midday to refresh and walk back to the parks in the evening.  I've booked another trip at this hotel - can't wait!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the kind review, Amy! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us enough to book a second stay. We look forward to hosting you again soon!

Summary: Loved how close to Disney this hotel was. We enjoyed the hot tub and size of room. Beds need an upgrade as they squeaked when you got up and we’re uncomfortable.  Water in rooms is rather pricey.... especially coming from a hotel where water bottles were given to you daily as well as our next hotel offered free water bottles.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Stephanie. We're happy to hear you enjoyed our great location, and we appreciate your feedback regarding our beds and the waters as well. We hope we have the opportunity to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary: The room we stayed in was clean and modern.  The location to Disney was fantastic.  It took about 8 minutes from our room to the Disney gates.  There is a Panera just outside the hotel that you can pickup breakfast from on the way to the parks.    The pool at this Fairfield seemed small and not as fun as the Courtyard next door.  There also was no free breakfast.  But given the relative price and the proximity to Disney, I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback! We're delighted that you loved our location and guest rooms. We also truly value and appreciate your constructive input. We hope to provide you with a five-star stay in the future!

Summary: The staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival. They gave us tips on visiting Disneyland, which is only across the road! It was very easy to walk there. The rooms are more spacious than I imagined, and they are very clean and modern. A great start to our trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We're thrilled that you loved our staff, guest rooms and location. We so appreciate your generous feedback!

Summary: The best part of this Fairfield is the location. Walk to Disneyland entrance is 7minutes. That part makes up for quite a bit!  There’s a basic swimming pool and hot tub (out of order part of our stay).  The small rooms have been updated since we stayed previously. Now, with laminate flooring and newer decor is an improvement. Big TV with Netflix access was nice. WIFI worked fine too. Small fridge in room and coffee maker. Must go to 3rd Floor to use microwave.  Also on 3rd Floor is a gym, arcade and Pizza Hut with limited menu. This was nice to have in the building and we enjoyed their chicken wings a couple of times. They do serve a breakfast (not included) but we didn’t try it. Looked like fast food style egg muffins and hash browns. But their Seattle’s best coffee was tasty!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your honest review. While we're glad you enjoyed our location, we're sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy a seamless stay in every way. We appreciate all of your feedback and we hope to provide you with a five-star stay in the future.

Summary: We stayed for two nights and the overall experience was very good.  The Good It was a short walk to Disneyland. We booked a premium view and it was worth it. We were on the 9th floor with the windows facing Disneyland. It was great having the option to watch the fireworks, especially with a sleepy and tired 3 year old who was able to comfortably sleep while we were able to enjoy the show.  The Bad The bed was fine; however, the box springs should be replaced. We had two queens in the room and both beds have this issue.The box spring creaks as you get up from the bed which was not a big deal to me, but may be annoying to someone else.  The Ugly  We did not get a printout through the door, so I requested one at checkout. I noticed 3 parking charges when we only stayed for 2
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We truly appreciate both your positive and constructive feedback. We will be sure to share this with our team in hopes that we can exceed your expectations in every way possible in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for 5 days and were very pleased at the hotel services, cleanliness, and staff. We were treated very nicely, and accommodated anytime we needed something. We will come back here next time we visit Disneyland. Front desk staff put balloon in my in laws room to start the celebration of the their anniversary! Pizza Hut on the 3rd floor was very hand, when wanting a snack to eat breakfast, lunch or dinner. The coffee was good too. Gift shop had some booze handy also....
Manager Response: What a pleasure it was to read your review! From our staff to our on-site dining, we're so glad our hotel was perfect for your travels. We hope you'll come see us again soon!

Summary: I'm a Marriot fan and the this Fairfield did not disappoint! With all the business that was going on here the staff were awesome! The room was clean and quaint and a great view of Disneyland!! The hotel was clean all the way around!! We are frequenters of Disneyland and enjoyed our stay here! Can't speak enough to the location!! Will stay here again!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! From our staff to our guest rooms, we're thrilled you loved it all. We hope to welcome you back very soon!

Summary: We stayed here with a wonderful room with balcony looking over at Disneyland. We could see Space Mt to the Pier and lots in between. We were looking forward to the fireworks but it was Santa Ana winds and it was canceled. It was the night the Thomas fire started ☹️. Easy walk to Disneyland. We went and ate at ESPN Zone. Great hotel. You can buy and print your tickets there in the lobby.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms and convenient location. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: Stayed at the Fairfield this month on an impromptu trip to Disneyland. Paid extra for the ‘premium’ room with a view of the park and it was highly worth it. The top floor was quiet, GREAT view, and our room must have recently been refurbished because it was in fantastic shape. The staff was VERY friendly, proximity to the parks is perfect, and I would very much stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay, from our views to our staff. We truly appreciate your kind words!

Summary: I give this hotel 5 stars based on location only.  The towels were worn and needed to be replaced. The rooms have been updated but the exterior of building has not. I don't like having to enter my hotel room from the outside like an old Motel. Parking fee was ridiculous but we got such a low price on our room, that it helped balance that out. I loved having Panera next door for a breakfast stop before we entered Disneyland. This hotel is close enough to Disneyland that I would have felt safe walking back to room alone.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful 5-star review! We're happy you enjoyed your time with us, and we appreciate your feedback regarding the design of the hotel, as well as pricing, and will share this with our team.

Summary Heading: Great location and experience for visiting Disneyland
Summary: I found a great price for staying here in the middle of December and decided to take a chance. I'm so glad we did.  My husband and I stayed three nights.  While parking was just under $20 per night, it was simple and easy to use.  I'm a Marriott Rewards member so I asked in advance for a quiet room away from the elevators and was put on the 8th floor facing Disneyland. We caught the fireworks on one night and it was great.  It was a very quiet room and even with the laminate floors we were only awakened early on our last morning. Two out of three wasn't bad.  The bed was really comfortable, the shower very good, the wifi adequate  (although not secure) and overall we were pleased with our stay.  There is also a small fridge included which was handy.  We never once turned on the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us! We're delighted to hear you found our rooms comfortable and quiet. We know how important a good night's sleep can be while traveling. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again on your next visit to the area.

Summary: We stayed eight nights at the Fairfield Inn in a top-floor room facing the Disney resort parks.   The room wasn’t ready for early check-in so we stored our luggage and went to Downtown Disney to wait for a text message telling us the room was ready. It was ready around 3pm.  Our two-queen-bed room had been recently renovated with wood-look floors and a lovely Disney-themed wallpaper mural covering one wall. Staff are friendly and helpful.   We found the room spacious enough for the three of us (two adults and one six year old) to rest in. Everything was clean and the pillows and bed were comfortable. There was plenty of space in the walk-in wardrobe area for our suitcases.  As we stayed during the first two weeks of December, before the holiday crush, we had no problem getting
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful and detailed review, Viola! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us in our great location and we greatly appreciate you sharing such fantastic feedback here. We hope to welcome you again in the future.

Summary: We have stayed here before.  We visit Disneyland every Christmas season and prefer to stay at a Marriott.  There are several local choices.  This one is the least expensive across the street from the park.  Your tip is to ask for a room facing Disneyland vs. the Freeway.  It is much quieter and you can see the fireworks show.  They have quick cheap food onsite and very close to many restaurants. They have a pool. Parking is $19 a day.  If you are looking for the nicest property, keep looking, but since we're at the Park all day we just need a place to sleep.  Beds are not great. Pay more and stay at the Marriott Suites if you want a higher end experience. For the price it's ok.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us. We are happy to be your home away from home for your visit to Disneyland, and we're happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in every way.

Summary: My mom, my 2 girls, and I stayed for a 10 day trip. Thr hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. It was a nice short walk to Disneyland's front gate, as well as food. Self-parking can be a bit of a struggle to find a spot but they offer valet for the same daily price. This really is a wonderful location to stay with the added bonus of a park view, because you can watch the fireworks from the balcony
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us. We're delighted to hear you found our location convenient for your recent visit to Disneyland, and that our staff was friendly and accommodating. Should your travels return you to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary: All staff are very friendly and helpful. Clean. Walking distance to Disneyland a major plus as we could go early and come back to the hotel for a break then back for more evening fun. James outside the front door was especially helpful!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us in our great location, and that our team made your visit special. We hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great location and very family friendly
Summary: A family of 3 with a young toddler, we stayed at the Fairfield Inn for our trip to Disney. We parked here in the early AM, around 7:30, packed up our stroller, and made the 5 minute walk to the Disneyland gates. Super easy! We went back to the hotel at check-in time, got our room on the fireworks side of the building (FYI, it will be loud at night, but you'll have an amazing view), and spent some downtime at the pool to rest our feet. Then hightailed it back to the park for the evening. The location was perfect, our room just what we needed, and we felt well taken care of. The only downside was the pool: it's small and faces the parking lot. I highly recommend the Fairfield Inn Anaheim if you are traveling to Disney!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us. We're delighted to hear your family found our location convenient for your recent visit to Disneyland. We love knowing you enjoyed your view of the fireworks, too. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in every way.

Summary Heading: Pleasantly Surprised!  Very Convenient Access to Disney Parks
Summary: Location allows for an easy walk to both Disney parks.  We had adjoining rooms and while nothing extraordinary, both were extremely clean and appear to have just been remodeled. They also had a clear view of the Disneyland fireworks show. Marisa at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful with our early check-in.  Food choices on the property aren't great, but there are good options very close by. Great value and I would not hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for this fantastic review, Don! We look forward to hosting you again in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights and this place was an awesome choice! The location is almost directly across the street from Disneyland, with several locations for food nearby. On the 3rd floor is a market place/Pizza Hut. We didn’t eat there but we did use the toasters and the microwave. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The staff were very friendly and were happy to oblige our requests of extra towels. The pool was fun and the hot tub was very nice. The pool seating is very generous as well as having complimentary towels for drying off. The check in process was a breeze as was the check out process. We are very happy with our decision to stay here and highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us and that our team was able to make your stay special. We appreciate your recommendation and we look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary: We had one day to spend at Disneyland so we stayed the night before and after here.  The location was great for our needs.  The staff was super friendly and the room was clean and comfortable.  We were on the freeway side so I wondered if it would be noisy, but it wasn't a problem.  We had breakfast the first morning at the Pizza Hut in the building, nothing wonderful but convenient.  We tried the Panera the next morning and it was much better.  Valet parking was reasonably priced and the car was ready quickly.  I would stay here again if I returned to the area.
Manager Response: We love hearing this! Thank you for the kind, 5-star review. We greatly appreciate you taking the time to submit this feedback and we look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.

Summary: Stayed here for the superheroes race weekend as it’s walking distance to the parks and start line for the run. Fairly standard room size and while the outside is of an older style hotel, the rooms have been renovated and have Disney touches - a feature wall and the public areas have old pictures of Disney. The AC unit in our room got into a bit of a rattle every so often but nothing a bit of maintenance wouldn’t fix. Room a little noisy but as you’ll only be here to max your time in the park it’s fine. You can see the fireworks from the hotel too as it’s across the street.   Room had 50 inch TV and all the latest channels and you can log into your Netflix account if you so wish. Coffee machine, fridge and safe.   We got an Uber from the airport but there is parking. Out front is
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay. It's wonderful to hear that you found our location convenient and our accommodations incredibly comfortable. We know how important comfort is while traveling! Thank you again and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary Heading: Great location; early check-in fee a money-grab
Summary: Positives: Great location (walking distance to parks and dining) Room clean and spacious enough  Decent lobby and friendly staff  Negatives: Non-carpeted floors - looks nicer than carpet but invite a lot of noise from above.  There was a child running back and fourth in the room above us at 6AM and constantly dropping what sounded like a toy, over and over and over again, and it sounded like they were in the room with us.  Same with the shower/toilet - without carpeting the sound just passed through the floor with ease.  Early check-in fee - this bothered me immensely.  We flew in across the country from the east coast and arrived well before check-in.  We didn't expect a room to be "ready" that early but you never know.  Sure enough, they had a room ready to go for us.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share a review with us after your recent stay. While we're delighted to hear you loved our location and spacious guest rooms, we're disappointed to hear you didn't enjoy a five-star experience in every way. We appreciate your feedback regarding noise levels and our early check-in charge and will discuss this internally. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary Heading: Perfect location to walk to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed 5 nights and booked a higher floor facing the park which is great to watch the fireworks.  2nd visit to Disneyland so we knew the location of the Fairfield was perfect.  Rooms are not that large but for the price they are very good value.  We used a driver Rene for many trips shopping and ice hockey and the airport drop off and he was arranged through the front desk who are so helpful with everything,  Definitely would recommend to any families or couples visiting Disneyland.  Would stay at the Fairfield again,
Manager Response: We're thrilled to read this review! It's so nice to hear that you and your family truly enjoyed your time with us in our great location. We appreciate you sharing your feedback here, and we look forward to hosting you again in the future.

Summary: WE arrived early & opted to pay for early check in. Seems OTT to charge for what is sitting empty waiting for us anyway but after an overnight flight we just wanted to put our stuff down, freshen up & settle for a little while before heading out so was probably worth it.  My only advise - avoid the rooms near the elevators. They are particularly busy early in the morning.   Location is fabulous. pretty much across the road from the parks but quiet enough to be out of the bustle when you came back to the room to relax.  Staff seemed friendly & happy to help. Would definitely recommend.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay. It's wonderful to hear that you found our location convenient for your recent visit. We know how important location can be while traveling! Thank you again, and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary: This was a great hotel, great location and great staff. We cannot thank enough the duty manager who provided us with a late checkout as we had a late evening flight back to Australia. As the weather was so hot, we very much appreciated that our room was available to us until our departure. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, the reception staff were excellent and very helpful. The hotel is only a short walk to Disneyland, so the location is fantastic. We would stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your recommendation, Sarah! We appreciate you sharing such kind words and we're thrilled our team was able to make your stay special. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: hotel very close to disneyland,just across the road,easy to get around,staff very good and friendly.Room can get nosiey from other guests,you hear alot of movements from other rooms,other then that room all good,places to eat inside the hotel and nearby.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay. It's wonderful to hear that you found our location convenient. We know how important that is while traveling! Thank you again, and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary: We paid $25.00 for an early check in (nice that there is an option, but if a room is available, why do I have to pay for it?.  But out of our 5 stays, it's the first time we ended up in the back of the building.  Room 221 had squeaky beds (every time you moved) and a sewage type smell coming from the bathroom.  It was also an adjoining room and we could hear the neighbors, which we hadn't experienced before.  This was pretty disappointing compared to the other rooms we've stayed in here.  We did not complain to Management because we didn't want to have to switch rooms after spending 13 hours in the park.  We'll be back, because we love the convenience and the staff is awesome, perhaps on our next visit we'll request our previous room on the corner of the 3rd floor which we have
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate both your positive and constructive feedback after your recent stay with us in Anaheim. While we're delighted that you loved our location and service, we're sorry to hear that our guest rooms fell short. We're very disappointed to hear that we didn't deliver a 5th exceptional experience for you, and we appreciate you letting us know. Should your travels ever bring you back to the area, we hope you will give us another chance not only to meet but to exceed your expectations.

Summary: My credit card information was stolen by an employee who then went on a shopping spree.   The only place this card was used or even out was in the lobby of this hotel when I paid for the room at check in.  When I spoke with the manager Rick, he accused someone at Disneyland of stealing my information.  Kind of odd since the card only saw the light of day at the Fairfiled Inn check in  desk.  I reported this Sunday night and had a voicemail this morning from a Fairfield Manager.  Apparently,  they do not listen or read...the ONLY person who saw my card was the check in person at this facility. The apathy and blatant disregard of this matter is very concerning.  I reported this incident in hopes that this could be prevented from happening to another guest.  Based on how this
Manager Response: Again, we apologize and feel bad about the inconvenience you experienced. We take the safety and security of our guests very seriously. Our investigation came up with no irregular activity in this instance.

Summary Heading: “This is the Disneyland place to stay,” said the discerning Dad!
Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland. We had visited Disney World twice previously and stayed onsite both times. So, we were nervous about staying off-site at Disneyland. I’m so glad we did! The Fairfield location is ideal, and a five minute walk from the entrance gate. The room was new, fresh, clean, and updated. Ask for a room on the park side of the building and watch the fireworks from the balcony before bed.
Manager Response: Christian, we're thrilled to hear about your stay with us. We're so appreciative of you sharing these kind words here, and are glad to know you had a magical experience. Please come back and visit us again!

Summary: We wanted to stay within walking distance to the Disney Land Resort.  The Fairfield Inn Anaheim was perfect.  It's a 10 minute walk to the main entrance and there are numerous restaurants along the way.  We went to iHop as my kids love their pancakes.  It wasn't too busy and the service was good.  Food came out quickly too and as always at iHop it was reasonably priced.  There is a pharmacy within a 20 minute walk and other convenience stores closeby.  There was a fire drill at 5 in the morning on our last night and the staff didn't tell anyone what to do.  It was weird.  It kept going on, and then off and then on again.  Everyone gathered out on their balconies but we were not told to gather anywhere.  At 5.30 we were told "sorry for the inconvenience, you can go back to bed"
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share a review with us, Colleen. We're pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay, though we do apologize for the fire alarm confusion. We'll be sure to discuss this with our staff. We're happy to know you found our location perfect, and we can't wait to welcome you again.

Summary: We always stay here when we go to Disneyland.  Very reasonably priced, always reliable and the location is perfect - a less than  5 minute walk into the park.  The people are always super friendly and they even have food in the hotel.  A perfect place when your priority for the trip is maximizing your Disneyland time!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this lovely review with us. We're delighted to be your home away from home during your Disneyland vacations. We're happy you found our location convenient and our accommodations comfortable! Thank you again, and we hope to welcome you for a return visit soon.

Summary: We've stayed many times at this hotel over the years when visiting Disneyland.  The location is fantastic as one can easily walk to the parks.  The rooms are clean, comfortable, and the staff is most friendly and helpful (top-notch!  Marriott staff is always fantastic). Loved the Disney-themed decor in our room. We also appreciate having a coin laundry available onsite (available on most floors). New this trip was the pleasure of having a Panera cafe just steps from the lobby.  Other eateries very close by included Mimi's Cafe, McDonalds, and IHOP.  Of course within the hotel there's a Pizza Hut Express and Seattle's Best Coffee.  We enjoyed our stay here and will definitely return on our next trip to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share this lovely review with us, Clydene. We're delighted to hear our staff had such a positive impact on your vacation experience and that you and your family enjoyed our convenient location and comfortable guest rooms! We're happy to be your home away from home during visits to Disneyland, and we look forward to welcoming you again soon.

Summary Heading: An Excellent Place To Stay Across From Disneyland
Summary: I have stayed at this location on several occasions over the years when going to Disneyland. It is very convenient being right across the street and a short walk to the entrances. The staff is excellent in processing you in and out as well as helping with the car. The rooms have been remodeled since my last visit so the rooms are in good condition. They are nice and clean. This facility does have a pool to relax at. Being right across the street you can see the Disneyland night fireworks from outside your room if on the north side of the building, otherwise just go to the north side for viewing. There is a Panera in front of this hotel and a McDonalds next door for quick and cheap meals. There are other restaurants as you walk south about a block to go to the Disneyland parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location and outstanding service. We especially love hearing that our staff left such a positive impact on your Disney vacation experience. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: Self parking or valet. Pizza hut on 3rd floor. Ice machines/soda dispensing machines on each floor. Pool we didn't use. Easy walk to Disneyland across the street. Food outlets close by. Clean well appointed rooms that feel clean and bright. Helpful staff. A short and busy stay visiting Disneyland. Good view of night fireworks from verandah.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay. It's wonderful to hear that you found our amenities convenient and our accommodations incredibly comfortable. We know how important comfort is while traveling! Thank you again, and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary: From the first minute we arrived on Oct 10 and were greeted by the bell/valet staff, we had a wonderful time at the Fairfield Inn.  We were traveling with my elderly father who was celebrating a birthday.  Your staff made sure that his stay was special and that extra attention as so very much appreciated!  We asked for and received rooms that made it possible for us to view the fireworks......What a treat!  The walk to the park was easy.  I hope we get to come back soon.
Manager Response: Jocine, thank you very much for such a kind review. We are absolutely thrilled that our team was able to make your stay special, as well as recognize your father's birthday. We hope to have the chance to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: We are from Australia and are big Disney fans so this was the perfect hotel for the price. With Disneyland down the road, it was the perfect location. Even though the rooms aren't the fanciest, they are Disney themed and have comfy bedding.  The guys in parking were extremely friendly.  Also this is the best location to watch the fireworks from the balcony at Disneyland.  Hotel has a Pizza Hut and its own guest laundry so you aren't forking out heaps of money for the hotel to do your laundry which we were extremely happy about.  The only gripe about the room is the rubbish in the bin and rubbish were never taken away?? (Not sure why)  But other than that, highly recommend!
Manager Response: Shanna, thank you for such a wonderful review. We're sorry to hear about the issues you experienced with housekeeping and we will pass this along to the team as a learning experience. We hope to have the chance to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: The five stars are for what this is not for how luxurious this place is. We were originally trying to book the Disney’s Grand Californian but it was booked. I went to Marriott to see what was available in the area. The Fairfield had availability so I booked it for two nights. The location is perfect - convenient walking distance to the parks and Downtown Disney. The hotel was clean, no frills. It’s actually a motel as the doors all open to the outside. As other reviews state there is a Pizza Hut in the building as well as a Panera Bread and a McDonalds at the entrance. We had three of us with a king bed and a sofa bed which my son said was quite comfortable. The floors were laminate which I liked. I also liked the bathroom layout. There was a sliding door that closed off the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location and outstanding service. We especially love hearing that Jessica left such a positive impact on your Disneyland experience. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: This isn't the fanciest hotel ever but we didn't have any complains and our stay was good. We stayed for 5 nights. The location is great, not directly across from the Disneyland turnstiles but about two blocks down. It's a short few minute walk and was easy to go back to our room to drop stuff off if needed. Check in was easy. We did pay the fee ($25 I believe) to check in early since we arrived at 11am and wanted to get to the parks. Our room was near the pool but we didn't notice much extra noise.   The room was clean and looked recently remodeled. Bed and pillows were decently comfortable. Fridge is in the room.   They have a Pizza Hut in the hotel which was nice though it did close early around 9pm so no good for after park meal.   Overall we enjoyed the hotel and didn't
Manager Response: Thank you for such a wonderful review! We're very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Hopefully, we have the chance to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: As far as the location of the hotel to the Disney Parks, it's very close and an easy walk to the entrance. I found the hotel itself to be very clean, with an outstanding, friendly staff! They have a nice convenience shop in the lobby, a Pizza Hut shop on the 3rd level, a Panera Store at the entrance to the driveway and a McDonald's next to that.  I wanted to test how walking from a nearby hotel, to the Parks all day and back would work out for the family. Rather than booking a hotel further away, driving in, parking in the Disney Ramp, taking the tram and walking the Parks. Sort of a cost ratio/time saving experiment.   Over all, I would say that you will save travel time to and from the parks (it takes about 10 minutes to walk to the entrance, at a leisurely pace). Having
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us, Stephen. We're delighted to hear you had a magical experience at our hotel, finding out location convenient and our staff friendly and welcoming. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to welcome you for another Disneyland adventure.

Summary: We arrived for our mini-honeymoon and they were able to check us in early and even gave us a sweet little picture frame when we mentioned we'd just gotten married! The room was reasonably spacious with a refrigerator and a nice little bathroom area, there was some Disneyland theming around, and every staff member we interacted with was super friendly. The walk to Disneyland was really easy as well!
Manager Response: Valerie, thank you for such a wonderful review. We're thrilled we were able to make your honeymoon special. We hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: un-caring attitude during a Natural Disaster
Summary: Being in the hotel industry, the first thing you learn is hospitality. Show your guests you care. This hotel failed on multiple levels. I am currently in the middle of a Fire disaster in my home city in Northern California. We were supposed to take my kids to Disneyland this past Monday and the fires erupted and were forced to leave southern California to try and make it to a home that may or may not be there. I contacted the 800 number at Marriott only for the nonchalant agent to tell me the agent at the front desk would not waive the 72 hour cancellation policy and I would be liable for all three rooms. So I asked to be transferred to the front desk agent. This gentlemen was even worse. He sounded like he didn't believe me. He asked me "you didn't know there was a fire?" What
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We regret that this is the experience you had with representatives of our company and apologize that it took 3 people to respond to your exceptionally difficult situation. We will learn from this and will improve our individualization of the cancellation policy moving forward. We are glad that they ultimately made the right decision and understand how frustrating it must’ve been for you while in the midst of the natural disaster. Your comments, as a fellow hotelier and more importantly as a guest, are much appreciated.

Summary: The hotel is about a half mile walk from the main gate of Disneyland.  The lights and street crossings are well marked and accessible.  The hotel also has a Panera, McDonalds, and Pizza Hut on site for cheaper eating options.  The hotel itself is a standard hotel - nothing special but comfortable.  The pool was small and murky. The staff were friendlier than expected - the Disney atmosphere seemed to spread to the areas around the park.  I would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review, James. We're happy to hear you found our location convenient for your Disneyland vacation and that our staff was friendly as well. We pride ourselves on providing a helpful, positive customer experience, and we're pleased to have delivered upon that during your stay. We look forward to welcoming you back again someday.

Summary Heading: Great Choice for Disney Resort Stay
Summary: Fairfield Inn is across the street from the Disney Resort (Disneyland & California Adventure.  You can walk to the parks and avoid spending a lot of time waiting for a bus.  We had a "Park View" room.  It had 2 Queen beds and a small sofa pull out (twin size) so sleeping 5 would not be a problem.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  Plenty of pillows of varying densities. Staff were very friendly and helpful.  When we asked to be moved because we could hear the elevators all night, we were moved without question.  Due to a knee injury, I had planned to rent a scooter at the Park, but poor planning I my part resulted in me walking the first half of the first day.  When we got back to the Hotel, I talked to the front desk staff person about getting a scooter.   She immediately
Manager Response: Terry, we can't thank you enough for sharing your experience with us here. We are thrilled you enjoyed your time with us and that our team was able to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Please join us again on your next visit!

Summary Heading: I Have Never Wanted to Leave a Hotel in the Middle of the Night
Summary: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn on a previous Disneyland trip. It was renovated with a great location. This stay was horrific. I wanted to sleep in my car versus this hotel. AFter a long day at Disneyland, I could not wait to sleep since we were waking up early and doing it again. I got into bed, and the sheets were damp. I just assumed the sheets were out of the dryer not completely dried, and I was so tired. The next night, the sheets were almost wet. It was humid out, but that is no excuse for almost wet sheets. It was totally disgusting and I was up the majority of the night. When I complained the next morning, the clerk told me that I would receive a $ 100 credit off my bill. When my credit card statement arrived, there was no credit.  Stay elsewhere unless you want to feel
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking the time to share your honest feedback with us. We're disappointed to hear that you did not experience the kind of five-star stay that we strive to provide all of our guests. We appreciate your sharing all of your constructive input so we can address your concerns internally. Should your travels ever bring you back to Anaheim, we hope to have the chance to improve upon your experience.

Summary: So this is a 4/5 review given that it is a 2.5 star hotel. Its definitely not anything more luxurious than that, but it was solid for our purposes.  As advertised, it is a short walk to Disneyland and CA Adventure - about 10 min, even for my 5 year old's short legs.   The rooms are what you would expect from a 2.5 star hotel - nothing fancy, and unfortunately it had shower curtains (touching hotel shower curtains is a particular fear of mine), I thought the two queen beds were pretty reasonable, but my husband found it rather uncomfortable.   The big problem for me was the temperature control - it was either super cold AC or heat coming out of the vents. Luckily the weather itself was mild the night we were there (probably 65 outside overnight) so it was easier to turn
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us, Elaine! We're thrilled that you loved our convenient location and outstanding service. We especially love hearing that Bernie left such a positive impact on your Anaheim experience. Thank you again for your valuable feedback regarding our air conditioning, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary Heading: First trip to Disneyland 2017  (Ladies only -Sisters and Cousin)
Summary: Our expectations were exceeded on this trip.  We were upgraded to a park view room, had a nice surprise awaiting us in the room and were treated very well upon check in.    I'd like to persoanlly thank the Cara Bryan especially for making this first trip (to Disneyland and California) so memorable and magical!!  We would also like to thank our housekeeping staff (I know how hard you work, as I was once a housekeeping during my college days!) and the valets (taking family pictures for us and getting in on the fun too). ROOM overview:  The room was nicely appointed, housekeeping was on point, both during the day and when we had an issue during the late hours of the evening (plumbing and a/c).  The walk to the park entrance was less than 5 minutes, and we could easily return to our
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location and outstanding service. We especially love hearing that Cara left such a positive impact on your Anaheim experience. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: Haven't even made it there yet and we are annoyed. Traveling next week with family and small children. Called hotel directly to verify reservation and check on request for connecting rooms. Was repeatedly told there was nothing they could do for us because it was a '3rd party' booking; wouldn't even confirm that we had a reservation!  Just because your establishment is across the street from a world famous amusement park does not entitled anyone in the hospitality business to treat anyone paying hundreds per night for rooms with such disdain.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention. We would like to invite you to email Veronica.Gonzales@marriott.com for assistance confirming your reservation. We look forward to welcoming you next week.

Summary: Picked an upgraded package to get 'park views' and free parking.  We were put on the top floor and could technically see bits of California Adventure World but not the Disney park or firework display.  Overall a decent hotel, room was adequate, nice clean pool that wasnt busy.  Hotel is almost opposite the park entrance, no more than a 10 min walk to get into the park.  PizzaHut on the 3rd floor was a bonus !  Staff were friendly always saying hello.  Would stop here again but reconsider the 'park view' package unless I knew which side of the hotel it was.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this review! We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, as well as the service our team provided. We appreciate your feedback regarding the views with your upgraded package and will pass this along for review. We hope to welcome you back on your next visit!

Summary: We picked this hotel as we were going to Disneyland and was an easy walk. Rooms are roomy and clean and beds are comfortable. TV also has Netflix and internet connection is decent. We stayed on the 1st floor and every now and again would notice a smoke smell, which probably came from the aircon and someone smoking outside. We would return, if prices are reasonable.
Manager Response: Thank you for this kind review! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate you sharing your experience here. Hopefully we'll be able to welcome you back again on your next visit!

Summary: This is the second time we have stayed at  a good neighbor hotel right across the street from the park. So far this is the best of the two we have stayed at. We had a great hotel stay. I have read some reviews on here that the rooms seem old but the room we stayed in had nice hard wood floors and a huge hd television. Also a plus was if you have Netflix, Hulu etc...you can access those directly on the TV. So this was big for us as that is about all we watch. It looks to me that at least the rooms on the the 8th floor have been re-done. Not sure if this is the case for the entire hotel. Also, I know this may not be the case for everyone but we discovered that 2 of our favorite rides at Disneyland would be closed Mon – Thursday which was the length of our stay. So we wanted to
Manager Response: Jason, we can't thank you enough for such a wonderful review. We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we greatly appreciate your feedback regarding breakfast as well. We do hope we have the opportunity to host you again on your next visit.

Summary: My husband and I visit Disneyland once a year from Phoenix, Arizona. We always choose to stay at one of the good neighbor hotels right across the street from the park. This was our first stay at this hotel since the one we usually stay at was booked.  I booked a standard promo room and upon check in asked if any king beds were available and they were able to accommodate without any extra charge which was wonderful. I was also expecting to pay $19.00/day for parking per the hotel website but they knocked it down to $5.00/day upon check in which was also fantastic. The service was great and the room was very clean. We arrived at about 5:00 p.m. and had no problem finding parking right in front of our room. They do offer valet for the same standard $19.00/day rate if you arrive
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review! We appreciate you choosing our hotel for your most recent trip. We appreciate all of your positive and constructive feedback and we hope you'll come back and see us again soon!

Summary: This hotel is a good value in the Disneyland area. It's location across the street from Disneyland is great. The hotel itself is older and is showing its age in places, but the rooms themselves have had some updates like the showers and appliances. Overall the rooms feel very clean and well maintained.   We didn't use the pool, but it looked to be a decent size and clean as well. The hotel has an on-site Pizza Hut as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us following your recent visit to Anaheim. We're happy to hear you found our location convenient and our guest rooms comfortable. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in every way.

Summary: We stayed with our 2children while we visited Disneyland and California Adventure park. Clean rooms, nice pool, great location to easily access theme parks and restaurants. 10 minute walk to theme parks. Kids were disappointed as our room faced the hotel next door with the most amazing water park!! Friendly staff. guest parking $20 per day and same price for valet! Guest laundry. Café within building for coffee, breakfast, pizza, games room , fitness centre, vending machines in each floor. express checkout
