Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We're happy to have been your home away from home during your recent Disneyland vacation. We pride ourselves on our friendly service, so we're pleased to see we delivered on this for you. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in every way.

Summary: Like this hotel a lot. The proximity to Disneyland and restraunts was very convenient, it was a 7 minute walk to the park. We booked with Getaway today and was parking included in our cost. Everyone was very nice and polite staff. They did room service every single morning when we were gone. The room was basic but updated. We had a huge tv in our room but very limited channels for the kiddos to watch.  My 2 gripes why I couldn't give them a 5 were. 1) The little pizza hut food place has terrible food. I was excited for the Belgian waffle, but it was like chewing on a tire. The breakfast sandwiches were gross too, from what I heard from friends. annnnnd 2). The damn pool was closed for resurfacing. It was in September which was hot as hell. They wanted us to take a shuttle to
Manager Response: Thank you for this detailed review! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us and we greatly appreciate your feedback regarding your dining experience. We do apologize for the inconvenience of the pool maintenance. Hopefully, we have the chance to welcome you back again to enjoy it!

Summary: Location is the main asset to this hotel rooms are ok housekeeping did a good job every day we were there, the vending machine on the 6th floor took 5 bucks from me and after a whole day at the park I had no energy to go downstairs look for someone to help me, in any case that was the only mishap during our stay, we would probably stay there again but then again there are other options at similar prices on the same block.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this review. We're glad to hear you enjoyed our great location, and that our housekeeping staff delivered top-notch service. We're sorry to hear about your experience with our vending machine and we'll pass this on to our team. We certainly hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again on your next visit.

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights as a family of 5. Location to Disney was excellent, within walking distance, laundry facilities great. Pool nice & clean. Front desk staff very helpful.  Can't fault it & value for money.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave this wonderful review. We're thrilled to have been your family's home away from home during your trip to Disney. We're delighted to hear our staff were friendly and helpful, and we look forward to welcoming you for another five-star stay in the future.

Summary: Stayed here two night with two teenagers.  Rooms were clean and beds were comfy!  Easy walk to Disneyland from the hotel and the Panera Restaurant in front of the hotel was the best!  There is a Pizza Hut on the 3rd floor.  Microwaves in the Pizza hut dining area are available for guest use 24 hours a day.  Front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  Housekeeping was very prompt when I called to have our room cleaned while I went on a morning run.  Will definitely stay here again next time we are in Anaheim!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this wonderful review with us, Donna. We're delighted to hear you found our location convenient for your stay and that our housekeeping staff provided prompt and efficient service. We can't wait to welcome you for another five-star stay in the future.

Summary: For the money and accessibility it's very tough to beat this Fairfield Inn. It was clean, well kept, service was above average. Only drawback- pool being serviced at our time of stay. Never made mention of that, even when I called 10 days before. We would have stayed at the Hilton to use to the pool.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us, Gary. We apologize for the inconvenience caused by our pool being serviced, but we're happy to hear you found our location convenient for your trip to Disneyland. We hope you'll come back for a five-star stay in every way on your next trip to the area.

Summary Heading: Happy weekend stay to visit Disney
Summary: Good location to Disneyland, about 10 minutes walk .  Stayed on the 5th floor at the corner, facing car park and road.  Room is big, clean comfortable.  Provided coffee maker with coffee bags, tea bags, room sleepers, toiletries except toothbrush.  Bed is comfortable to sleep.  Each floor has a vending machine for drinks.  3rd level has a pizza eatery, microwave to heat your own food. We did not eat there but heard that the pizza is good.  There is a swimming pool but we did not use it.  Check in is fast though room is not ready at 4 pm. We went for a walk and got our room when we came back at about 5.30 pm.  We did our express check out by dropping keys into the box.  All the service staff were great and friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your Disneyland getaway with us! We're thrilled that you loved our location, guest rooms and dining conveniences. We hope to welcome you back very soon!

Summary Heading: Great value and close to Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first time on a trip to Disneyland last weekend and we thought it was great! We used Marriott points to pay for part and paid money for part and we thought it was a good value. I've stayed at several hotels near Disneyland and this hotel had a great rate, very clean and good sized room and is about a 10 minute walk to the entrance to Disneyland. The room included a safe and mini refrigerator, and you can even login to your own Netflix account on the tv! We had a room with a king bed and there was also a sitting area with a couch and two small tables. There is a Pizza Hut on site, which was great to grab a quick breakfast sandwich, though it would be nice if the hotel included breakfast. We also liked that there is a Panera and
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words! We're thrilled you chose our hotel for your Disneyland getaway. It sounds like you had a magical time and we couldn't be happier to hear that. Come see us again soon!

Summary: Can not fault the rooms or service at this hotel but the wifi was non existent pool was small and there is no on sight restaurant only takeaway and no bar lounge area  Distance to Disneyland was great and an easy walk
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about the trouble you experienced with the wi-fi. We do apologize for this! Thank you for sharing your review and we hope to welcome you back for a seamless stay soon.

Summary Heading: Great Location for a brief stay
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for two nights prior to a trip to Hawaii. Valet was friendly and courteous.  Front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful to answer any questions we had.  The hotel is set back from the main road and we had some difficulty finding it until we realized that it was.  It is located down a long  driveway alongside Panera Bread and in close proximity to other restaurants.  l especially enjoyed the breadsticks from the Pizza Hut located in the hotel itself.  Although  the hotel is old as others mentioned it was clean and well maintained.   We had a Disneyland mural on the wall behind the bed and a hidden Mickey on the roof top of the section of the hotel below us. While this is a no frills hotel it was a short walk to Disneyland and suited our purpose
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review! We're thrilled that you and your husband enjoyed your stay, from our helpful staff to our convenient location. We appreciate all of your valuable feedback!

Summary: When you book the website photos looks very good, but the hotel is old, check in was good no delay room was ready I didn’t wait for it, to get to the rooms you had to walk outside with the very hot weather its not ideal. Beads are noise A/C very noise it was so noise I could not hear the people in the swimming pool, breakfast do not expect much it was a market shop with pizza hut on 3rd floor so we opt to eat out as there was a few places to eat. The staff were very friendly, it’s a shame that the hotel need lots of TLC.
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate you sharing both your positive and constructive feedback after your recent stay with us in Anaheim. While we're delighted that you loved our location and service, we're sorry to hear that our guest rooms fell short. Should your travels ever bring you back to the area, we hope you will give us another chance not only to meet but to exceed your expectations.

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights on our trip to Disney and loved it! Location is the key but a nice, clean room makes a difference when you come to the room after a long day at the park. One think I liked was how much storage space was available in a somewhat small space. Besides the usual dressers there was storage under the sink and a large closet with storage above as well. Nice to stash suitcases out of the way instead of tripping over them. Hard-wood floors were very nice and the theme-park themed room was fun. There is a limited Pizza Hut on the 4th floor with a game room off to the side. We found it to be kind of $$$ but still not as bad as Disney prices! The walk is about 10 minuted from the hotel lobby, across the street, through security to the esplanade to DL turnstiles.
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous review, Morgan, and thank you for staying with us during your recent trip to Disneyland. We're delighted to hear you loved our spacious guest rooms and convenient location. We know how important location is while traveling. We hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: This hotel is very clean and comfortable, loved the large room and the fact that there was no carpeting only hard wood flooring. Most of the staff were friendly only found a few that were short when asking questions.  Would not recommend paying extra for the Disney rooms.  We were charged around a hundred dollars for a preferred room so we could see the park and watch the fireworks.  All we could see from our window was the farthest point if the park and in order to see the fireworks we had to leave our room and join everyone else by a couple of small railings.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay. It's wonderful to hear that you found our accommodations spacious and comfortable. We know how important comfort is while traveling! Thank you again, and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary: Our stay was better than we ever expected. Staff were awesome, arrived at 10.00am after 14 hour flight and were in our room within 10 minutes (for a fee but happy to pay it). Room was more than acceptable, pool is small and overcrowded. We had a room facing the parks, it was nice. The view out the other side overlooking the freeway is certainly less than nice. The real winner is the location. At a guess I would say you are 500m from the main gates at Disneyland and California Adventure. Certainly close enough that you can come and go during the day which is an absolute life saver. Highly recommended good value option that doesn't disappoint.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay, Simon. It's wonderful to hear that you found our location convenient and our staff friendly and accommodating. Thank you as well for your thoughts on the size of our pool. We hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary: We stayed 7 nights at the end of August and received a renovated room which was nice. The hotel seems to be in generally good repair and our room was very clean although it seemed like it was not thoroughly cleaned each day. Something to keep in mind is that most if not all hotels near the Disneyland Resort gates charge for parking ($19 day) so factor this in. The hotel has a great location very near (5 min walk) to the main gates of both parks. There's a great Panera Bread Company rest on the property and a MacDonald's next store for meals.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience with us, Jon. While we're pleased to have hosted you and to hear that you enjoyed our central location, we're disappointed to hear that your room did not exceed your expectations. We hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back for a flawless stay in the very near future.

Summary Heading: Great hotel but don't get an adjoining room
Summary: We are just finishing our 7 night stay here. It's our 4th-5th visit to this hotel. The newly refurbished rooms are nice and clean. I like the new vinyl plank flooring. Carpet is soooo gross in hotels, so I'm glad it's gone. The staff are always very friendly and accommodating. My only complaint was the adjoining room we had. Our neighbour had a 2(ish) year old and we heard him very clearly and loudly at 7:00am and still at 11:15pm!!! My teenagers were asleep or trying to when the little guy was squawking. We've stayed here before and never had a problem, so I'll chalk it up to bad luck. Room tip: don't stay on the freeway side of the hotel(its loud) and ask for a room that is not adjoining, as the door is paper thin. I'm sure our annual trip to the park will bring us here again
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this kind review! We're happy to have hosted you on your visits to the park, and we certainly hope to welcome you back again on your next trip.

Summary: Comfortable and great friendly staff willing to assist. Watched Disney fireworks from room balcony. Highly recommended. Clean room. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Would prefer better food options onsite but that is a small thing when you are staying on disney row. Plently of food options outside the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We love hearing that our staff left such a positive impact on your Anaheim experience. We're also thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location, and outstanding service. We're grateful for your feedback regarding our on-site dining options. We hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: Great place to stay super close to Disneyland.  Every member of the staff was very friendly! The front desk, luggage storage, housecleaning...  The room also felt very clean and recently updated.  Very easy to make a quick stop at Panera bread before heading back home.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our updated guest rooms, convenient location, and outstanding service. We especially love hearing that our staff left such a positive impact on your Anaheim experience. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel before many times along with a slight name change it underwent a face-lift of the main entrance foyer last year, it did little in my mind to change the service for guests not that the service was anything but good prior to the change or now. I'm of the opinion that the face lift was an unnecessary large expense anyhow that's a management problem the hotel rooms have undergone some changes which was money well spent. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with coffee making facilities,microwave, a security box/safe and a refrigerator. There is a coin operated laundry on each floor. On the 3rd floor there is a little restaurant of sorts where breakfast can be purchased and other snacks etc.Choose a room on the upper floors at the front of the hotel as
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay. It's wonderful to hear that you found our location convenient and our accommodations incredibly comfortable. We know how important comfort is while traveling! Thank you again, and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary: The hotel was nice, clean, and quiet.  We got a corner room on the top floor so we could see the park from our room.  We arrived about an hour before the 4:00 check-in time not realizing it was such a late check-in time and we did have to wait a bit before our room was ready.  The staff was friendly though and offered to hold our bags and sent me a text as soon as the room was ready.  It was a standard Fairfield Inn with 2 comfortable beds, the room was decorated in Disney though and for travel with kids it was nice that the sink area was outside of the bathroom and had a separate door blocking it from the bedroom.  It was only about a 15 minute walk to the park which was helpful for returning to the room for nap time with our toddler.  There is a Panera and McDonald's right on
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay. It's wonderful to hear that you found our location convenient and our accommodations incredibly comfortable. We know how important comfort is while traveling! Thank you again and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary: Me and my dad went to stay in the inn, to go to the Disneyland resort and we can say that it was a fine experience. The Fairfield inn had a good price, clean rooms and a good location. In the mornings we had breakfast in the third floor which I think was good then we went to the parks, walking. The service that they have us was great. Overall I think we can say it was a good experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us, Diego! We're thrilled that you loved our guest rooms, convenient location, and outstanding service. We hope you'll choose us again for future visits to the area.

Summary: Excellent location and close to Disneyland, friendly staff, extremely clean hotel (I walked by a room and was amazed at the lengths they were going to to clean it - they even took the AC cover off and dusted it). I was worried because someone posted pics of bed bugs, but shouldn't have been. Front desk staff were extremely nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Although we paid for the preferred room with a view, I probably would not pay extra again as you can just take the elevator up to the 7th floor and walk along the outside balconies for a view of the fireworks every night.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us. We're delighted to have been your home base during your recent trip to Disneyland. We're also happy to hear our staff helped make your stay a pleasant one. We hope you'll stay with us again when your travels bring you back to the area.

Summary: Pleased with location. We were able to store our luggage and go visit Disneyland on our early arrival. The staff was always friendly and were able to put us in adjoining rooms. Never heard any noise outside (except for our grandkids). Close to Mimi's Cafe, IHOP and Denny's.  We did Amazon Prime Now for snacks and water and the hotel accepted our order and stored it until we returned to our room. Nice vacation!
Manager Response: We're thrilled you enjoyed your stay, Robert! Thanks for this wonderful review. We hope to welcome you and your family again on your next visit!

Summary Heading: Overall Good Location, Clean accommodations and very friendly staff.
Summary: Stayed here with family of 4 for a Disneyland getaway before the new school year began. Normally we stay on the Disney property, but everything was booked. This property was a pretty economical alternative and about equidistant to the park entrances as Paradise Pier. Our room was clean and comfortable with no signs of anything nasty. The staff was very friendly, always greeting at every encounter. The pool area was fine for our kids to enjoy a break from the parks. The Panera restaurant location right in front of hotel is really convenient and good alternative to the park food. Overall this hotel was a good experience. The only item I'd warn future patrons is the limited parking spaces on the property. If you arrive in the late afternoon or evening, your car will have to be
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review! We're happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your time with us and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit!

Summary Heading: Visiting Disneyland again after a long time
Summary: We took our daughter Disneyland about 14 years ago and stayed at the Fairfield Inn in Anaheim and loved it. I am a grandparent now and have a 5 year old granddaughter who I am taking to Disneyland over the Labor Day weekend 2017. We live in Hawaii so a trip like this one takes a lot of planning. I researched all the hotels in the area and wanted to stay at one of the Disney resorts on the property. I always remembered the Fairfield inn which we stayed  long ago and after a lot of deliberation (not price) we chose to stay at the Fairfield Inn again. location is great and with McDonald's and on site pizza hut (my granddaughters favorite restaurants) Great choice. I will be reviewing this property when we get back.
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate your kind words, Todd! We're glad to welcome you back. Please let us know if we can assist in any way during your stay.

Summary: Great hotel, near Disneyland (half a block from the main entrance), the lobby is modern and inviting, rooms are sparkling clean and very comfortable, amenities include a swimming pool, lobby souvenir shop, valet parking and there is pizza hut in the third floor where they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner, the staff is friendly and very professional from the parking entrance to the main desk, they are always ready to help, the $19.99 parking fee is a bargain due to the closeness to the Disneyland and California Adventure parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for this fabulous 5-star review, Juan! We're thrilled you enjoyed your stay with us, inclucing our amenities and great location. Please come back and visit soon!

Summary: We didn't want to pay the outrageous prices to stay at the Disney properties so we chose to stay at Fairfield Inn. The hotel is literally minutes from the entrance to Disneyland and it was perfect. Hotel is clean and does the job. Our family was able to walk back to the hotel around 2 pm, freshen up and take naps, and then had back to Disney around 5:30. It was perfect and we will definitely do this again and stay at this hotel. Save money and have peace of mind :)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us during your recent trip to Disney, and thank you as well for taking the time to leave us a review. We're delighted to have been your family's home away from home during vacation and glad to hear you found our hotel clean and comfortable. We do hope you'll stay with us again in the future!

Summary: The Fairfield Inn is located just a block away from the entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure.  That alone makes it a great hotel to choose when you are Magic Kingdom bound!  Being a Marriott property there are many things that also make it a good choice; well designed rooms with queen beds and a fold out chair, separate areas in bathroom so one could be in the shower and others in the sink area, refrigerator, faux hardwood floors (no icky carpet), excellent air ventilation, flat screen TV, and many rooms face the park and you can see a lot of the fireworks from the walkway although you will want to be there in person!  Because you are at the parks from early until late the most important features of the rooms are the beds and the air conditioning, which are great.  My
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share this review! We're always happy to hear that our guests have enjoyed their time with us as much as their time at Disney. We're thrilled to be a hotel so convenient to the parks that families can return for an afternoon rest before heading back out. We hope that you'll stay with us again during your next visit to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Across the Street from Disney
Summary: Booked this room due to the price and location and it did not disappoint.  You do have to pay for parking and it doesn't have a free breakfast but there is a pizza hut/breakfast restaurant on the 3rd floor of the hotel that we grabbed breakfast food cheap and quick each morning.    This hotel is literally just a block or so walk to the intersection where you cross the street to the main entrance.   We never had to take or wait on a shuttle or move our car the 3 nights we were there which was wonderful and less stressful.  After seeing where Disneyland Hotel and Paradise Pier are at the end of Downtown Disney I don't know that they are any closer than the strip of hotels where the Fairfield is located.  Unless you are going to shell out big $$$ for the Grand Californian I think
Manager Response: Thank you for such a wonderful review! We're very happy to know that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay and hope to have the chance to welcome you back in the future.

Summary: The Hotel is in a excellent location!! It is basically right across the park so great location. We stayed two nights. Came in early parked our cars at about 7:00 am Checked in no rooms available yet fine going to Disneyland anyway.  Super nice person helped us and she got us connecting rooms so nice.  We even had a view out of the window at California Adventure. They text us when the room was ready. Some of our party went back and forth to rest. Great stay every time  I spoke with someone at the front desk they were super helpful and friendly.  Room was clean and sheets were clean. Comfortable bed. some in the group slept on the hideabed  and no complaints from them.  Now take this for what it is a close clean hotel right by Disneyland not a resort.  Love the stay would stay
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this 5-star review! It sounds like you definitely took advantage of our great location. We're thrilled you and your group enjoyed your stay and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: Spacious room! Laundry on every floor. Pizza Hut and games room on the 3rd floor which we were staying on. Right across the road from Disneyland! Such a clean area. Shop on the main floor snacks, medicine souvenirs and things you might need. Loved it here.
Manager Response: Thanks for this amazing review! We're glad to hear you enjoyed our great location and amenities, and hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: We stayed here in August 2017, while visiting the parks. It is in a perfect location, never more than a 5 minute walk to Disneyland. As the parks stay open until midnight, it meant there was no long waits for a shuttle bus.  There are a lot of restaurants on the road too, most of which are cheaper than in the parks. There is a McDonalds and Panera Bread next to the hotel, and a pizza hut inside the hotel too.  The staff are very friendly, and our cleaner Claudia even wished my daughter a happy birthday. When we checked in, they also left balloons and a card.  The WiFi was great, always worked although needs reconnecting each day though that was no trouble at all.  Again, for my daughter’s birthday, they gifted us a room on the top floor, with a  view of both the Disney parks and
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay. We're happy to hear that Claudia helped make your daughter's birthday celebration a magical one. Thank you again, and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary Heading: Brilliant, family friendly and great location.
Summary: We stayed here in late July. It was a last minute booking for us because we had planned to stay somewhere else but we didn't like the location and we had stayed here a few years ago.  We left our other hotel early and went over here but I knew that we wouldn't be able to check in so early but we put our luggage in storage and went out for the day. The lady at reception couldn't have been more friendly and she helped us organise transport and went out of her way to ensure that the driver would come and get us. When we returned our room was ready.  We were really pleased with our room. Since the last time we had stayed the rooms have been updated! It was larger than our other room and had plenty of room for our luggage, bags and a stroller.  The room was very clean and we had a
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location, and outstanding service. We especially love hearing that our front desk staff and driver left such a positive impact on your Disney experience. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: One of the great benefit of living in Asia, hotel are more luxurious and get more benefits then in USA and also the price, Asia is far more better.   If you are looking about the distance to Disney. This hotel is near by and 10 minutes or so walk to the gate of Disney, I'm aware there are plenty of hotels but this is one of them. Surround by places to eat as well. Clean and a good place to rest for 1 or 2 nights with family for your visit to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you found our location convenient for your trip to Disney. We're glad to know our hotel was able to meet your family's needs. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: On the fifth floor we could hear kids in the pool, and the "high speed" wifi is awful (only 3 mbps), and no Ethernet cord. The room looked like something from a motel. What is nice is your able to walk into Disneyland in about ten minutes.
Manager Response: Hi, Jarret. We thank you for taking the time to submit this review. We're sorry you did not enjoy your room, but we're glad you were able to take advantage of our great location. We hope to welcome you back again for a flawless visit.

Summary Heading: Perfect for family trips to Disney
Summary: We are a family of 4 with small children. This place gets 5 stars for location. It is actually across the street from the entrance to Disneyland Resort.  It takes about 5 minutes to walk from the hotel to the first security check at Disney.  Check in was at 4 but they were able to get us in just before 3 which was awesome.  Our room was 2 queens with a pullout chair which my daughter opted for and enjoyed.  Our room could comfortably sleep 5.  The room was very clean and I LOVED that the rooms are not carpet (it's fake wood).  The wet closet was small but the layout of the room was great! And, we were able to watch the Fireworks from outside our room Only a few small issues.  Our air conditioner was necessary but loud and therefore annoying. Also, the pool was nice but dated,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us after your recent stay, Tovah! We're delighted to hear you found our location convenient and our guest rooms comfortable and spacious. We know how important comfort can be when traveling! We can't wait to welcome you back on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Truly Focused on the Bottom Line
Summary: Marriott is my preferred hotel brand and I've always considered Fairfield Inns to be an inexpensive, value lodging.  At 99 out of 100 Fairfields you'll get a free breakfast and free parking.  This property is one of those exceptions.  The positives:  My family has stayed here at least 4 times over the years.  On this visit, I received a phone call the Saturday before our stay from a hotel staff member.  He simply called to inquire if we had any special requests.  On previous visits we've been fortunate enough to view the Disney fireworks from the comfort of a suite.  I requested rooms with a view of the fireworks and the rep happily obliged without imposing the "premium view" rate.    Unless you're staying at Disney's Grand Californian this hotel is your best bet for convenience
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to submit this review. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed the service our staff provided, as well as our great location. We're sorry to hear about your experience in your rooms, and appreciate your input regarding pricing as well.

Summary Heading: Great location, just a 5 minutes walk to Disneyland
Summary: After a few hours considering our options we choose to stay at the Fairfield Inn as it was well priced and just a short walk to Disneyland, which meant that we could come and go a few times during the day.  Our room had everything that we needed, it was clean and tidy and the maid had always been when we returned in the afternoon.  There are many places to eat within a short stroll.  Would definitely stay here again for the convenience.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our convenient location and outstanding service. We appreciate your valuable feedback and we hope to welcome you again soon.

Summary: My wife and I decided to go to Disneyland, just the 2 of us...no KIDS. Since we are PLATINUM ELITE members (I stay at a Courtyard 3 days a week for work.....the last 2 years), we decided to use our points in order to enjoy our 5 days in Anaheim. We checked in on 7-17-2017 and my wife inquired about Breakfast and/or appetizers in the evening. In a rather short terse response she was told "Sorry, we don't offer that to our guests?". My wife stated that we are Platinum Elite....she said "No, we can't accommodate all our guests for breakfast, but if you want, you can buy the ON THE GO breakfast for $8.00" (which is like the complimentary breakfast that all the other Fairfields offer...not this one). So, we made it up to our room.......this was nothing more than a 8 story MOTEL with
Manager Response: Thank you for filling us in about your stay. We're very sorry to hear about your experience. We have sent you a private message so we can look into this further.

Summary: I reserved a 1 king bed and 1 sofa bed in that specific hotel because is across the street from Disneyland resort, when we arrived, the room was only 1 bed, NO sofa bed. I was traveling with my spouse a two children. So I asked staff member JOHN GERMANY DE, for a room with a sofa bed, he told me the hotel was all booked, and no sofa bed rooms were available. I explained to him, that we needed a room that could accommodate the four of us.  That was the moment when he started with a very rude attitude, at the point that, when I tried to borrow the pen he had in his hand, he told me in a very threatening manner, that I should never try to grab something from him shouting "DON'T TOUCH ME, DON'T YOU EVER TOUCH ME".  After seing that, I asked to speak with the manager, he answered
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your candid review with us. We truly value all of our guests' input. We're sorry to hear that your stay did not exceed your expectations like we would have hoped and we appreciate you filling us in on your experience. We will be sure to address your concerns internally and hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in the future.

Summary: I wish I would have tried this hotel sooner. We come to Disneyland often, sometimes staying in a Disney property, sometimes in a nearby hotel. This was such a pleasant experience. Disneyland is just across the street - about the same distance you need to walk from Paradise Pier. It was clean and quiet. The valet service was fantastic. Very helpful, friendly staff. We stayed one night but parked there for two days and paid slightly less than the fee for the Disney parking structure. There is a Panera bread out front with a good and healthy breakfast selection. We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your experience and our location. We hope to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary: We stayed here on election week in Nov 16 for our visit to Disneyland. We found the rooms to be clean and adequately stocked. Our room was prepared daily by the housekeeping staff and I really can't think of a bad thing to say. They have a snack and meal counter located on the 3rd floor I think it was. The selections were adequate and reasonably priced. There was also a well supplied convenience shop in the lobby we frequented. All the staff was friendly and courteous in my limited interactions with them. We had a view room that overlooked Disneyland which was cool. The rooms on the other side overlook a parking lot that's less than mesmerizing. If the view is important you might keep that in mind. Our room had a Cars theme that was cute and helped remind us of our reason for
Manager Response: We're thrilled to have the opportunity to welcome you back, Cody! Thank you for sharing such a kind review.

Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights. I arrived early morning and it's a late check in but they got a room ready by lunch time which was great. Comfy beds & spacious rooms. Also a massive TV in front of the bed that has Netflix.  Only took 10 mins to walk to Disneyland entrance and downtown Disney is just a little further.  There's a pizza hut in the hotel which was great. You can see the Disneyland fireworks from the balcony. Will be staying here again on my next visit 🙂
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review, Sammy! We're very happy to know we were able to be such a great part of wonderful memories. We hope to welcome you agian in the future.

Summary: Taking a trip to Disneyland with a big family is always a hassle but when we got to our rooms after a long day of walking it was like heaven and everything was so clean. The staff was excellent and check in was simple!
Manager Response: This is what we love to hear! Thank you for sharing such a kind review. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

Summary: This is the second time staying in this hotel but the first time after it's room renovations. It's a bit of an older building but when I saw it recently got renovated, I decided to book a room here. Love the modern look of the rooms and HARDWOOD FLOORS.   PROS - Proximity to Disney gate. 5-10 minute walk only - Proximity to McDonalds, Panera for dining options. There's also a Pizza hut and coffee place inside hotel - Newly renovated rooms  - Pool and gym in hotel - Sink is outside of bathroom which helps in getting ready in the morning - Not sure if it's because I'm a Marriott Elite Member but I got a call a couple days before trip already thanking us for staying with them and they gave me an upgrade to a premium view room from the call.   Cons - We had a premium 2 queen room,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It was all about the location
Summary: After a disastrous day trying to deal with a broken down rental car, we arrived a couple of hours early ready to check in and lay down. The woman at reception was exceptionally nice and gave us an early check in. She did warn us that our room would be behind the elevators (In the end it was no big deal, we could hear the elevators going up and down but were out most of the day at Disney). We had two double beds and a pull out sofa which was nice. The room was adequate and fairly clean. The pool was a lot smaller than what the pictures show. The best part of the hotel was the location. Right across the street from Disneyland which is what we wanted. There was also lots of restaurants such as Panera, I Hop and Denny's near by so we didn't have to use the car. The staff were super
Manager Response: We're glad to hear that your stay was a pleasant one after getting off to a rough start with your rental car. We hope that when you return to the area, you'll stay with us again!

Summary: When our son and family planned a trip to Disneyland, my wife and I drove out to Anaheim to enjoy the grandkids experiencing Disney. We chose the Fairfield Inn at Anaheim on Harbor Blvd. Its only about one block from the main crossing of Harbor Blvd. at the main entrance of Disneyland and Disney California Adventure. There are loads of nearby restaurants also. Parking is $18 per day. There is no breakfast area nor free breakfast here. There is a small shop / food store on the 3rd floor where you can buy a few things (pizza, juices & milk, cereal, yogurt, pastries, etc.). There was also a Panera Bread immediately in front of the hotel. Our room was on the north side of the front-most building on the 5th floor. The good news was that from the balcony walk just outside our room you
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. we're happy to hear you enjoyed our convenient location and hope you'll return again soon!

Summary: To find the hotel as you are driving North on Harbor Blvd, when you see the McDonald's, slow down and turn right at the Panera Bread, you will see a valet for the hotel, who will let you drive into hotel parking.  Hotel parking is usually maxed out, so prepare to use the valet parking.  The days we were there, the staff was extremely friendly and very helpful.  The room is pretty basic and very clean.  I was surprised at how quiet the rooms were at night.  The hotel is about 1/2 mile walk to the entrance of Disneyland and the CA Adventure.  The only thing I did not like was the very weak, free wi fi access.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your generous 5-star review! It pleases us to hear that you found your room to be quiet and comfortable as well as a very close proximity to Disneyland. We truly look forward to our next opportunity to exceed your expectations.

Summary Heading: View of Disneyland from our room!
Summary: This hotel was very clean and spacious. We arrived early and were given a room at the top. Our view was Disneyland. The room was big and really clean. We stayed for 3 nights, and Disney is a 5 minute walk. Keep the car at the hotel and walk to Disney. The pool looked nice but we didn't have time to swim.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review, Kim! We're so happy to hear that you found your room to be clean and spacious and that you enjoyed our close proximity to the park. We hope to host you again in the very near future!

Summary Heading: Disneyland is really a five minute walk away
Summary: It really is just a five minute walk to Disneyland.  This allowed us to go back to the hotel and rest up in the middle of the day without having to hassle with shuttles. Staff was awesome, check in\out was a breeze.  Use the valet - doesn't cost you anything extra.  There is a Panera in the same parking lot with a McDonald's and a Mimi's Cafe in front of the hotels on either side.  Great value and would most definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We' re happy to hear you enjoyed our staff and service and hope you'll return again soon for another magical stay.

Summary: My family stayed a couple of nights at this hotel during our road trip vacation. Not only was the room nice and clean, but the staff were super friendly and helpful.... in fact, a whole day after we left this hotel, I realized I had misplaced my iPad. Figuring it was long gone, I went ahead and called the hotel on a hope and prayer. To my surprise they had found my iPad and were holding it hoping I would call. We weren't able to get back to the hotel for another day, but the hotel had no problem holding it for me until we could return. Thank you for a great experience with such a caring, honest staff!
Manager Response: Tracey, we're thrilled to hear you were able to recover your iPad! Thank you for this kind review, we're glad our team provided top notch service and we hope to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary Heading: Access to Disneyland is the key
Summary: No frill, safe and closely located to Disneyland entrance. Family of 5 interconnected rooms, 2 Queen beds in each. Coin laundry available $2 wash $2 dry. Pizza Hut, cafe and store available site was convenient. The hotel is dated but it was clean and serviced very well daily. Macca's and Panera out the front and a range of other food options made feeding the family outside Disneyland easy. We didn't have a car so had no need of the parking but there appeared to be plenty and the staff manning the carpark were diligent with security. Getting early checkin was difficult so don't plan to be in your room before 4pm. In saying that they have a clock room and are happy for you to drop your bags pending your checkin....Disneyland was calling anyways.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this review, Ben. We're happy you enjoyed your stay with us, and we appreciate your feedback as well. We hope to welcome you again on your next visit.

Summary: The hotel is located within an 8 minute walk from the gates of Disneyland and California Adventure which is part of the reason we selected this hotel.  We had a Disney-faced room on the top floor and the view was great.  The location worked out great as we were able to return in the afternoon for the kids to take a nap and could go to the park at our leisure.  The room was clean and appeared to have been a part of the remodel. The beds were comfortable and the room was very quiet.  Water pressure was excellent for being on the top and A/C was also quiet when it turned on and off.  The entrance to the hotel is poorly marked and could only be entered by going northbound on the street (need to make a U-turn if you are coming LA). If have gone past Panera, you have missed the turn.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your generous 5-star review! Thank you for taking the time to review your experience and we look forward to welcoming you back for another seamless stay.

Summary Heading: Blink and you'll miss the entrance
Summary: Fairfield Inn is a no frills but straightforward venue.  The main entrance is very easy to miss; it is sandwiched between the McDonald's and a Panera. (TIP: going north on Harbor, slow down when you see the McDonald's. A small driveway will appear. The property is situated at the end of the driveway)  Unlike most Fairfield locations, there is no complimentary breakfast even though the daily rate is much higher. However, there are a lot of options within walking distance such as McDonald's, Panera, IHOP and Starbucks. Of course, if you are heading over to Disneyland, there's plenty of eateries to chose from although most will be more expensive.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We always love hearing from our guests, both their positive and constructive feedback and this is no exception. We appreciate your input and we hope to provide you with a five-star stay in the future.

Summary: Pros: Hotel is located around 2 blocks from Disney.   This seemed to be a very safe area with lots of families walking within a 4 block radius  Lots of places to eat within walking distance (4 blocks, I'd say) Not many shopping places.  I was told there was a CVS nearby, but it must have been 6+ blocks away, as I never saw it. Nearby Panera & McDonalds were not too busy.  Very ready to serve us. Can see fireworks from many rooms. Walk to Disney easily! Very friendly & helpful staff.  VERY  Cons: Rooms are exterior Pizza Hut on site is pricey, but convenient  Smaller pool than next door hotel  Tips: Market nearby for cheaper drinks & such Ask for top floor room facing Disney for fireworks view If you're wanting a nice pool, go to the Marriott next door.  It has a slide & this
Manager Response: Thank you for your valuable feedback! We always love hearing from our guests. Both positive and constructive feedback is very helpful for us so we can ensure we're providing a wonderful experience from our guests. We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: It was my grandaughters 4th birthday and she wanted to have lunch with Belle.  So here we are back at my favorite place Disneyland.  My daughter chose the hotel as she has stayed on this property before.  I was a little skeptical. Past reviews with pictures of bugs, (TripAdvisor may want to think about removing reviews that are over 3 years old), but to my surprise this hotel was pretty great.  Let's start with location, it is right across the street from Disneyland. I would say the front of the hotel lines up with Tomorrowland. There is a Pizza Hut on site and down from their main entrance is a Panera, and next driveway over there is a McDonalds and two driveways over there is a Mimi's Cafe, can you say "Covenient". The rooms are of average size, we had two queens and the chair
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're delighted to hear that you and your girls had a fun time with us for your Disneyland getaway. We truly appreciate your feedback and we hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: This is a good hotel for families. It's about a ten minute walk to the front gates of Disneyland and surrounded by family friendly restaurants. There's a Panera Bread and McDonald's located very close to the property. The staff are friendly and helpful. Ask to stay on a higher level floor to see the nightly fireworks. Definitely would recommend this hotel for families
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent review! We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our close proximity to the park and that you found our team to be friendly and helpful. We truly look forward to hosting you again in the near future.

Summary: walking distance to Disney! Accomodation was reasonable with a handy cafe and pizza place inside. Very close to other eating places nearby. Good for a short stay with the family to enjoy Disney attractions!
Manager Response: Thank you for this kind review! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us, as well as our great location and your dining experience. We hope we have the opportunity to welcome you back soon.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel 6yrs ago and had such a great experience we thought we would stay here again for a family trip to Disneyland.  This visit was a disappointment starting with one of our two rooms not available until way past 4:30pm. Next was stained sheets on the beds; one bed had what looked like blood stains across the entire top of the sheet and the other bed had similar stains, not as bad but still had stains. We spoke to the front desk and they gave us a credit of $100 and the one bed was changed but not the other one. We did not receive full sets of clean towels, the coffee pot was never cleaned and never had coffee refilled in the basket. One day, after room was cleaned, we found cleaning rags on top of the fridge next to coffee pot. These were brought down to the
Manager Response: Hello, Nadine. We're sorry to hear about your experience. We truly appreciate you taking the time to submit this review. We greatly appreciate your feedback as we are always trying to improve upon the service we provide to our guests. We hope to welcome you back again in the future for a flawless experience.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel when I was a child, 17 years ago to be exact. I remember it being great then and this time it didn't disappoint. Great hotel for all generations, particularly families. It has a pool, games room, mini store and Pizza Hut. The rooms have been recently renovated and well done on the improvements. With my high recommendation, my brother and his family stayed there as well and loved it too.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review and recommendation! We're thrilled to be a part of such happy memories and your family tradition. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Nice room, a very short walk to the Disneyland entrance. Friendly staff. Ricky on Valet was super quick and helpful, even ran to my car to retrieve something my son left inside so we didn't have to go searching for it! All around nice hotel if you're spending a few days at Disney!
Manager Response: Thank you for this fantastic 5-star review, Emily! We're thrilled you enjoyed your stay, and we'll pass these kind words on to Ricky.

Summary: This was a last minute trip for the wife's birthday.  I have the app which is how I booked the room.  Super convenient and the price was reasonable.  I only needed 1 night.  Spend all day at Disneyland go to sleep, wake up, and leave.  I was scared I would be stuck with no room until 4PM (We arrived early).  I did the mobile check in the day prior and showed up 30 minutes before I said I would.  The person at the desk grabbed my keys all ready to go.  The room was ready for my early check-in.  The wife and I even told each other "best case scenario if we get a room."  This made the trip so much better.  I know they won't always be able to accommodate but they did this time.  I went to Disneyland after checking in and dropping my stuff off at the room and then was able to come
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review, we appreciate your kind words and feedback! We're thrilled to see you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit.

Summary: Hotel was great! After reading some reviews I was a little nervous about the hotel. When we got there the hotel was clean and welcoming. Friendly staff that got us into our room four hours earlier than check in. We had a king room for two adults and a toddler. The room was a great size. The TV was gigantic. I liked that the room had hardwood floors. Bed was comfortable. On the firm side which I prefer. The bathroom was good size and I liked the sliding door that gave me the chance to get ready in the morning while my family was still asleep. The location is absolutely perfect! Very short walk to the entrance of Disneyland. Panera bread on site was great, I recommend using their rapid ordering from their app. The only cons of the hotel was the pool size. It was small, but we had
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're thrilled that you were so pleasantly surprised by your experience with us. From our staff to our guest rooms, we're thrilled you enjoyed your stay. We truly hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: We visited the Fairfield Inn last May for our three day Disney adventure. Located directly across the street from Disney within a 3 minute walk the hotel is clean and comfortable. We were welcomed on our arrival and given a room immediately even though we were 4 hours early. We found all staff to be friendly and accomodating. With the added benefit of having a Panera Bread cafe located at its entrance this made for a great option when looking for a healthy meal be it breakfast lunch or dinner. I'd easily recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay in a great proximity to Disneyland.
Manager Response: We appreciate this great review, Steven! Thank you for sharing your wonderful experience in our great location. We're happy you enjoyed your stay and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: Rooms were very clean and newly renovated with a modern design. Layout is motel like with outside hallways but this is fine. Pizza hut / Seattle's Best in building but we never went. We would order breakfast the day before from Panera (just near the hotel entrance) using the Panera app which was super convenient, no wait. Pool is decent - would be nice if it had a slide like the neighboring hotels but I think the price reflects this. They accidentally charged me for 3 days valet parking but cleared it up when I pointed it out - should check your bill. Uber sometimes has a trouble finding it so suggest waiting for an Uber on Harbor Blvd instead of at lobby.
Manager Response: Thank you for this detailed 4-star review! We're glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate you sharing your feedback and tips as well. We're sorry to hear about the error with your parking charge, but we're glad our team was able to correct it quickly. We hope to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary: My Husband & I stayed here for 1 night while visiting Disneyland. We loved everything about this hotel! The front desk staff was welcoming (I felt like I was staying at an actual Disneyland hotel, they were so friendly!) Our room was beautiful and had an awesome view of the parks. The hotel has TONS of dining options nearby. Our favorite part was how close the entrance to Disneyland, Disney's California Adventure, & Downtown Disney were! All were literally about 5 minutes from hotel entrance to Park entrance. We were kicking ourselves that we didn't book a longer stay. Next trip to Disneyland, we will definitely be staying here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for this amazing review, Jenna! We're so happy to know that you had a wonderful time during your stay and we greatly appreciate you sharing this excellent feedback. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: This hotel has so many "amenities" that are around or near the property it makes it possible to over look the age & wear on the rooms themselves.  A short walk to Disneyland and all the adventures & shopping of downtown Disney and California Adventure Park. The hotel offers amazing access to the park at incredibly reasonable nightly rates.  The rooms themselves are nothing special, Very utilitarian. They are clean and housekeeping worked their own brand of Disney magic cleaning up after my crew, making the room look fresh and new every evening when we returned from the park.  I judge a hotel mostly on the criteria "would I stay again?" And the answer is yes!!! With a Panera bread and McDonalds at the entrance to the property, plus a Pizza Inn & cafe on the 3rd floor for easy,
Manager Response: Sammy, thank you very much for such a kind review. We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to take advantage of our great location. Thank you for your recommendation and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future.

Summary: We recently stayed at the Fairfield Inn because the hotel we usually stay at is being renovated. There is free valet parking when you pull up and the lobby staff was very helpful. Check-in was super quick and they even let us check in an hour early at 3pm, and you can park your car in the morning and go into the park which is a MUST for us. The hotel is very close to the entrance, you only have to cross the street once (those lights can take forever!) and the walk takes no more than 5 minutes. There is a Pizza Hut / food court area on the 3rd floor which was convenient to grab some snacks before heading into the park on the second day. Bed was comfortable, room was nice and clean, and I really like the LVT flooring they've installed it looks great. The hotel was a little
Manager Response: Thank you for this great 4-star review! We're very happy you enjoyed your stay, including your room and our hotel amenities, as well as our great location. We hope we have the chance to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Convenient, just please upgrade your pillows
Summary: This is the second time we stay at this hotel. Staff was cordial and knowledgeable. Very convenient location for quick access by foot to the Disney Resort and plenty of restaurants and a couple of pharmacies. Very convenient to have the Pizza Hut Express and Seattle's Best Coffee on the 3rd floor, and the gift shop on the first floor (where you need to go to purchase detergent and softener if you're doing laundry, but quarters need to be obtained at the hotel's front desk). A couple of washers and dryers were available on the same floor of our room. WiFi was fast in both the room and the lobby. Room with two queen beds was spacious and comfortable. There were only two issues we encountered this time: Room was not ready at check-in time (4 PM), and it took them 1 hour for the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience with us. While we're pleased to have hosted you, we're disappointed to hear that you did not experience the kind of 5-star stay that we aim to provide for our wonderful guests. We will certainly forward your comments along to our management team, and hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back for a flawless stay.

Summary: I checked in yesterday. The staff has been super helpful, the rooms are clean and I love the free wifi because my cell reception is minimal at this hotel.  My only complaint is noise. My friend and I couldn't fall asleep because then neighbors were slamming things around. We called the front desk and reported it. The noises stopped but then started again early in the morning. I wish the walls were thicker. We can also hear every little thing that goes on outside.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Friendly Inn staff and an excellent location to Disneyland.
Summary: I stayed at Fairfield Inn in June 2016.  My stay was for five days. I am planning on returning this September 2017.  I was in Anaheim to attend my Brother's 65th Birthday.  My entire family was flying in from all over the country.  I selected this location because it was on the Disneyland related places to stay. Boy, was I happy I selected it.  The employees were friendly from the point I stepped out of the transportation van.  They helped me to check in and to my room. The room, lobby were very clean. Everyone I interacted with during my stay were so kind and attentive.  I was staying at this location by myself since my family was staying elsewhere. I was made to feel safe! The Inn is located at an excellent location with easy access to Disneyland.  There are nearby places to
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We're so thrilled that you loved your stay so much that you're already planning your return. Thank you for all of your generous feedback and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: My favorite on S. Harbor Blvd!
Summary: I stayed here 9 years ago and loved it and loved it even more on my most recent visit! I love the remodeled rooms! I actually like the new non-carpet flooring! No unknown stains, dirt, etc. in the carpet. The bed was super comfy. The shower had great water pressure. My only complaint is that I wish maid service would have left the privacy curtains closed during the day - I don't want passersby peaking into my room. Convenient options for breakfast (Pizza Hut on site) McDonald's and Panera in the parking lot. Quick walk to and from the park. Yep, Fairfield Inn Anaheim Resort - you are my favorite and I will be back. Hopefully it won't be another 9 years!
Manager Response: Thank you for joining us for another visit! It sounds like it was long overdue after 9 years. We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed our refreshed look, comfortable accommodations, and are honored to be your favorite. We look forward to welcoming you again soon!

Summary: The Short: This hotel is all about location. If you have traveled here, you are probably there to visit Disneyland. The location is literally across the street from the main gate. Also about location, it shares a parking lot with Panera, and Mcdonals is next door if hungry. With that said, the hotel itself, checks the boxes of whats needed for a traveler going to Disneyland. Check in smooth and effortless. If you are early, they will check your bags. The rooms are exterior entry. Room itself is average hotel room size and clean. There is a pool and hot tub as well as a gym. A small store connected to the lobby and also an additional snack area on the 3rd floor that has pizza, beer/wine, coffee, and other eats. And lastly there is an arcade.   Check In: We arrived early, prior to
Manager Response: We greatly appreciate your thorough review and feedback, Roman! We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, including or amenities, location and the service our team provided. We certainly hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back on your next visit for a 5-star experience.

Summary Heading: Awful place to use as your honeymoon
Summary: My wife and I booked this hotel for our honeymoon because of the short walk to Disneyland. First off, we booked it several weeks in advanced. We booked 1 king bed. When we arrived, they said that the room we reserved was no longer available and they had a room with two queens...are you guys kidding? It was our honeymoon and we had to get a room with two queens. Whatever it was late and we were tired from the traveling. They apologized and offered us one free night of parking. (Which is $20 a NIGHT).  The room they gave us was literally right next to the elevator so all we heard was that motor running.   We called the front desk and they apologized again and gave us a new room. The new room they gave us seemed okay, so we got settled in. We turned the ac on and started to get
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience with us. While we're pleased to have hosted you, we're disappointed to hear that your room and overall experience did not meet your expectations. Please know that we truly value your feedback and have passed your comments along to our management team to look into further. We hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back for the flawless 5-star experience that you deserve.

Summary: This hotel is across the street east of Disneyland, within easy walking distance with parking included through a Get-Away-Today package. Staff was beyond helpful and friendly. Room was family friendly (not plush but clean). Beds were comfortable. Pool and hot tub were nice and at good temperatures. When I had trouble with my 3rd party reservation company, the hotel responded with help and a friendly "no problem" attitude.  Not a lot of parking spaces, but I always found a place. Would definitely recommend this hotel for families vacationing at Disneyland.
Manager Response: We truly appreciate your generous review, Robert! We're delighted to hear that our team was helpful and friendly and that you found your room to be comfortable and clean. We hope to welcome you back for another seamless visit in the very near future.

Summary: Check in not very pleasant as was told would text if ready before 4:00 but got to hotel at 3:40 and just got keys and wasn't told anything, like check out time, pool hours, where the fitness room was. Would of been nice to have microwave in room. It is pretty much across the street from Disneyland though which is very nice. The wifi service was not good at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your experience. While we're pleased to have hosted you, we're disappointed to hear that you did not have the seamless check in that we aim to provide for our wonderful guests. We truly hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back for the flawless stay that you deserve.

Summary: I read a lot of mixed reviews before staying here and was a bit apprehensive, but the price was pretty stellar so I went for it.  I definitely made the right decision.  First off, the location cannot be beat.  Ok, it can be beat, but only by about 3 hotels :).  It is well under a 10 minute walk to the Disney parks.  There is a Panera in the parking lot and a Pizza Hut Express (and video arcade) on the 3rd floor of the hotel.  They serve breakfast there as well if you do not want to do breakfast in the park or go to Panera or McD's.  The opposite way of the park 1 block is a Mimi's Cafe.  They have pretty good food here as well.  The hotel also has coin laundry if you are there for an extended time.  We were also impressed with the room for the price as well.  The rooms are all
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this wonderful review, Brent! We truly appreciate all of your detailed feedback. We are absolutely thrilled you enjoyed your stay with us, our location and the service our staff provided. Thank you for your recommendation, and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Decent room recently remodeled. It was very clean and decor was modern. Our room had a small fridge and an in room safe, coffee maker, hair dryer all the standard things you would expect. The carpet has been replaced with a fake wood vinyl which I usually do not like but it is better than having nasty carpet with mystery stains, and is better for people with allergies. Staff was friendly. I would stay here again. Very short walk to Disney. Pool is small. There is a small food court where you can purchase breakfast biscuits and pastries or pizza later in the day. There is also a Panera in the parking lot which is better for coffee and breakfast foods. I would say good for families.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us. We're glad you enjoyed our cozy accommodations, friendly staff and prime location. We appreciate your feedback about our flooring and on-site dining offerings and hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: I have stayed at this location once before and plan on doing so again this year.  The staff is very accommodating and pleasant to work with. I called ahead of time to make a few requests and every one was granted.  I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate your kind words and recommendation, Patricia. Thank you for taking the time to share your review and we hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: Brandon at the front desk. The rooms clean. Restaurants the free breakfast was a total full one. The pool and fitness center was a nice touch. People was friendly and helpful with directions and nature sights
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us, Kathy. We're glad you enjoyed our property's features and friendly staff and hope to welcome you again soon!

Summary Heading: We enjoyed our family vacation on this hotel!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for our 5 day Disneyland Vacation because of its location. Its within a 10 minute walk to the gates of Disneyland & California Adventure Land.  The only thing I wasn't very happy with was the walk with all our luggage & small children from the airport Disneyland Shuttle bus stops.  It would have been much nicer to be dropped at the entrance to the hotel.   Check in and Check out were very smooth. Staff is very nice, friendly & accomadating. The hotel has a small pool that the Grandchildren enjoyed with their parents.  A great way to cool down after a hot day in the Parks.   The rooms were excellent.  We arrived early and they were able to find adjoining rooms for us.  The housekeepers were excellent.  The beds were comfortable.  We found this hotel very
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your wonderful review, Betty. We're so glad we could welcome you and your family for a Disneyland adventure! From our friendly staff to our cozy accommodations, our on-site dining to our pool, it sounds like you enjoyed a fantastic stay. We hope to welcome you again soon!

Summary Heading: Sponsor for a group of high school students
Summary: I recently stayed here for three nights in April. I was sponsoring a large group of students on their class trip. We chose the Fairfield for its location. I felt safe in the resort and area.   Location: There is a McDonald's and Panera right in front of the hotel. It is also walking distance (across the street) from Disneyland and California Adventure.   Parking: Valet parking was $18/night/vehicle.   Extras: There is a Pizza Hut and Coffee Shop located on the third floor, as well as a video game area.   Pool: The pool was heated and had a hot tub. It appeared large enough for several families as well as our group.  Staff: The staff was very accommodating and helpful.   Room: The rooms were nice, but more of a motel style. They included your basic toiletries such as shampoo,
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughtful review with us. We're happy to hear our property was able to provide comfortable accommodations and amenities for your group to be able to enjoy the visit and hope to welcome you again soon!

Summary Heading: Recently remodeled - Tile floors in room make the room feel like a cheap motel
Summary: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn Anaheim in early May.  I was early for checkin and my room was not ready.  I had reserved a high floor room but because I was early it was not ready.  The lady was very helpful and was able to locate me a room that was very close to the one I reserved.  I was also supposed to get a Disney USB charger with my rate but the lady was very friendly and because we were talking we both forgot about it.  Im sure if I had gone back and asked she would have given it to me.  I never asked or received it.  Parking is by Valet only and is 20.00 for the first car and 30.00 foir the second.  There is no free breakfast like at all other Fairfield Inn hotels.  The location of this hotel is perfect for visiting Disneyland.  It was 4/10 of a mile from the door of my
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this 5-star review! We're thrilled you enjoyed our great location as well as the service our staff provided. We appreciate your feedback about our renovations as well and will share this with our team. We hope to welcome you back in the future for a flawless experience!

Summary: This isn't the nicest hotel you'll ever stay at.  But it is very close to Disneyland, which is why people stay here.  We reserved a room with two queens and got a room with a king and a sofa bed.  If you weigh more than a child, the sofa bed would not be comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this review. We're happy to hear you enjoyed our great location, and we truly appreciate your feedback. We hope we have the chance to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: This hotel is a Disney Good Neighbor Hotel.  A short walk to the front gate to Disney from the hotel, definitely book this hotel if it a little bit cheaper than the others nearby.  Most of the hotel is renovated and looks great.  We had a renovated room and it was very nice.  The staff was very nice and eager to help with anything.  Luggage room if you need to use it.  No food included but there is a Panera and McDonald's in the parking lot if you need to eat outside of Disney property.  The pool looked nice, we didn't want to swim.  Food is available in the hotel, but we chose to eat elsewhere.  Stayed 2 nights and had a very comfortable, clean stay.  I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Thanks for this wonderful review! We're happy you enjoyed your stay in our great location as well as our newly renovated rooms and the service our staff provided. We're excited to welcome you back on your next visit!

Summary Heading: Always a Problem of Some Sorts Here
Summary: This was our second visit to the Fairfield Inn, and our second round of problems. First, the location of this hotel in relationship to Disneyland is great. You basically just walk across Harbor Blvd. and you are on Disney property. It's about a 7-10 minute walk to the ticket booths. But here is the latest problem...they have installed in the bathroom a light sensor. They claim if there is no motion for 30 minutes, the light goes off. They are wrong... it's about ten minutes. I was in the shower and the lights went out. It was pitch black in the bathroom. I almost fell getting out of the shower to open the door and let some light in. They may be saving ten cents on electricity, but they will have a big lawsuit soon if someone falls. A young child showering would be terrified if
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your honest review with us. While we're glad you love our location, we're sorry to hear that you didn't love our bathroom lights. We appreciate your valuable input and will be sure to share it with our team. We hope to welcome you back for a third stay so we can provide you with a five-star stay.

Summary: We where here with our grand-kids. We stayed 6 nights. The hotel was under renovations, but that was on the top floors at the time so that was no problem. If you want to have a rest in the middle of the day make sure you don't have a room on  floors above or below the rooms being renovated to much noise.  We wanted an adjoining room and they gave us two adjoining rooms by the pool on the first floor. You just stepped out of the room and the pool was there. It was great coming back from a day at Disney and jumping in the pool. The rooms where just remodeled and they are very nice. If you have a car they charge 18,00 per day for parking. Mind you we booked through WestJet and only had to pay 5.00 per day for parking. The staff where very friendly and helpful. It was a very short
Manager Response: Thank you for joining us for a fun family getaway! We're so glad that you loved our pool, guest rooms and staff. It's always great to hear when families love our hotel for Disneyland getaways. We hope to see you all again soon!

Summary Heading: Great location and fitted the bill.
Summary: This hotel is almost at Disney's front door and that is why it was chosen for a 3 day visit with the grandkids. Check in and out were speedy and accurate, you can ask no more, and any questions or requests we had were answered or responded to politely and efficiently. The room was functional and the bed very good, we were out from 9 a.m. Until 9 p.m. each day so it fitted the bill for us although the aircon was noisy.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us for your Anaheim getaway! It's wonderful to hear that you enjoyed an excellent stay, from our location to our helpful staff. We appreciate all of your valuable feedback and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star stay in the future.

Summary: We decided to stay at this hotel because of the proximity to Disneyland.  We walked everyday to the park and back and I would say from the front gates it's approximately 5-7 minutes.  That was the Main reason why we chose this hotel.   I initially reserved this room with get away today and had requested a room with a view of the park, But by the time we got there, 45 minutes after the hotel check in time, they only had a view of the "mountains"... well that was at least the glamorous definition we got of the view when checking in with the front desk.  Really you get to look down into buildings and parking lots, and the freeway.  Oh wait,  in the far off distance there are some mountains.  But c'mon let's call it what it is, the backside of the hotel, no view. The front desk area
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit this 4-star review. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate your recommendation. We appreciate your feedback regarding the views, dining hours and pricing as well. We look forward to welcoming you on your next visit!

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel in 89, 95, 99, 05, 09, and again this week.   I've continued custom to this place for many reasons, all pointed out in my previous review.  It's always been GOOD.   This time, however, very disappointing stay.   This review has not been influenced by the current noisy renovations, nor for the fact the water was turned off.  These things are unavoidable.   This time round, my husband and I were on our belated Honeymoon (ten year anniversary) and we found ourselves all the way round the back facing a huge quarry/sand pit with a very noisy freeway.
